loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old and lives in the municipality of San Pelayo. He has 6 children, 4 girls and 2 boys and he loves his big family and feels very proud of each and every one of them. Raising them hasn’t been easy but he fights hard so he can give them a good life. This boosted him to start his own business; he’s going to raise pigs.

He’s ready to work hard so he can obtain good profits from his business about to start, because he expects that it can last in time having which with he can support his family. He’s asking for a loan so he can start his business and build a pigsty and buy feed for sustaining his pigs.

Jose’s biggest dream is make his family happy, let his children grow up in an excellent environment and as good people. He also expects he can improve his house so they live better. You can be part of this beautiful story about to begin, a loan will help him a lot.

loans.use: start his business and build a pigsty and for sustaining his pigs

loans.name: Pedro Claver

texts.en:
Pedro is a 48 year-old-married man who lives in the municipality of El Carmen de VIboral. He has a daughter who he loves very much; they are a beautiful and united family. Some years ago he decided to start his own business; he owns since 2009 a growing of flowers, a really traditional thing in Colombia.

His father was the one who taught him how to do the job so he would grow beautiful flowers. Now he wants to take further his business so he’s going to invest in it to make his growing bigger. He asked for a loan so he can prepare the land to grow hydrangeas and to buy fertilizers and irrigation. 

Pedro dreams with her daughter being a professional, so he hopes his business let him pay for an excellent education for his daughter so she become a professional. You can help Pedro to achieve all his goals, support him with the loan he needs.

loans.use: prepare the land to grow hydrangeas and to buy fertilizers and irrigation

loans.name: Edulfo

texts.en:
Edulfo is 69 years old and lives in the municipality of Lorica. He has 3 beautiful daughters whom he loves very much. His family is the most important thing for him and the main reason of his hard work. Some years he inherited a raising bird business from his family, a business that has been in the family for many years and now he’s the responsible of it.

There’s a lot of competition in his location, and the weather doesn’t help much either. But the problems he assumes them like a challenge to achieve. He wants to be more competitive and make his business last even more. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy materials to build a barn like cement, also to buy food and expand his business by buying pigs and food for them. 

Edulfo wants to keep his family tradition by leaving the business to his children, but not before he improves it and makes it successful. Help him accomplish this dream and more by giving him the support he needs, loan now.

loans.use: buy materials to build a barn like cement, also to buy food and expand his business by buying pigs and food for them

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Sophal’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng City in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, rolling material, paint color, paint brush and plastic bags,

loans.name: Mwakame

texts.en:
Mwakame is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with two kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rehema has operated a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her motorcycle transport and general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Daisy dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona  works hard to support her family. Chona  is married and has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines.

Chona  requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of dry goods like blankets, pants, towels, blouses, etc. to sell.

Chona  has been in this business for 21 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Chona  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods like blankets, pants, towels, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Visminda

texts.en:
Visminda is 50 years old, married and has five children, two who are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Visminda requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Visminda has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Visminda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 51 years old, married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Clarita has borrowed and paid 1 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 50 years old, married with eight children. Three of her children are enrolled in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosemarie has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her manicure/pedicure business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her manicure/pedicure business.

loans.name: Mwakuzimu

texts.en:
Mwakuzimu  is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly has electricity. 

For one year now  she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of competition in her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers.

loans.name: 6 De Abril 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE ABRIL 2” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Norma es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de  materiales escolares, servicio de transporte, venta de ropa, venta de CD's, venta de chompas de lana, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Norma es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución, que se realizó en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó hace varios años, aprendiendo la comercialización de estos productos de su mamá, es por esta razón que con el pasar del tiempo y con el ahorro de un capital decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Bolivia – Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución y las reuniones de pago.
texts.en:
The "6 de abril 2" communal bank will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer´s German Busch office. The bank has eight members, and is run by a board of directors that has Norma as its secretary. The members have different businesses, including: selling school supplies, providing transport services, selling CDs, selling clothes, woolen sweaters, and making and selling meals.

This loan will benefit small-time entrepreneurs in Norma's group. Norma herself says that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago, following an invitation during a promotional campaign that Pro Mujer ran. Norma currently has a business selling clothes. She says that she started the business a number of years ago, having learned to trade these goods from her mother. After working with her mother for some time, and after saving up money, Norma decided to start her own business.

This loan will be used to increase assets by buying clothes in bulk from wholesales at the border between Bolivia and Peru. Norma will then sell these goods at the markets in the city of El Alto. This work allows Norma to earn the income to support her family financially. Norma has a partner and five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Norma says she likes the training offered by the organisation, and the payment meetings.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 60 años de edad, quien vive de manera humilde junto a su compañera de vida y junto a sus dos hijos, una niña de 11 años y un niño de 14 años de edad, tiene 48 años de residir en vivienda propia. Él es una persona muy humilde, responsable y trabajador quien se desempeña como albañil independiente, labor que realiza desde hace 15 años y con lo cual mantiene la economía del hogar. Así también en busca de obtener otro medio por el cual tener más ingresos económicos para el hogar, se ha dedicado a la crianza y venta de pollos, actividad que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logra llevar, negocio en el cual lo apoya su compañera de vida. De esta manera mantiene la economía del hogar y así de esta forma busca satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia y poco a poco ir tratando de mejorar su calidad de vida. Pero para mantener este negocio Antonio no cuenta con la liquidez económica y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: concentrado, vitaminas y también más pollos para aumentar las ventas y así las ganancias. De esta forma seguir luchando por mejorar su vida.
texts.en: Antonio is 60 years old and lives modestly with his wife and his two children, a daughter who is 11 and a son who is 14. He has lived in his own home for 48 years. He is very modest, responsible and hard working and he woks as an independent builder. He has been doing this for 15 years and with this he sustains the household economy. Furthermore, in the search to gain another way to earn more for the family, he works breeding and selling chickens. It takes a lot of effort and dedication to carry out. His wife also supports him in this. In this way he sustains his family economy and he tries to meet the basic needs of his family and little by little he tries to improve their quality of life. However, to maintain this business, Antonio does not have the necessary funds and this is why he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to by concentrated feed, vitamins and also more chickens to increase sales and thus earnings. In this way he will continue fighting to improve his life.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, vitamins and also more children to increase sales and thus earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions, pumpkins and carrots.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio Victor se dedica al negocio de venta de maiz,el socio vende en diferentes mercados, el socio por medio de este negocio le gustaría abrir una tienda de abarrotes, el es una personas muy emprendedora y quiere salir adelante. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar maíz.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Victor, earns a living selling corn. He sells in different markets and through this he would like to open a grocery store. He is a very entrepreneurial person and wants to get ahead in life. He is asking for a loan to buy corn.


He is grateful for this loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Nuevo Dia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO DIA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Toribia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de accesorios de autopartes, venta de mantas,  venta de ropa deportiva, venta de calzados deportivos, venta de verduras, venta de juguetes, veta de tarjetas para llamadas.  

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Toribia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra  Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa deportiva; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su suegra hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa deportiva por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tienes dos hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trato a las clientas y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank "NUEVO DIA" is starting its first Pro Mujer loan cycle through the German Busch Social Center.  The group comprises eight members and its management board is presided over by Toribia.  The members are involved in different business activities including: sale of auto parts, blankets, sport clothing, sport shoes, vegetables, toys and phone cards.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners, including Toribia.  She says this is her first experience with Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation through a representative of the institution.  Her current business is selling sport clothing, a trade she learned from her mother-in-law several years ago.
 
The loan she is requesting will increase her capital to buy wholesale sport clothing from wholesale dealers in the city of La Paz.  Then she will sell the merchandise at her stall.  Through her work she is able to support her family economically.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says she likes how the customers are treated and the health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy wholesale sport clothing.

loans.name: Adonay Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ADONAY” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Catalina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pan, venta de polleras, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, fabricación y venta de zapatos, venta de muebles, servicio de fotocopiadora.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Catalina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración  y venta de zapatos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de su esposo; en la actualidad este negocio es administrado por la señora y por su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en los puestos de venta de zapatos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución y el compartir con sus compañeras en las reuniones de pago.
texts.en:
The community bank "ADONAY" is starting its first Pro Mujer loan cycle through the Villa Tejada Social Center.  The group comprises eight members and its management board is led by Catalina, the president.  The business activities of the members are varied and include: sale of bread, typical clothing, food, a grocery store, manufacture and sale of shoes, furniture sales and photocopy services.

The loan will benefit small business owners, including Catalina.  She says this is her first experience with Pro Mujer, having joined by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution.  Catalina's current business is making and selling shoes.  She learned the business from her husband several years ago.  They work together to run the business.

The loan will be used to increase capital to buy wholesale leather from dealers in the city of La Paz.  After the shoes are manufactured they will be sold through the sales point.  This type of work allows Catalina to support her family economically.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says it is the health area offered by the institution and sharing time with her colleagues at the payment meetings.

loans.use: To buy wholesale leather.

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es: Deyanira es una joven aventurera, que le gustan los retos y emprender nuevos horizontes, de este modo inició su actividad comercial, cuando viajó a la Guajira un municipio con incidencia de una tribu indígena de los pueblos arawak, llamados los Wayuu, que está dedicado especialmente al pastoreo y a las artesanías en las que  encontró su oportunidad de negocio y compró un número significativo de mochilas que trajo a Malambo el municipio donde reside y ofreció a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos obteniendo una gran acogida. Tiempo después amplió su oferta de productos e inició con bolsos y una nueva línea de productos para el cuidado de la salud y la nutrición. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en productos para la nutrición y la salud, así como un nuevo surtido de bolsos. Con esta inversión considera que podrá mejorar las ventas y con ello su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Deyanira is a young adventurer who likes challenges and to take on new horizons and so she started her commercial activity when she travelled to la Guajira, a municipality with influence from an indigenous tribe from the arawak people called Wayuu. They are specifically dedicated to shepherding and to artisan crafts. This is where she saw her business opportunity and she bought a number of bags and took them to Malambo, the municipality where she lives and she sold them to friends, relatives and neighbours where they were very popular. Some time after, she extended her offer of products and started with bags and a new line of healthcare and nutrition products.  She is currently asking for a Kiva loan, her first fund with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she will use to buy nutrition and health products as well as a new stock of bags. With this investment she thinks she will be able to increase her sales and with this, her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy nutrition and health products and a new stock of bags.

loans.name: El Jardin De Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDIN DE LAS ROSAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, servicio de construcción, venta de comida, venta de pescado, tienda de barrio, venta de mantas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando con su mamá, y hace once años que la señora decidió emprender su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank "JARDIN DE LAS ROSAS" is starting its fourth Pro Mujer loan cycle through the Collpani Social Center.  The group comprises eight members and the management board is led by Ana, the president.  The business activities the members are involved in include meat sales, construction services, sale of food, fish, blankets and a neighborhood store.

The loan will benefit small business owners including Ana.  She says this is her first experience with Pro Mujer which she joined by invitation through a friend who is a client of the institution.  Her current business is making and selling blankets, a trade she learned while working with her mother.  She decided to start her own business eleven years ago.

The loan will be used to increase working capital to buy fabric wholesale from the dealers in the city of El Alto.  Then she will make the blankets and sell them through her sales point.  Through her work she is able to support her family economically.  She is a widow with four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Ana says it is the training and health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un microempresario de 39 años residente en Barranquilla, un municipio del Atlántico en donde se consolida la gran mayoría de su clientela a la que oferta una variada gama de medicinas naturales, vitaminas y complementos para la nutrición.  Su idea de negoció surgió, luego de haber trabajado en una distribuidora, y como su sueño era ser empresario independiente, con sus propio capital inició su negocio en el que hoy día expende medicamentos en diferentes barrios de la ciudad, y su canal de distribución es directamente en las viviendas que integran el sector.  Así mismo contrató dos vendedores para poder abastecer la demanda en poblaciones circunvecinas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en medicinas y poder ampliar su capacidad de compra.  Juan es un padre de familia que vela por el bienestar de su cónyuge e hijos y desea a largo plazo poseer un local y establecer un punto de ventas que le permita tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan, 39, is a small business owner who lives in Barranquilla, a municipality of Atlántico where most of his customers are located.  He sells a wide variety of natural medicines, vitamins and food supplements.  His idea to start a business came from having worked for a distributor.  His dream was to become an independent entrepreneur.  With his own capital he started the business and now sells medicines in different neighborhoods of the city, on a door-to-door basis.  He has hired two salespeople to meet the demand in neighboring villages.

He is currently applying for his first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in order to buy medicine and expand his purchasing power.  

Juan is a father who looks out for his wife and children.  In the long term he wants to open a shop and establish sales points to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy medicines.

loans.name: Ayda Elvira

texts.es: Ayda es una microempresaria de 58 años de edad que heredó de su familia la tradición del comercio, ella lleva en esta actividad 16 años en la que a través de catálogos promueve ventas a sus conocidos, amigos y vecinos, alternando sus labores en el hogar, puesto que es madre de una hija mayor de edad y reside con su cónyuge en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad.  Ella es muy dedicada con su labor, de lunes a viernes a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m., distribuye su catálogo en el que exhibe una gran variedad de calzado para dama, caballeros y niños, y realiza sus pedidos una vez sus clientela le indica la refencia y tallas. Ayda no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la demanda que se aproxima por la temporada de fin de año y por ello aplicó a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en nuevas colecciones de calzado para dinamizar sus ventas. Su meta a futuro es abrir un almacén con un buen surtido de calzado.
texts.en: Ayda is a small business woman who is 58 years old. She inherited the business tradition from her family. She has been doing this for 16 years. Through catalogues she promotes sales to people she knows, to friends, and to neighbours, alternating with her work with her home. She has one grown up daughter who lives with her husband in a neighbourhood in Soledad. She is very dedicated to her work, from Monday to Friday from 9am to 7pm she distributes the catalogue in which a large variety of shoes for women, men and children are shown. She places orders after her customers tell her the reference and size. Ayda does not have the sufficient funds for the demand that she expects for the end-of-year period and so she applied for a Kiva loan, her first fund with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she will invest in new shoe collections to invigorate her sales. Her future aim is to open a warehouse with a good supply of shoes.

loans.use: to buy new shoe collections.

loans.name: Nueva Asuncion Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artículos varios, venta de pan, venta de útiles escolares, venta de mantas, venta de polleras, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artículos varios; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace más de quince años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de jaboncillo y crema acondicionador por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tienes dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank "NUEVA ASUNCION" is starting its ninth Pro Mujer loan cycle through the Alto Lima Social Center.  The group comprises ten members and its management board is led by Sonia, the president.  The members are involved in different businesses, including sales of varied merchandise, bread, school materials, blankets, typical clothing and food.

The loan will benefit small business owners including Sonia.  She says she has been involved in Pro Mujer for four years and joined by invitation through a massive promotion conducted by the institution in her area.  Her current business is selling a variety of merchandise.  She learned the trade 15 years ago.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her capital to buy soap and cream conditioner wholesale from dealers in the city of La Paz.  She will sell it through her sales spot.  Through her work she is able to support her family economically.  She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the savings offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy soap and cream conditioner wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Ivonne Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de gas propano desde hace 7 años tiene muchos clientes pues es un prodcuto muy vendible, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas gas propano por mayoreo para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Ana is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and child. For 7 years she has earned a living selling propane gas. She has many customers as the product is very sell-able. Her business is located in her home and with the earnings that she gets she manages to pay for some household costs. She is asking for a loan to buy more propane gas in bulk to be able to continue with her sales and thus to be able to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more propane gas in bulk.

loans.name: María Pilar

texts.es:
María, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja de albañil, juntos tienen tres hijos, pero solo uno asiste a la escuela.

María, es empleada en una ferretería desde hace 11 años, después de salir de estudiar busco trabajo debido a la 
necesidad que tenia y su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.
 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una refrigeradora, porque quiere vender sorbetes para generar más ingresos, de esa manera lograra tener una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de María, es siempre darles buenas condiciones de vida a sus hijos y mantener siempre su trabajo.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old. She studied up to her baccalaureate. She is married and her husband works as a construction worker. Together they have three children but only one goes to school.


María has worked as an employee in a hardware store for 11 years. After leaving her studies she looked for work due to the need she had. She works from 7am to 5pm.


She needs the loan to buy a refrigerator as she wants to sell sorbets to create more income, in this way she will manage to have a better quality of life.


María's dream is to always give her children good living conditions and to always keep working.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator because she wants to sell sorbets to create more income.

loans.name: Martires

texts.es:
Mártires, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, actualmente está acompañado, vive con su pareja y sus tres  hijos, todos menores de edad; su pareja se dedica a oficios domésticos, mientras que él trabaja en labores agrícolas.

Mártires, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos como maíz y frijol, estas actividades las realiza desde hace muchos años, el cual aprendió de su padre; sus cultivos los realiza a una distancia corta del lugar de su vivienda, por esa razón tiene que caminar mucho tiempo para llegar hasta su lugar de trabajo.-

El presente crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, pago de jornales y preparación de terreno para dicho cultivo, con el cual espera tener una buena cosecha este año.

Mártires, sueña con dar a sus hijos una buena educación y una vivienda digna, cómoda y segura para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mártires is 31 years old and went to school until fifth grade. At the moment he is in a relationship and lives together with his spouse and their three children. They are all minors. His spouse takes care of the household while he is working in agriculture.

Mártires is earning a living growing basic grains like corn and beans. He has been doing this trade for many years and learned it from his father. He is growing his crop a short distance from his home. This is why he has to walk a long time to get to his work place.

He needs the current loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers and manure, to pay for day laborers and preparing said land, that he is cultivating. With this he is expecting a great crop this year.

Mártires dreams of giving his children a good education and his whole family a decent, comfortable and secure home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers and manure, to pay for day laborers and preparing the land he cultivates

loans.name: Sthefany Liseth

texts.es: Sthefany es una joven de 23 años que estuvo empleada por el instituto de bienestar familiar en el programa de madres lactantes, de esta experiencia de vida su gusto por el cuidado de menores de primera infancia marcó su vida y decidió abrir un jardín infantil en el año 2012. Ella reside en un barrio del municipio de Bogotá y en el garaje de su vivienda adecuó el jardín infantil en donde ofrece cuidado, protección y educación a esto pequeños infantes. Sthefany desea que los niños cuenten con unas mejores condiciones locativas y por ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para realizar adecuaciones a la cocina y baños del jardín, así como pintura y resane de paredes.  Con inversión podrá cumplir con los estándares reglamentados por el instituto de bienestar familiar y los niños estarán en mejores condiciones.  Su sueño de prosperidad es tener un colegio y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sthefany is a young woman of 23 years, who was employed by the institute of family well-being in the program of nursing mothers. From this experience her life was marked with the pleasure of caring for infants and she decided to open a kindergarten in the year of 2012.

She lives in a neighborhood of the municipality of Bogotá and built the kindergarten into the garage of her home. This is where she offers care, protection and education for the little infants.

Sthefany wants to offer the children a better location. This is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva. It is her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to improve the kitchen and bathroom of her kindergarten, as well as to paint and repair the walls.

With this investment she will be able to comply with the regulation standards of the institute of family well-being and the children will be in better conditions.

Her goal of success is to have a school and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the kitchen and bathroom of her kindergarten, as well as to paint and repair the walls.

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: Ana de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica desde hace 13 años a la venta y elaboración de quesadillas y pan de maíz, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, pero también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la comprar de mas maíz, harina, azúcar, leche, moldes, etc. para continuar con su trabajo ya que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old and lives in her own house together with her husband and her daughter.

She has been earning a living for 13 years by selling and making quesadillas [cheese tortillas] and corn bread. Her business is located in her house, but she also sells as a street vendor in different neighborhoods. She is getting ahead with what she makes from her sales.

Once more, she is requesting a loan to buy more corn, flour, sugar, milk, baking dishes, and so on to continue her work because she is making a good income.
.

loans.use: to buy more corn, flour, sugar, milk, baking dishes, and so on.

loans.name: Santos Eusebia

texts.es:
Santos, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus padres y dos hijos que tiene.

Santos, tiene seis años de dedicarse al negocio de venta de pupusas, papas fritas, yuca, entre otros, estos productos los vende en el cafetin que tiene en la escuela, desde muy joven se ha dedicado a vender, pues de esa forma suplió las necesidades de sus hijos por mucho tiempo.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes y abono para que su padre trabaje la tierra y para comprar más mercadería para el negocio, ya que solo así mejorara su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Santos, es mejorar su calidad de vida y que sus hijos crezcan en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is 50 years old and went to school through the second grade. She is a single mother who lives with her parents and her two children.

Santos has been making a living for seven years selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas), french fries, cassava, and other things in the small cafe that she has in the school. She has been a saleswoman since she was very young and has provided for her children in this way for a long time.

She needs this loan to buy fertilizer and manure to help her father work the land and to buy more supplies for her business. Her dream is to improve her family's quality of life and for her children to grow up with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to help her father work the land and to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS TEJEDORAS II” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Milenka es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, venta de aceite para movilidades, venta de abarrotes, venta de frazadas, venta de dulces, venta de detergentes, venta de ropa deportiva.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Milenka es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su mamá que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces; da a conocer que este negocio lo implementó hace varios años, lo aprendió de su mamá y con el ahorro de un capital decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Tejedoras II" [The Weavers II] will start the third loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the "Centro Focal de Santiago II" [Santiago II Focal Center]. It consists of nine members and is headed by a board where Milenka is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them, there are sweaters sales, oil sales for vehicles, groceries sales, blankets sales, sweets sales, detergents sales, and sportswear sales.

The loan taken out will benefit small female microentrepreneurs where Milenka is a member. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years now, entering by an invitation from her mom who is a customer of the institution. Today, she has a business selling sweets. She makes known that she started this business several years ago. She learned it from her mom and with a saved capital decided to implement her business independently.
 
The current loan that she will take out will be for capital increase, to buy candy wholesale which she will get from the women wholesalers from the city of El Alto and subsequently will sell in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially since she is single.

When it is asked to her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the trainings and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy sweets wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es: Jose de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de pilones de cafe y granos basicos desde hace 15 años, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitado un credito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para poder continuar con sus cultivos y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Jose, 38 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He has worked growing coffee seedlings and basic grains for 15 years. He sells his products in the neighboring towns and has established customers. With the earnings that he gets, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase manure and fertilizers, and to pay labor costs to be able to continue with his crops and have better income.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Kevin Walberto

texts.es: Kevin de 23 años de edad que habita en vivienda familiar en compañía de sus padres y hermana. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica a la venta de productos varios tales como sodas, jugos, galletas, etc., ya que posee un puesto en el mercado, es así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha salido adelante y con los que apoyo a su familia. Kevin desea invertir en la compra de más variedad de productos para surtir su negocio y así poder generar más ingresos económicos, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: carne, embutidos, jugos, refrescos, adquirir equipo para elaboración de licuados, para mejorar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes y así poder generar más ingresos económicos
texts.en: Kevin, 23 years old, lives in the family house with his parents and sister. He is a very hard-working man who works selling a variety of products such as sodas, juices, cookies, etc., since he has a stall in the market. This is how he generates the income with which he has gotten ahead and supported his family. Kevin wants to invest in the purchase of a greater variety of products to stock his business and, so, to be able to generate more income. For this, he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in meat, cold cuts, juices, soft drinks, and to get equipment to make smoothies to improve the products he offers his customers and, so, to be able to generate more income.

loans.use: to invest in meat, cold cuts, juices, soft drinks, and to get equipment to make smoothies to improve his offerings.

loans.name: Lilian Concepcion

texts.es: Lilian es una mujer trabajadora de 29 años de edad que se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa cercana lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Lilian habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre, por lo que se siente feliz de poder apoyarla en su vejez. Lilian desea construir un muro de contención, ya que su terreno colinda con una calle que se encuentra niveles abajo, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un muro de retención que brinda mayor protección a su terreno y a su madre sobre todo en estas épocas de lluvia.
texts.en: Lilian is a hard-working woman, 29 years old, who works at a nearby business which allows her to get her family ahead. Lilian lives in a house she owns with her mother, and she is happy to be able to support her in her old age. Lilian wants to build a retaining wall since her land abuts a street which is some levels below. So, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and rebar to build a retaining wall to offer better protection to her land and her mother, above all in the rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, and rebar to build a retaining wall to offer better protection to her land and her mother.

loans.name: Maria Doris

texts.es:
María, de 48 años de edad, no estudio, ella no sabe leer ni escribir, actualmente está casada; su esposo se dedica a trabajar como vigilante en una iglesia evangélica, la cual está ubicada cerca de la casa donde viven; tienen 1 hijo en común el cual vive junto a su compañera de vida en otra vivienda y depende de si mismo para mantener su propio hogar.

María, se dedica a elaborar y a vender tortillas en el cantón donde vive, esta actividad la realiza desde hace muchos años, el cual aprendió de su madre, dicha venta se realiza principalmente durante la mañana, ella se levanta muy temprano, prepara el maíz, lo cocé, lo lleva al molino y luego elabora las tortillas que finalmente logra vender a personas que residen en su cantón.- El horario de trabajo de ella es de 06:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 m.d.

Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales para su tortilleria como maíz, gas y leña para la cocina, los cuales servirán para lograr vender más.

María, sueña con tener una vivienda digna, cómoda y segura para su familia, además de poder ver crecer a uno de sus nietos y poder brindarle todo el apoyo que necesite.
texts.en:
María, 48 years old, did not go to school, she does not know how to read and write. She is married and her husband works as a security guard at an evangelical church, which is located near the house where they live. They have one child in common who lives with his life partner in another house and depends on himself to maintain his own home.

María works making and selling tortillas in the canton where she lives. She has done this work for many years, which she learned from her mother. She makes these sales primarily in the morning. She gets up very early, prepares the corn, cooks it, and brings it to the mill and then makes the tortillas which she finally manages to sell to people who live in her canton. Her work schedule is from 6:00 am to 12:00 noon.

She is asking for a loan to purchase materials for her tortilla-making business such as corn, gas, and firewood for cooking, which will serve her to be able to sell more.

María dreams of having a dignified home, comfortable and secure for her family, in addition to being able to see one of her grandchildren grow and be able to offer him all the support he needs.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her tortilla-making business such as corn, gas, and firewood for cooking.

loans.name: Concentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONCENTIDAS” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Arminda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido y venta de mantas, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de carne de pollo, venta de carne de res, venta de comida, venta de ollas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Arminda es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, cuando veía tejer a sus amigas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The "AC Concentidas" will begin the 7th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the John Paul II Focal Center. It is comprised of 9 members and is led by a director's board where Ms. Arminda is the president. The businesses that the communal association members are advancing are varied. Among them, there are: weaving and selling blankets; vegetable sales; a neighborhood store; chicken meat sales; beef sales; food sales; and selling pots and pans.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Ms. Armina is a member. She has been a part of Pro Mujer for 3 years. She was included through an invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business weaving and selling blankets. She reveals that she learned this business several years ago when she saw her friends weaving.

The loan that she is now taking out will be an increase of capital (she buys wool wholesale). She will buy from the wholesale vendors in La Paz city and subsequently, after production, she will sell them at exhibitions in El Alto city. This form of work allows her to generate resources to economically support her family, as she is married with 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
"Success will always follow if you have determination and hope."

Here is Elvie, a woman driven with eagerness to work hard for her family. She pursues the best in everything she does, like being faithful even in small things entrusted to her.

She previously received a loan worth Php 20,000 which she has successfully paid back. Now, she likes to avail again a loan amounting to 10 000 PHP which she will use to buy another PC unit. This will greatly help improve her daily earnings as wells as make her life a little better than usual. And this can only happen through your tender hearts which are willing to help.

Her dream is simple. She just wants her business to favorably expand. She's praying for her family stability and good health at the same time. She truly hopes for your affirmative response regarding the matter.

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy another PC unit for her business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 55 years old, and is married with five children.

Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Joy has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from charcoal retailing.

Joy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 58 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mary Ann has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Charlin

texts.en:
Charlin is a marreid woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Charlin has a upholstery business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business.

Charlin has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia, de 46 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijas, las cuales están estudiando.

Sonia, se dedica a la venta de ropa y también a la sastrería, se ha dedicado a estos negocios por más de diez años, pues el trabajo lo aprendió con su hermana mayor, que la indujo al realizar ese tipo de negocio; decidió dedicarse al trabajar vendiendo y elaborando prendas, porque necesitaba una fuente de ingreso que le genera ganancias, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 de la tarde.

Sonia, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa para salir a vender.

El sueño de Sonia, es que mis hijas sean profesionales y que yo pueda aumentar más el negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia, 46 years old, only went to school up to the third year of secondary school. She is a single mother and has three daughters who go to school.

Sonia works selling clothing and also as a tailor. She has worked at these businesses for more than ten years, since she learned the work from her older sister who prompted her to do these types of businesses. She decided to work selling and making clothing because she needed a source of income which would generate earnings. Her work schedule is from 7:00 am to 4:00 in the afternoon.

Sonia needs the loan to purchase more clothing to go out and sell.

Sonia's dream is that her daughters become professionals and that she can increase her business more.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to go out and sell.

loans.name: Ruth De La Paz

texts.es:
Ruth, de 29 años de edad, fue a la universidad y estudio enfermería, está casada, su esposo trabaja de motorista y tienen dos hijos.

Ruth, trabaja en una clínica de salud, ella vende pupusas y su madre y una hermana le ayuda, ella empezó el negocio porque quería obtener otros ingresos, ya que sus hijos van a estudiar y requiere más dinero, el negocio lo atiende de sábado y domingo.

Ruth, solicita el préstamo para comprar otra plancha para hacer pupusas, porque la que tiene no le da abasto, puesto que tiene muchos clientes. 

Ruth, sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ruth, 29 years old, went to university and studied nursing. She is married, her husband works as a driver, and they have two children.

Ruth works at a health clinic and she sells pupusas, and her mother and a sister help her. She began her business because she wanted to get additional income, since her children are going to school and she needs more money. She works at the business on Saturday and Sunday.

Ruth asks for the loan to purchase another griddle to make pupusas, because the one she has is not enough, since she has many customers.

Ruth dreams of her children becoming professionals and continuing with her business.

loans.use: to purchase another griddle to make pupusas.

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
María, de 51 años de edad, no estudio, sus padres no le ayudaron porque tenían muchos hijos, es madre soltera, ella sola ha crecido a sus cinco hijos, tres de ellos ya se acompañaron y dos viven con ella y trabajan en la agricultura sembrando maíz y frijoles.

María, se dedica a tejer hamacas y matatas, este oficio lo aprendió desde muy joven y de esa manera a obtenido ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos, cuando tiene bastante pedidos sus dos hijos le apoyan ya que desde 
pequeños ella les enseño.
 
María, solicita el préstamo para comprar hilo para las hamacas y para comprar fertilizantes para su milpa, de esa manera lograra tener una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de María, sueña con tener materiales para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María, 51 years old, did not go to school. Her parents did not help her because they had many children. She is a single mother; she raised her five children alone. Three of them are now partnered and two live with her and work in agriculture growing corn and beans.

María works weaving hammocks and sleeping mats. She learned this trade from very young and in this way she has gotten income to get her children ahead. When she has enough orders, her two children support her since she taught them how when they were little.

María asks for the loan to purchase yarn for the hammocks and to purchase fertilizers for her cornfield, in this way she will manage to have a better quality of life.

María's dream is to have materials to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase yarn for the hammocks and to purchase fertilizers for her cornfield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new carpentry machinery

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa de 28 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda junto a sus 4 hijas de 13, 11, 4 y 7 años de edad y un varón de 9 meses de edad . Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de tortillas ya que posee un negocio de ventas de tortillas, negocio con el cual ha sacado adelante a sus hijos brindándoles todo lo insumos básicos necesarios y generando los ingresos con lo que paga los servicios básicos de su hogar. Rosa desea mejorar sus ingresos económicos innovando los productos que ofrece a sus numerosos clientes, además desea adquirir productos para la elaboración de variedad de pupusas, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, chicharrón, frijoles, repollo, cebollas, tomates, etc., para mejorar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes en su negocio y poder generar un mejor ingreso económico.
texts.en: Rosa, 28 years old, is a single mother and lives in a house with her 4 daughters, ages 13, 11, 4, and 7, and a 9-month-old son. She is a very hard-working woman who works selling tortillas since she has a business selling tortillas, a business with which she has gotten her children ahead, offering them all the basic necessary supplies and generating income with which she pays for the basic services for her household. Rosa wants to improve her income, innovating with the products that she offers to her many customers, in addition she wants to get products to make a variety of pupusas. For this, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in corn, pork rinds, beans, cabbage, onions, tomatoes, etc. to improve the variety of products she offers her customers in her business and to be able to generate more income.

loans.use: to invest in corn, pork rinds, beans, cabbage, onions, and tomatoes, to improve the variety of products that she offers her customers.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: blanca de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con ayuda de su esposo logran sacar a delante a su familia, la clienta esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos para tener una buena cosecha y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Blanca, 46 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. She has worked in agriculture, planting corn and beans, for 20 years. She sells her products in the different markets. With what she earns from her sales, and with the help of her husband, they manage to get their family ahead. The borrower is asking for another loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and manure to have a good harvest and, so, to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, and soft drinks. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Mary Ann dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine works hard to support four children. She is married and has a business farming seaweed in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her hours even after nightfall.

Christine is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks and other hazards for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines and supplements this income with earnings from her rice farming.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marites dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leonitas

texts.en:
Leonitas is a married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonitas is 35 years old.

Leonitas has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Leonitas requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more varieties of fish to sell to her customers.

Leonitas has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Leonitas would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Boneta

texts.en:
Bonita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending and raising livestock.

Bonita dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Máyela Carolina

texts.es:
Máyela es una mujer emprendedora de veinte y siete años de edad, que se ha abierto las puertas de la vida, siendo independiente y trabajadora. Hace un par de años, ella decidió montar su propio negocio en su casa de habitación, una tienda de ropa para niños. Gracias a un primer préstamo logro comprar más mercadería y crecer como comerciante, por eso ella está muy agradecida. 
En estos momentos, Máyela, tiene mucha demanda de nuevos clientes, por eso ha decidido tocar las puertas de nuevo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para obtener un préstamo que le permita comprar cosméticos, pantalones, camisetas y accesorios alusivos a las fiestas patrias de Nicaragua. En un futuro desea poder incursionar en otros negocios relacionados a la belleza y estética.
texts.en:
Máyela is an enterprising woman, twenty-seven years old, who has opened doors in her life, being independent and hard-working. A few years ago, she decided to open her own business in her home, a children's clothing store. Thanks to her first loan, she managed to purchase more merchandise and grow as a businesswoman, and for this she is very grateful.

At this time, Máyela has a lot of demand from new customers, so she has decided to knock again at the doors of Kiva and MiCrédito to get a loan to allow her to purchase cosmetics, pants, shirts, and accessories depicting Nicaragua's national holidays. In the future, she wants to be able to go into other businesses related to beauty and aesthetics.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, pants, shirts and accessories depicting Nicaragua's national holidays.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Arlene has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as fish, noodles, cooking oil, spices, and vegetables for her food production business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Arlene has been in this business for 23 years. Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as fish, noodles, cooking oil, spices, and vegetables for her food production business.

loans.name: Magna

texts.en:
Magna is 34 years old and married with three children, who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from food vending.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like chips, canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

Magna has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like chips, canned goods, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is married and works hard to support her family. She has a "buy-and-sell" frozen foods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

Analyn has been in this business for four years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Mery

texts.en:
Mery is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafoods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures including her general store and bakery businesses.

Mery dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafoods to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 22 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Isabel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her coconut farm.

Isabel has been farming coconut for eight years and also earns income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her coconut farm

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Maria Corazon is 38 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Corazon has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, spices and other groceries.

In the future, Ma. Corazon would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, gas, lime powder, and kitchen utensils for maintenance of her business, etc.

loans.name: Louella

texts.en:
Louella is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, school supplies and other groceries. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Louella dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, school supplies and other groceries.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 32 years old and has four children, who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store, like soap, eggs, noodles, coffee, chips, etc.

Ailyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, eggs, noodles, coffee, chips, etc.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Madelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling sea cucumber. Madelyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials, like a bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Madelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like a bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Noyaa 2 Group

texts.en:
Teley is in Teshie, Accra-Ghana. It is a trade and fishing area in Accra. The five women range in age from 34 to 50 years, and have elementary and high school educations. They all are mothers with between 2 and 4 children each.

These hardworking women have small businesses such as fish business, grocery, fast food, wigs and perming creams. This is their tenth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and their second with Kiva.

The enterprising Teley, who is 40 years old with three children and a sixth-grade education, is asking for a loan in order to buy more fish and firewood to smoke fish and sell to customers.

She wants to increase the income from her fish business in order to be able to take care of her children's education and give them a prosperous future.

These clients are given educational topics that range from health and hygiene to important business management tools. All the women develop a strong self-esteem, which leads to their being empowered and successful entrepreneurial women.

loans.use: to buy more fish and firewood to smoke the fish and sell to customers.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business selling maize flour for the past seven years. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking far too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Maria Fidelia

texts.es: María de 47 años de edad que habita en vivienda en compañía de su madre y sus dos hijos de 7 y 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo se gana la vida preparando tamales para vender tres días a la semana  además trabaja  brindando sus servicios como tortillera de lunes a jueves, siendo así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y llevado los insumos básicos para su hogar. María desea invertir en su negocio adquiriendo más productos como maíz, aceite, pollo, vegetales, etc., para la preparación de los mismo, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, aceite, gas, pollo, chipilín, etc., para ofrecer más variedad de tamales a sus clientes y poder obtener más ingresos económicos y así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 47, lives with her mother and her two children, ages 7 and 17. She is a very hard-working woman. With great effort she earns a living preparing tamales to sell three days a week. She also provides her services as a tortilla maker on Mondays through Thursdays. This is how she generates income with which she has gotten her children ahead and brought basic supplies to her household.

María wishes to invest in her business by getting more products like corn, cooking oil, chicken, and vegetables, etc. to make tamales. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy corn, cooking oil, gas, chicken, and vegetables, etc. This is so that she will offer a greater variety of tamales to her customers and to be able to get more income. This way she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, cooking oil, gas, chicken, and vegetables in order to offer a greater variety of tamales to her customers.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
53-year-old Edna lives at one of the rows of shanties in Batasan, Quezon City.

She has been thinking of how she could develop her buy-and-sell business; most especially because this is the only means of income for her family.

She knows that saving money alone is not enough when worst-case scenarios come. Then a time came that permitted her to be introduced to CCT, where she became a member last 2010.

Now she would like to request a loan of PHP 10,000. This would be used for improving her livelihood, which she started 15 years ago, through incorporating additional capital for buying more items.

She believes that this is now an open door to her dream of acquiring a more affordable life for her family. In the future she hopes to expand her business and buy additional varieties of products to offer, other than what is shown in the picture.

She hopes for her business to gradually grow. Now, she is praying for unity and good harmony within her household. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more lotions, soaps, beauty products and other items for sale.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Thelma works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a frozen food business. Thelma is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional coffee, sugar and other ingredients for her cafeteria business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams..

loans.use: to buy additional coffee, sugar and other ingredients for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 61 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marietta has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future Marietta would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María, de 56 años de edad, no estudio debido a que sus padres no tenían los suficientes recursos económicos, está casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y solo dos hijos viven con ella que le ayudan a trabajar, aunque ella tuvo 11 hijos.

María, tiene bastante experiencia en la elaboración de hamacas, pero también le apoya a su esposo en la preparación de la tierra y la siembra de maíz.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos como: pesticidas, abono y otros, de esa forma lograran tener una buena cosecha.
