El sueño de María, es construir su casa de bloque, porque actualmente es de adobe.
texts.en:
María, 56, did not attend school because her parents lacked the financial resources. She's married and her husband works in agriculture. Even though she had 11 children, only two live with her, and they help her work.

María has a lot of experience making hammocks, but she also helps her husband prepare the land and grow corn.

The loan she's requesting is to buy pesticide, soil amendments, and other agricultural inputs to grow basic grains. That way she'll get a good harvest.

María's dream is to build her house of cinder blocks because currently it's made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, soil amendments, and other agricultural inputs to grow basic grains

loans.name: Leydi Siomara

texts.es:
Leydi, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casada, su esposo actualmente se encuentra en Estados Unidos desde hace tres años y juntos tienen tres hijos.

Leydi, trabaja de vendedora en un comedor donde venden desayunos y almuerzos todos los días, pero además venden lácteos como: queso, crema y quesillo; este negocio es de un familiar de ella y el horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m.

Leydi, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para la siembra de maíz, porque su padre es quien se dedica a tal trabajo, de esa forma lograra cubrir la necesidad que existe en este momento.

El sueño de Leydi, es que sus hijos tengan lo necesario y tener las fuerzas para darles la alimentación.
texts.en:
Leydi, age 30, went to school through the seventh grade. She is married, and her husband has now been in the United States for three years. They have three children. Leydi works as a salesperson at an eatery where they sell breakfast and lunch every day. However, they also sell dairy products like cheese, cream, and soft cheese. This is one of her relative's business, and the work schedule is from 8:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m.

Leydi needs the loan to buy fertilizers for the corn crop. Her father is the one who does this work. This way she will manage to cover the need that now exists.

Leydi's dream is that her children have what they need and that she has the strength to provide their food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn crop.

loans.name: Jineth Carolina

texts.es: Jineth es una microempresaria residente en Bogotá y en su expendio de carnes maneja todos los cortes de carne de res, pollo y un amplio surtido de productos cárnicos.  Ella es madre de dos hijos y vive con su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio y con el fruto de su trabajo ha logrado brindar bienestar a su familia. Diariamente apertura su negocio de lunes a domingo en el horario de 8:30 a.m. a 7:30 p.m. y sus clientes que su gran mayoría son vecinos y transeúntes del sector realizan sus comprar a buenos precios llevando productos de excelente calidad. Alteno a su actividad principal, aprovechó el espacio de su negocio para instalar unas máquinas de juegos que le aportan un ingreso adicional.  En la actualidad ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar activos fijos necesarios para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio. Su meta a futuro es realiza adecuaciones que garanticen la ampliación del local y que permitan manejar una mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Jineth is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in Bogotá. In her small butcher shop she handles all cuts of beef and chicken and a wide supply of meat products. She's the mother of two children and she lives with her spouse in a city neighborhood. She has been able to provide for her family's well-being with the fruit of her labor.

She opens her business every day from Monday through Sunday from 8:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. Her customers, mostly neighbors and passersby in the area, make their purchases at good prices for products of excellent quality. In addition to her main job, she made the most of the space in her business to install a few game machines, which provide additional income for her.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy the fixed assets she needs to run her business smoothly.

Her goal for the future is to make improvements to expand her locale and handle greater amounts.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets

loans.name: Myril

texts.en:
Myril is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, like shampoo, noodles, soap, sugar, coffee, etc.

Myril industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling dry goods. She dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like shampoo, noodles, soap, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Xuân

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân is 53 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fruit for 8 years. Xuân lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. So it is really difficult for her to cover the life cost and do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Xuân first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Xuân hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Vilma Yaneth

texts.es: Vilma de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hjos, ella se dedica a la confeccion de ropa interior desde hace 14 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes establecidos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de variedad de telas, elasticos, etc. por mayor para poder continuar con su negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
42-year old Vilma lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has earned her living making underwear for fourteen years. Her business is located in her home; she has many regular customers. With the money she makes, she is managing to get ahead.

Vilma is seeking a loan to buy an assortment of fabric, elastic etc. in bulk so she can continue with her business and increase her income.

loans.use: buy an assortment of fabric and elastic etc. in bulk

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as spices, canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lule

texts.en:
Lule's mother passed away recently and she is seeking your financial help to pay for the funeral expenses. She had been living with Lule's family from the very beginning

Lule had no money at home when this happened and acquaintances and distant relatives paid for the burial. She promised to pay them back as soon as possible, thus the loan that she is requesting will help her pay them. Lule's family lives in a little town therefore, the income is the disability of her two daughters in a total amount of $144/month and $120/month from her husband, who works in construction.

loans.use: to pay for the funeral expenses of her mother who passed away recently.

loans.name: Cariza

texts.en:
Cariza is 26 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from buying and selling dry goods.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell in her store.

Cariza has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell.

loans.name: Arpik

texts.en:
Arpik lives in the frontier village Khashtarak of Tavush region. She lives here with her daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. Her husband and son are in Russian Federation working there and they send money for their large family’s great needs.

These needs are a lot since living in the frontier village the life here is very hard and dangerous one for everyone, but the love and tender towards the native village make all the farmers like Arpik to stay and develop it. Now in her farm she has a cow, a calf, pigs and chickens. On her plot of land she also cultivates potato, zucchini, cabbage, tomato, cucumber and greens. With her farm’s milk, meat and eggs and vegetables she sells both from her farm and she also takes it to city’s wholesale market.

Arpik now has an important and very urgent problem to solve as soon as it is possible, since the cold season is very close and the barn that needs some repairing cannot be warm and safe place for her cattle. With her Kiva loan Arpik wants to repair her cattle-barn and she is thankful for support beforehand.

loans.use: to repair her cattle-barn and she is thankful for support beforehand

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine! This is 28-year-old Mohammad from Asqoola neighborhood in Gaza. He is married with no kids. For 10 years he has been making sweets with his mother and in 2014 he opened his own sweet stall, which you can see in the picture.

Mohammad says that the main challenge to his business is the economic situation in Gaza. He has required this loan in order to buy a sugar spraying machine and the extra needed materials for his stall. He hopes that the income from this loan will allow him to expand his business.

In the future, Mohammad plans to rent a sweet shop and expand his variety of sweets. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a sugar spraying machine and needed extra materials for his sweets stall.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 23-year-old single young man who opened a mobile phones shop, almost two years ago, where he sells mobiles and accessories. He is an ambitious man who has a good reputation in his region.

Abbass is trying desperately to develop his business, so today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with a new collection of mobile phones and accessories.

Abbass hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new collection of mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en:
Mrs Tâm is 34 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Tâm lives in Hoang Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

Tâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Tâm has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
In the future, Tâm hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Omar Anfermo

texts.es: Omar es un microempresario de 43 años que emprendió su propio negocio de agroquímicos, productos veterinarios y de aseo, gracias a su experiencia en el campo de más de diez años de experiencia, él deseaba trabajar para sí mismo e incrementar sus ingresos, de este modo en el año 2011, logró hacer realidad su sueño de prosperidad con el que ha ofrecido bienestar a su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos.  De lunes a sábado apertura su local a las 8 a.m. y cierra a las 7:30 p.m. en horario extendido, de este modo sus clientes pueden realizar sus compras de aromatizantes concentrados, insumos para fumigación, productos naturales; tés, multivitamínicos, medicamentos entre otros. Omar está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en toda la línea de sus productos al por mayor, de este modo sus ventas se incrementarán al igual que sus ganancias.  Su meta a futuro es fortalecer su capital de trabajo para poder acceder a mejores precios y promociones de productos.
texts.en:
Omar is a 43 year old businessman. He started his own small business selling agrochemicals, veterinary products, and cleaning products and has more than ten years' experience in the field. He wished to work for himself and increase income, and then in 2011 he succeeded in making his dream reality. With his increased income he has been able to support his wife and two children.

His business is open extended hours from 8 am to 7:30 pm Monday to Saturday when his clients can make their purchases of aromatic special feed, fumigation supplies, natural products (teas, multivitamins, medication etc.)

Omar is seeking his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy his whole product line in bulk and thus increase sales and income. His goal in the future is to increase working capital so he can access the best prices and product promotions.

loans.use: buy his whole product line in bulk

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis, de 28 años de edad, trabaja y estudia administración de empresas, está soltero y vive en casa familiar.

Luis, es empleado de una gasolinera familiar, el administra el establecimiento y los empleados, ya tiene
muchos años de trabajar en ese lugar.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar repuestos para su vehículo, de esa forma la necesidad quedara satisfecha.

El sueño de Luis, es terminar de estudiar y graduarse con un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Luis is 28 years old. He works and studies business administration. He is single and lives in his family home. Luis is employed by a family gas station. He manages the establishment and the employees. He has spent many years working in this place.

He will use the loan to purchase parts for his vehicle so that this need will be satisfied. Luis dreams of completing his studies and graduating with a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ena Dinora

texts.es: Con 30 años de edad, Ena vive al lado de sus hijos de 10, 14 y 16 años de edad, y al lado de sus padres. Ena es madre soltera y en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida se dedica a la venta de productos helados y verduras desde hace cuatro años, lo que le permite tener una buena cantidad de clientes que prefieren sus productos. Esta actividad le permite poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de ella y de su familia. Ena logro con el crédito solicitado anteriormente construir el servicio sanitario, por lo que se siente muy feliz, pero buscando la manera de continuar mejorando su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir pared alrededor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
At 30 years old, Ena lives at the side of her children who are 10, 14 and 16 years old and at the side of her parents. She is a single mother in search of a better quality of life. She has worked selling frozen products and vegetables for four years which has permitted her to have a good number of customers who prefer her products. This activity allows her to cover the basic needs of her and her family.

With the previous loan, Ena was able to construct the restroom and she feels very happy because of this. But, she is searching for a way to continue improving her home. Because of this she is seeking a FUSAI loan to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to construct a wall around her home.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to construct a wall around her home.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 54 años de edad, no estudio, está casada, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la albañilería, tienen cinco hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad y solo una hija vive con ellos.

Marina, trabaja en un restaurante de comida típica desde hace cuatro años, pero también tiene una venta de meriendas en su casa que se la administra su hija todos los días de lunes a sábado.

El préstamo lo solicita para comprar cacerolas, mesas y materiales para incrementar más sus ventas, de esa forma lograra mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Marina, es que su familia viva en mejores condiciones de vida y siempre tener las fuerzas para trabajar de esa forma.
texts.en:
54-year old Marina has no formal education. She is married and her husband works in construction. They have five children, all adults--only one daughter still lives with them. Marina has worked in a restaurant selling local dishes for four years, and she also sells snacks out of her house. Her daughter takes care of this business from Monday to Saturday.

The loan Marina is seeking will be used to buy casseroles, tables and other supplies and increase sales. In turn her income will improve.

Marina's dream is to see her family have improved living conditions; she hopes she will always have the energy to work in this way.

loans.use: buy casseroles, tables and other supplies

loans.name: Urbasi

texts.en:
Urbasi is 50 years old and she is married. She has had a mushroom-selling business for the last seven years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Urbasi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Lina's Group

texts.en:
Living in a small wooden house located in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Lina is 22 years old and she has a young kid. She has been working as a tailor and working for others for a fee to support her standard of living for several years. Her daily income is around $7 per day.

She lacks funds to support her business so she decided to take a new loan and this is the fourth loan cycle of her with VisionFund. With the past loans, she could afford to buy household supplies to support her family’s living condition better.

Lina will manage her loan portion to buy a sewing machine to support her business. She hopes to produce tailored clothes more than before and earn more income so that she has enough ability to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to produce more tailored clothes so as to increase her income to send her beloved kid to school.

loans.name: Amilcar Alexander

texts.es: De 37 años de edad, Amílcar, reside en casa propia, en la cual habita al lado de su compañera de vida y al lado de sus 3 hijos de 9, 13 y 15 años de edad. Amílcar desempeña la función de albañil independiente, trabajo que realiza desde hace tres años y de esta manera busca mejorar su vivienda y a la vez ofrecer una mejor forma de vida a su esposa y a sus hijos, Amílcar y su familia viven de una forma muy humilde, por lo que con el crédito solicitado anteriormente invirtió en productos básicos para vender en una pequeña tienda que instalo en un cuarto de lámina, pero ha observado que la demanda de productos con la que cuenta es muy buena, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para construir un cuarto más seguro para su negocio y de esta manera tener mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Amílcar is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their 3 children, ages 9, 13 and 15. Amílcar works as an independent construction worker, a job he has had for 3 years now. He hopes to improve his housing and, at the same time, offer a better way of life to his wife and children.

Amílcar and his family live very humbly, so with the loan requested previously, he invested in staples to sell in a small store that he installed in a room made of corrugated sheet metal. But he has observed that the demand for the products he has is very good, so he is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to buy: galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to build a more secure room for his business, so that way, there will be better security.

loans.use: to invest in corrugated sheet metal, wood and nails to repair the room for the store.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Maria de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee un negocio de venta de comida ubicada cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. She has a small business where she sells food located near her home in a zone of the city with a lot of traffic. And so, she is able to earn enough money in order to cover some household expenses. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit and vegetables so she can continue selling food and obtain higher earnings.

loans.use: purchase, rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan lives with his wife and two children in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. He graduated Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute and from 2011 till today, he works at the local school as a teacher of mathematics. Stepan mentions that he could never imagine he work as a pedagogue but now he likes his work and his pupils very much , whom he greatly helps in their learning process every day. He also gives paid private courses of his subject preparing some of his pupils for the entrance exams.

Now with this Kiva loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Stepan wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature- all these for self-development and also for more proper organization of his private courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional literature- all these for self-development and also for more proper organization of his private courses

loans.name: Nevi Maritza

texts.es: Nevi de 33 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de verduras. Trabajo que realiza para cubrir las necesidades básicas de la familia y así también para mejorar su calidad de vida. Nevi vive al lado de su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con la economía de hogar, también vive al lado de su hijo de 8 años de edad. En vista de las necesidades que existen en su vivienda, Nevi solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, láminas, madera, clavos y pago de mano de obra para la construcción del corredor de su vivienda, y de esta manera mejorar su vivienda y así también su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nevi is 33 years old. She is a very hardworking person who works selling vegetables, work that she completes to pay for the basic necessities of her family and to also improve her quality of life. Nevi lives at the side of her life partner who helps with the household economy. She also lives at the side of her 8 year old son. In light of the needs that exist in her life, Nevi is seeking a FUSAI loan to invest in: sand, cement, sheeting, wood, nails and manual labor to construct a hall for her home in order to improve her home and her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in: sand, cement, sheeting, wood, nails and manual labor to construct a hall in her home.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia de 24 años de edad, vive al lado de sus dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, y también al lado de sus padres. Ella es madre soltera que en busca de sacar adelante a sus hijos presta sus servicios en un restaurante de comida rápida que está cerca de su vivienda, lo que le permite poder aportar una ayuda a su hogar y a la vez poder ofrecerle el estudio a su hijo. Yesenia en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bloques, cemento, arena, lámina, polines y pago de mano de obra para finalizar la construcción de un cuarto habitación, proyecto que con anterioridad había empezado y por falta de liquidez económica no había podido finalizar. Y es por lo que Yesenia acude a FUSAI para poder solventar dicho contratiempo.
texts.en: Yesenia is 24 years old and she lives with her two children who are 6 and 3 years old. She also lives with her parents. She is a single mother looking for ways to give her children a better life. She works at a fast food restaurant that is close to her home. This helps her give financial support to her household and pay for her son's studies. Yesenia is hoping to improve her quality of life and so she is applying for a loan with FUSAI in order to purchase cement blocks, cement, sand, laminate, two-by-fours, and labor in order to build a fourth bedroom on the house. She began this project previously, but did not have the money to finish it. And so, she is looking for FUSAI for a way to complete construction.

loans.use: purchase cement blocks, cement, sand, laminate, two-by-fours and labor to finish construction on a bedroom.

loans.name: Srim's Group

texts.en:
Srim is 38 years old and she is married. She and her family live in Kampong Cham province. One out of her three children is dependent on her and under age of school. She and her husband are farmers, growing rice to earn the main source of income. They are so industrious that they are earning supplement income through raising pigs and working as a tailor.

Srim has been involved in her farming business for twenty years. Earning about USD21 per day, Srim can manage to save approximately about USD10 each day.

This will be her first time with VisionFund. Leading a group of two members, Srim will use her loan to purchase organic fertilizer to boost her crop yields and the remaining loan portion will be used to purchase organic pesticide and fuel for her pumping machine. She hopes that her crop can produce more outputs so that she can manage to upgrade the standard of living and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase organic pesticide to protect her crop from threats by insects, so as to increase her crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Kiaphul

texts.en:
Kiaphul is 34 years old and she is married. She has had a fruit-selling business for the last five years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Kiaphul hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Since 2000, Samer who is living in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon, owns a vegetables store in the area where he lives. He is 45 years old and married but his wife does not work.

At the beginning, Samer's brother helped him open his shop, but a few years later as the business grew, Samer was able to rely on himself and employed two persons to help him.
For the first time, Samer is asking for a 4,111,000 Lebanese pound loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan to buy a larger quantity of vegetables in cash, which will allow him to secure a lower price, and sell them for the provisioning season before winter which will increase his income and profitability.

Samer's store is well known in the area, it is one of the cleanest shop in the area, he has large of supplies of fresh vegetables and a very respectable reputation among his clients.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of vegetables wholesale and prepare them for winter provisions by his customers

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a 39-year-old married mother of four. Five years ago, she opened her own beauty salon shop to help her husband in covering the increasing needs of their children. She learned beauty care in an institute and has twenty five years of experience in this domain which helped her with her professional skills to gain her loyal customers.

Habiba is trying hard to develop her business, thus today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will facilitate her business and allow her to transport items and visit her customers easily.
Habiba hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with descent living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car which will facilitate her business

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla is 19 years old. She is from Agdas. Leyla is an energetic student, and she is a hardworking intelligent girl.

Leyla has big wishes and ambitions in her life. She wants to excel in her studies and be helpful to people. Her father’s income is not enough for her education, so she needs a loan to pay for her school tuition. She is very hopeful that Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition.

loans.name: Rosalina Yamileth

texts.es: Rosalina de 28 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de sus hijos de 11, 8 y 5 años de edad. Rosalina con mucho esfuerzo lucha por que a sus hijos no les falte nada y puedan crecer con todo lo necesario en su vida. Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catálogo y así de esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de sus hijos, mientras que su compañero de vida ayuda con los gastos del hogar gracias a que presta sus servicios como mecánico automotriz en su vivienda. El hogar de Rosalina es humilde, el cual ha sido construido de adobe y teja, y en el cual tiene 9 años de residir felizmente al lado de su familia y agradecida por poder tener un techo bajo el cual vivir. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, Rosalina decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, clavos, vara de castilla, zacate y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio de adobe, ya que desea ampliar su vivienda y de esta manera vivir de una mejor manera al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 28, lives with her life partner and their children aged 11, 8 and 5.  With a lot of effort, she strives to provide for her children so that they lack for nothing and can grow with everything they need in life.  She has a business selling beauty products through a catalog.  This is how she generates the income she needs to cover her basic needs and those of her children.  Her partner helps with the household expenses thanks to his job working as an auto mechanic from their home.  

Rosalina's home is modest, built of adobe and tile.  This is where she has lived happily with her family for 9 years, and she has been grateful to have a roof over her head.  Seeking a better quality of life, Rosalina decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in: sheets of corrugated metal, nails, cane rods and hay, and to pay for labor to build a bedroom out of adobe.  This is because she wants to expand her home so that she can live better with her family.

loans.use: to add a room to her house

loans.name: Roxana De Jesus

texts.es: Con 34 años de edad, Roxana se dedica a la venta de comida, entre las cuales encontramos: sopa de gallina y  tamales, actividad que realiza con el fin de poder cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia. Roxana vive al lado de su compañero de vida quien gracias a su humilde trabajo aporta para la economía del hogar, también vive al lado de sus dos hijas de 7 y 10 años de edad. Roxana en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de una pila, debido a que la que posee se encuentra deteriorada y se le dificulta a la hora de realizar las tareas. Roxana se siente agradecida ya que con el crédito anterior construyo un corredor, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir la pila y el lavadero de su vivienda.
texts.en:
At thirty-four years old, Roxana works selling food. Among her dishes, you can find chicken soup and tamales. It’s a job that is able to cover the basic necessities of herself and her family. Roxana lives with her domestic partner who, thanks to his humble work, contributes to the household economy. She also lives with her two daughters who are seven and ten years old.

Roxana, in search of a way to improve her quality of life, is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, and labor to build a sink. This is because the one she has is deteriorated, and it’s difficult for her to do the work.

Roxana feels thankful since with her previous loan she built a corridor. That’s why she’s asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build her home's sink and laundry room.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build her home's sink and laundry room

loans.name: Carmen Nohemy

texts.es: Con 29 años de edad, Carmen reside al lado de su compañero de vida y al lado de sus dos hijas de 14 y 2 años de edad quienes son la motivación para Carmen para salir adelante y esforzarse día con día por ganarse el sustento diario de su familia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, quien labora en una carpintería familiar junto a su esposo. Carmen en busca de mejorar su estilo de vida decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, ladrillo, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para construir un cuarto habitación en su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida. Así también ella se encuentra muy agradecida con FUSAI por el crédito que anteriormente se le otorgó, ya que con ello pudo invertir en la reparación del techo de su vivienda dando como resultado una mayor tranquilidad y seguridad para su familia.
texts.en: At 29 years old, Carmen lives with her husband and with her two daughters who are 14 and 2 years old. They are Carmen's motivation for trying to get ahead and why she works every day to earn enough money to support her family. She is a hard working women who works at a family carpentry business, along with her husband. Carmen is looking for a way to improve her quality of life and so she has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in cement, bricks, sand, steel and labor. She is thankful to FUSAI for the loan she was previously awarded because she was able to repair her roof and for the tranquility and safety it has brought to her family.

loans.use: purchase cement, bricks, seand, steel and labor in order to build a room for her house.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: sonia de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de prodcutos varios (ropa, lociones, zapatos, etc.) se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 7 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Sonia, 39,  lives in her own home with her 2 children.  She has a business selling items such as clothing, lotions, and shoes.  She's been doing this work for 7 years, and with the earnings from her sales she manages to cover some of the household expenses.  

Sonia is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is in her early 30s and is married with three schooling children. She has been running a retail shop for four years now. She works from 08am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the shop inventory and had managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the best selling items in the shop inventory. She dreams of owning a motorcycle.

Eliza will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling items in the  shop inventory.

loans.name: Diana Estefany

texts.es:
Diana, de 23 años de edad, estudio un diplomado en informática, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en una tienda de consumo, actualmente no tienen hijos.

Diana, se dedica a vender prendas de acero como anillos, cadenas, pulseras y aritos, este negocio lo tiene desde hace un año, lo inicio con el propósito de ayudarle a su pareja y ahorrar un poco para el futuro cuando tengan hijos y darles lo que necesiten.
 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más prendas de acero como: anillos, pulseras, aretes y otros productos para ofrecerles más variedad a sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias.

El sueño de Diana, es ayudarle a su pareja y que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Diana is 23 years old and she is studying for a degree in information technology. She has a boyfriend and he works at a grocery store. They currently do not have children.

Diana works selling accessories like rings, chain necklaces, bracelets and earrings. She has been running her business for a year. She began with the goal of helping her boyfriend and to save some money for the future when they have children. The loan she is asking for today will be used to purchase more accessories like rings, bracelets, earrings, and more so she can offer a wider variety of products to her clients and earn more money. Diana's dream is to help her boyfriend and to grow her business a little day by day.

loans.use: purchase accessories like rings, bracelets, earrings and other items in order to provide more variety to her clients.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwakais a married woman with seven children, four of whom attends school. She owns a  house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with four children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie wants to build an irrigation system about 1000 meters long including pipes and pump, from the mountain to their house, because she had no water, neither for drinking nor for watering her plantations. She has 3 dynym of agricultural land that her family owns or is for livestock. Marie also owed some money she used it for the livestock, to her relatives whom she promised to pay them back as soon as she could. Therefore, the loan she is requesting from you will be used for the irrigation and the money she owes.
Marie is in the photograph with her husband, Ndue.

loans.use: to build an irrigation system about 1000 meter long including pipes and pump.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 27, single and has a laundry and ironing business. He is requesting 4000 EGP loan to buy a modern iron to increase his income and expand his project

loans.use: to buy a modern iron for his laundry business

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María, de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos que son mayores de edad, la mayor de sus hijas reside en Estados Unidos y el menor está estudiando bachillerato.

María, se dedica a vender meriendas como: yuca frita, nuégados y tostadas, ella tiene varios años de dedicarse a este 
negocio, puesto que siempre le ha gustado trabajar.
 
El préstamo anterior María, lo solicito para comprar una vaca lechera y ahora lo está solicitando para comprar yuca, aceite, sal y plátanos para el negocio que tiene, de esa manera obtendrá otros ingresos y tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de María es tener siempre lo necesario para su vida y su hijo y que su hija este bien en Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Maria, 50 years of age, studied to the sixth grade, is a single mother, and has two children who are now adults. The older of her daughters resides in the United States and the younger is studying for her high school diploma.

Maria dedicates her time to selling lunches such as fried yucca, syrup-coated fried dumplings, and toasted bread. She has done this for various years because she has always liked to work.

Maria requested her previous loan to purchase a milk cow and now she is soliciting a loan to buy yucca, cooking oil, salt and plantains for her business. In this manner, she will obtain additional income and have a better quality of life.

Maria's dream is to always have what is needed for herself and her child and, also, that her daughter in the United States may be well.

loans.use: buy yucca, cooking oil, salt and plantains for  her business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a new client to the institution, and he is a single father of two children.

Edward drives a motorcycle taxi as his major source of income. He has done this job for over four years, but he has been riding someone else's motorcycle.

Edward decided to join Ugafode to access financial assistance and buy his own motorcycle. He applied for a loan of 1,800,000 UGX to help him buy a motorcycle. Edward thanks Ugafode for financial support which will enable him to acquire his own motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Nyamvula has been operating a poultry selling business for over one year. She mentioned that disease outbreaks causing losses is a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, Nyamvula wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Luis de 38 años de edd vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis is 38 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has had a store located in his house for 3 years and with what he makes from his sales he manages to get ahead with the household expenses. Luis is requesting a loan to buy more soup, eggs basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. to be able to have higher income for a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more soup, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Ana Ceferina

texts.es:
Ana, de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, porque en ese tiempo solo a trabajar los ponían sus padres, es viuda desde hace dos años y vive solo con un hijo porque los demás ya se casaron.

Ana, desde joven su madre le enseño la sastrería y desde que se caso ella puso su propia sastrería y de ese negocio pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar telas, hilos y repuestos para su maquina, de esa manera podrá seguir trabajando y obteniendo ingresos para los mismos gastos de la casa.

El sueño de Ana, es siempre mantener la clientela y cada día mejorar sus ingresos y siempre apoyar a su hijo en lo que este a su alcanze.
texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old and studied up to Grade 2 as at this time parents put their children to work. She has been a widow for two years and lives alone with her son since her other children are married.

Ana when she was young was taught to sew by her mother and when she got married she opened her own sewing shop and with this business she raised her children.

She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread and parts for her machine. In this way she will be able to continue working and obtain income for the household expenses. Ana's dream is to a keep her clientele and each day improve her revenues and always support her son as much as she can.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and parts for her machine.

loans.name: Orlys

texts.es: Orlys es una microempresaria de 46 años madre de tres hijos a quienes educó en el seno de su hogar, ella contaba con unos ahorros y no tenía alguna proyección de inversión con ellos, únicamente se ocupaba de las labores en el hogar y su cónyuge era quien aportaba para los gastos en el hogar, sin embargo la convenció de que los utilizara para apertura de algún negocio que les proporcionara un ingreso adicional, de esta manera Orlys optó por una miscelánea, ya que en el sector no existía algún negocio similar y que desde la comodidad del hogar podría realizar dicha actividad.  De este modo adecuó un espacio en la sala de su vivienda ubicada en un barrio del municipio de soledad en donde exhibe una vitrina con una amplia variedad de artículos de aseo personal, de belleza, golosinas, papelería entre otros.  Hoy en día está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para mejorar el surtido de su negocio y aprovechar las festividades que se aproximan.  Su meta a futuro es abrir un almacén más grande y con un excelente surtido.
texts.en:
Orlys is a small businesswoman, age 46 and the mother of 3 children who were raised at home. She had some savings and didn't have any plans to invest them, she just concerned herself with the household chores and her husband was the one who contributed for the household expenses.

However, he convinced her to use her savings to open some kind of business that would bring in another income. That's how Orlys decided on a variety store, since there wasn't a similar business in the neighborhood and she could run the business from the comfort of her own home. So she adapted a space in the living room of her home, located in a neighborhood in the city of Soledad, where she has a display case with a wide variety of personal hygiene products, cosmetics, candy, paper goods, etc.

Today, she is applying for a loan - her first Kiva loan - with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to improve the selection of goods in her business and take advantage of the upcoming holidays. Her future goal is to open a larger store with an excellent selection of products.

loans.use: to improve the selection of goods in her business and take advantage of the upcoming holidays.

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma is 42 years old and she is married. She has had a food stall business for the last four years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Uma hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and lives together with her husband and six children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Fatuma has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation.

With the 10,000 KES, Fatuma wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad a 21 year old young man, lives with his parents and three brothers in a camp for the Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon. Mohammad's father is an employee and his mom does not work.
Three years ago, he graduated from school and decided to open his own shop in which he sells all types of phone accessories. Back then, Mohammad got the support of his father and one of his brothers to establish his business, but today the success of his shop allows him to financially rely on himself and help his family with their expenses.

Mohammad is well known in the area, he has his own clients who trust him for his honesty and reliability. Although he is young, he is very ambitious and hardworking.
For the first time, Mohammad is asking for a 1,543,992 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa to buy supplies for his shop in wholesales at a lower price. He believes that by getting the loan he will be able to increase his revenue and insure the business' sustainability. He is also hoping that an increase in his income will allow him to recruit someone to help him in the shop.

loans.use: to buy accessories and chargers for his cellular shop

loans.name: Sajid

texts.en:
Sajid is 42 years old, married, and owns a small community school. His school provides education to 154 students and was founded in 2009. Almost 50% of the students in the school are female, and Sajid has made it a personal goal to increase this ratio in future.

Recently Sajid requested a loan of 100,000 PKR, stating that his school is in dire need of proper furniture for the students. To keep classrooms cool in the scorching heat, he also plans to purchase ceiling fans and a water cooler for the school.

Willing to meet the challenges faced by a school owner with limited funds and expansion opportunities, Sajid is adamant on improving the quality of education in his school and plans to continue to do so year after year.

loans.use: to purchase proper furniture along with ceiling fans and a water cooler for the school.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber is a new client to the institution, and he is married with four children, three of whom attend school. Wilber is a civil servant and he has been serving the government for over 11 years. Unfortunately his salary alone cannot meet all of his family's financial needs, and so he decided to start agricultural projects so as to supplement his income.

Wilber applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and manure so as to increase his production, as well as some building materials to finish his house.

Wilber thanks Ugafode for the financial support it extends to people, which has improved many lives.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to boost his agricultural production.

loans.name: Mensure

texts.en:
Mensure is 44 years old and married. Mensure's family consists of two children and her husband. She is from Agdash.

Mensure is a farmer and she started her work about 22 years ago. She has gained a lot of experience at work, but currently she is not happy about the situation of her farm. Due to a water shortage she cannot earn enough income. She needs money to buy a water tank and improve her business.

She loves her family and knows that with a grown and expanded business she can also improve her family's living conditions. Therefore, she applied for a 1,200 AZN loan. She will use this money to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Sabit

texts.en:
Sabit is 43 years old and married and also a father of two beautiful kids. He is from Agdash.

Sabit is a hawker. Every day he earns a different amount of money, because he doesn't have a fixed job. Sometimes he also makes money by painting houses, washing cars, or farming.

Now he has some problems. Sabit’s wife is ill. His wife needs treatment but he does not have enough money to pay for her treatment. Sabit needs Kiva lenders' support to pay for treatment and medicine for his wife.

loans.use: to pay for treatment and medicine for his wife.

loans.name: Andrea Carolina

texts.es:
Andrea es una estilista profesional que se realizó como empresaria independiente en el año 2013, 
ella adecuó un espacio en las instalaciones de su vivienda ubicada en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, en donde diariamente recibe a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son habitantes del sector y familiares, a quienes les ofrece cortes de cabello, cepillado, tintes, desrizado, iluminaciones, entre otros tratamientos que están a la vanguardia como queratinas, y chocolaterapia. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de un lavacabezas e  insumos de peluquería, inversión que mejorará sus servicios y el cliente tendrá la oportunidad de estar en un lugar mejor acondicionado.  Andrea es una joven de 20 años que está soltera y a futuro desea tener un local donde pueda inaugurar su sala de belleza que le provea para su sustento y para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Andrea is a professional stylist who became an independent businessperson in 2013. She adapted a space in the facilities of her house which is located in a neighborhood of the municipality of Barranquilla. Here she receives her customers every day, the great majority of whom are inhabitants of the area and acquaintances whom she offers haircuts, styling, dying, hair straightening, highlighting amongst other treatments that are at the vanguard like keratin treatments and chocolate therapy.

She is currently applying for her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in the purchase of a hair washing station and hair-cutting supplies. This investment will improve her services and her clients will have the opportunity to be in a better equipped place.

Andrea is a 20 year old youth who is single. In the future she wants to have a shop where she can open her beauty salon which will provide for her sustenance and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a hair washing station and hair-cutting supplies.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar, es un hombre honesto y trabajador, de cincuenta y siete años de edad, padre de seis hijos, creció al aire libre y trabaja a diario en el campo, en la actualidad es productor agropecuario. Poco a poco ha logrado fortalecerse como comerciante, está muy agradecido y seguro que con trabajo arduo él lograra convertirse en un gran agricultor y ganadero. 
Él confía y está muy agradecido con MiCrédito y Kiva, sabe que en ellos siempre tiene apoyo, por eso ha solicitado un préstamo que le permita comprar alimento a las vacas, vitaminas, pacas de arroz y otros insumos que necesita para mantener a flote su negocio dado que su zona está pasando por una temporada de sequía. En un futuro desea comprar más tierra y reforzar sus corrales.
texts.en:
Cesar is an honest, hard working, 57 year old man. He is the father of six children. He grew up in the open air, and works daily in the fields. He currently is an agricultural producer. Little by little he has managed to strengthen himself as a businessman. He is very grateful and certain that with hard work, he will manage to convert himself into a great farmer and cattle rancher.

He trusts in and is very grateful to MiCrédito and Kiva. He knows with them he will always have support. For that reason he has requested a loan that will permit him to buy food for his cows, vitamins, bales of rice and other supplies that he needs to keep his business afloat, since the area is dealing with a period of drought. In the future, he hopes to buy more land and reinforce his corrals.

loans.use: to buy food for his cows, vitamins, bales of rice and other supplies to keep his business afloat.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is 47 years old and a cattle breeder. She has a large family: a mother of nine sons who are still studying and her husband, who is old but he helps in breeding. Taghreed and her husband are cattle breeders, she has been involved in this job for five years.

She hopes if she can expand her business to help her sons in their hard conditions of life. That’s why she visit Kiva’s partner, Alibdaa, to get a loan and buy a few heads of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and expand her business.

loans.name: Group Nyasho

texts.en:
Juliana is in her early 40s is married with six schooling children. She has been running a retail shop for twenty years. She works from 08am to 08pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase on the shop inventory and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to buy chicks and chicken fees, chicken medicine, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the shop inventory. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop.

Juliana will share this loan with her loan group NYASHO which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  restock the out of stock items in the shop inventory.

loans.name: Quý

texts.en:
Mrs Quý is 63 years old and she is married.
She has been operating a food stall selling snacks for 5 years.
Quý lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. And the income from this job is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Quý first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.
In the future, Quý hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Mergeline

texts.en:
Mergeline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Mergeline has been in this business for 20 years. Mergeline earns more income from food vending and general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mergeline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 40 years old and married with four children, two of whom in school, Annaliza works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Annaliza has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Annaliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 57 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Trinidad is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Trinidad has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine is 28 years old and she lives with her beloved husband and two sons in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Armine is engaged in farming with her husband, who also works as constructor. In her farm Armine has cows, calves, bulls, sheep, lambs and a pig. She organizes also the sale of her farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese and meat (beef, mutton and pork). These products are also very useful and important for her family use, but she would like to sell more milk since its quantity is very little and the income from it as well, and sometimes her children have lack of milk for everyday use. With this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Armine wants to buy a cow and also fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow and also fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Norcamar

texts.en:
Norcamar is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Norcamar has been in this business for 5 years. Norcamar earns more income from buy and sell rice grains and farming vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Norcamar has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Leonidas Benildo

texts.es: Leonidas es un hombre de 50 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Subin, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él trabaja como obrero de construcción y también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por alfalfa orgánica que él mismo cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cuatro vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder darle a su pareja estabilidad económica y sobre todo espera poder tener salud, es por ello que apuesta por lo orgánico, para seguir estando junto a su ella por mucho tiempo más.
texts.en:
Leonidas is a 50-year-old man who lives with his partner in a rural village of Subin, which is located in Moquegua.

He is a construction worker and also makes a living by organically raising cattle. He puts a lot of attention into their care and the nutrition that he gives them, which is made up of organic alfalfa that he grows himself.

He is requesting the microloan to be able to buy 4 organic cows. He hopes that their milk may be sold at a better price because it is organic.

In the future, he hopes to be able to give his partner economic stability, and above all, he hopes to be able to be healthy. For this reason, he has opted for organics, in order to be at her side for many years to come.

loans.use: to buy organically raised cattle

loans.name: Duyên

texts.en:
Mrs Duyên is 26 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling seafood for 4 years.Duyên lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
In 2014, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business.
In the future, Duyên hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be happy and healthy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 56 years old and married with three children. Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, spices and other groceries. 

In the future Alma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. Vanna makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Tai's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five dependent children, Tai is 43 years old and living in a rural area of Battambang province. Two of her children are studying in high school.

Fishing and selling fishes are the main sources of her family’s income about twelve years. Her daily income is about 12USD per day. Recently, her fishing business is not going so well, so she could earn a very low income which really hard for her to support the whole family.

Tai has been with VisionFund for two cycles already and completely repaid back. Those two loans have helped her to be better support her family and able to send her children to school. Now, she is leading a group of six members to apply for a new Kiva loan. Tai is willing to use her entire new loan portion to buy fishing material to be able to catch more fish for sale and take the rest of money to buy more kind of fish to attract more customers. She hopes that her current business will be expanded through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment to be able to catch more fish for sale, so that she can increase her income to expand her current business.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa, a talented Lebanese mother of two, has a passion for knitting and has been practicing crochet for personal use for more than 10 years.

She is a married to a retired army officer and lives with her family in the area of Aley, Lebanon. One of her sons is attending engineering school and works at the same time while her husband currently works as a bus driver.

One year ago, Wafaa decided to start to turn her hobby into a business by selling her products in the neighborhood. With the success of her idea, she quickly saw the demand progressing and her income increasing. This allows her to help her husband in covering their son's tuition fees, education being a priority in the family.

For the first time, Wafaa is asking for 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa in order to buy new crochet accessories and supplies. The supplies she is planning to buy will allow her to come up with new patterns and impress her clients with new products which should positively affect her income.

loans.use: to buy new crochet accessories and supplies.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long pay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Essam

texts.en:
Essam is 43, married and has one son, and one daughter. He has a small clothing project and he previously requested 10,000 EGP and successfully repaid it on due dates.

He is currently requesting 15,000 EGP loan to buy more clothing to increase his income and afford his children's education expenses because of the beginning of the school year.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for his store.

loans.name: Musoma Agape Group

texts.en:
Paulina is in her mid 30s and is married with two school-aged children. She has been selling small dry fish (kiswahili dagaa) for five years now. She works from 07am to 06pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the dagaa stock and has managed to pay back her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase on the small dry fish (dagaa) stock. She dreams of owning a wholesale business.

Paulina will share this loan with her loan group Musoma AGAPE GROUP which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the small dry fish (dagaa) stock.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 63 years old, married with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Felicidad has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Felicidad requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Felicidad has been in this business for three years. In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Myrele

texts.en:
Myrele works hard to support her family. Myrele is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Myrele has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Myrele would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 39 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school, Analiza works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, noodles, etc. Analiza has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Analiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, noodles, etc

loans.name: Universal Group

texts.en:
Accra is the capital of Ghana and Teshie is in the northern part of Accra, Trade and fishery are the main economic activities. This group is made up of four members who are in service businesses like tailoring, barbering, and the sale of detergents and foodstuff.

Marvis (standing on the far left in the photograph), one of the men in the group is a tailor. He is 57 years old and resides with his wife and two children. Marvis has provided tailoring services to his customers for 13 years now with the support of his wife. He is doing very good business by fulfilling the demands of his customers on time. Marvis' monthly family income is not good enough so he is in need of financial support at an affordable interest rate.

With this loan, Marvis will purchase more material which he will use to sew both tops and trousers to sell to his customers. He hopes this will definitely help him to expand the business and to earn more profit.

Marvis’ dream is to provide a better education to his children for better future.

loans.use: to purchase more material which he will use to sew both tops and trousers to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Kiboco

texts.en:
Kiboco is the proud owner of Star of Hope Primary and Secondary School. The school has successfully provided education services to the children of Viwandani for over five years.

Last year, he learnt about Fresh Life Toilets and joined the movement by installing five facilities to serve his students and teachers.

So far, he has been proud of the visible positive impact Fresh Life Toilets have had upon his pupils such as improved personal hygiene practices such as hand washing. However due to the high number of students at his school, he hopes to increase the number of Fresh Life Toilets so as to serve the students better.

His current goal is to have additional facilities that will serve a total of one hundred and ten secondary school students.

Let's help him in acquiring two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.use: to pay for two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Sovanntheara's Group

texts.en:
Sovanntheara’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Sovanntheara does work as a teacher and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Krowor Ladies Group

texts.en:
These women entrepreneurs are part of the group called krowor ladies, Tehie, Accra-Ghana and they are three. They are into the sale of wigs, rice and charcoal. Leain is the lady standing in the middle of the photo. She is 28 years old and is living alone. She provides hair dressing service to her clients and also sell her products like wigs and creams to the customers. She started this business four years ago after she has completed her apprenticeship and has been working hard to grow her business. logically, she earns good profit for herself but she needs to grow the business further and also prepare herself in the future.

So Lealn is planning to expand her business. With the present loan, she will purchase more wigs and hair products so that she sell part and provide service with part. The profit that she will make will go into expansion of the business and save part of her future projects

loans.use: to purchase more wigs and hair products so that she sell part and provide service with part.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
As a farmer from Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Rey, 54 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near her house. She is a hard-working mother of three children and can earn approximately 2.5 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that she has done for more than twenty years.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Rey is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials.
She thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es: Carlos de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace 17 años al servicio y ventas de bicicletas y accesorios su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas repuestos para bicicletas y asi seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 42 years old. He lives in his own house with his two children. He has earned his living for 17 years repairing and selling bicycles and accessories. His business is located in his place of residence, and he has many customers because of his good work.

Carlos is requesting a loan for the purchase of more replacement parts for bicycles. This way, he will be able to continue with his work in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more replacement parts for bicycles

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Marina has been in this business for 10 years. Marina earns more income from food vending.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Pelita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Pelita is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fishing business.

Pelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
