Ararat is 34 years old and he lives with his brother in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Ararat is employed; he works at the private company as a driver-distributor. On his own truck to over 400 of markets, he distributes juices, sweets and candies. He likes his work and mentions that it allows him and his brother to cover their needs.

With this partnership with Kiva lenders Ararat wants to enlarge the assortment of his distributed products, since from the company he takes it at the beginning of the week and he does his best to distribute as much and as quickly as it is possible; so the more products he gives to markets the more his income rises.

So with this Kiva loan Ararat wants to enlarge the assortment sweets and juices and he also wants to buy winter tires for his truck for getting prepared for coming winter long moths.

loans.use: to buy winter tires for his truck for getting prepared for coming winter long moths

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 31 years old and married with three children who are in school, Shiela works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Shiela has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Shiela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 42, married and has 4 children. He has a small grocery store project and it is the only source of income to the family.

He previously requested 2 consecutive loans and successfully repaid them on due dates. He is requesting 10,000 EGP to buy some grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to increase his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products for his store, such as oil, rice and pasta. .

loans.name: Savry's Group

texts.en: Savry’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh province in Cambodia. Savry makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer teacher and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, soft drinks, eggs, etc for her general store business.

Ludy has been in this business for 5 years. Ludy earns more income from buy and sell ice drop.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ludy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, soft drinks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Nyabitete Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Jonah is the woman in yellow t-shirt on the left hand of the photo and she is married with 2 children who both go to school. Jonah owns a retail shop and bar at Nyabiteete trading centre which is her source of income plus money got by the husband, who is a carpenter, to meet family needs and also pay school fees for children. Jonah got married still young after dropping out of school and hence did not attain enough education, due to a lack of school fees. As a result she decided to start a retail shop and bar in order to earn a living and be occupied with work..

She is a member of Nyabiteete Twekambe group that has been with Ugafode for about 1 year and this being their second loan cycle. She decided to apply for a loan of ugx600,000shillings in order to add more stock in the shop and she aims at buying more crates of beer and sodas, sugar maize flour, rice, yellow bananas.

She says that her incomes will increase, her children will go to school and also earn a living after adding more capital in the shop and she is grateful to Kiva lenders for the financial support rendered to her and the colleagues in the group. These group members thank Ugafode for financial assistance which will help to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to boost her retail trade business.

loans.name: Elba Esther

texts.es: Elba es una comerciante de artículos varios que inició esta actividad cuando se encontraba en una situación difícil; ella necesitaba generar recursos para el sustento de sus hijos puesto que al encontrarse separada y sin el apoyo de una pareja que la respaldara con los gastos en el hogar, no tuvo más alternativa que emprender su propio negocio. Se incorporó a empresas de comercialización por medio de catálogos, de este modo empezó a promover ventas entre sus conocidos, amigos, referidos y familiares, dedicando diariamente seis horas a esta actividad. En la actualidad Elba cuenta con ocho años en el negocio y ha logrado aportar bienestar a su familia, es por ello que desea continuar más consolidada y está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que atenderá pedidos de su clientela y la compra de mercancías varias para provisionarse para el fin de año. Su meta a futuro es fortalecer su capital de negocio y tener utilidades mucho mayores.
texts.en:
Elba is a seller of a variety of items. She started this activity when she found herself in a difficult situation; she needed to generate resources to provide for her children when she became separated. Without the support of a spouse who would help her out with household expenses, she had no choice but to start her own business. She joined catalog-sales companies, and in that way began to promote sales among her acquaintances, friends, and relatives, working at that activity for six hours a day.

Currently, Elba has been in this business for eight years and has managed to provide for her family's wellbeing. That's why she would like to continue consolidating her business; she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will fill customer orders and buy various merchandise to stock up for the holiday season. Her goal for the future is to strengthen her business capital and have much greater profits.

loans.use: to fill customer orders and buy various merchandise

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 38-year-old man married with six children. He is a repeat client with the institution. He deals in secondhand shoes, a job he has done for 10 years. However, Wilson found out that his capital alone cannot enable him to expand his business. Therefore, Wilson decided to join UGAFODE to access financial assistance to boost his business. Wilson has been taking loans from UGAFODE, which has boosted his business, and he has been able to increase his income and  meet his family's financial needs. Wilson applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more shoes for his business to serve the available market. The client praises UGAFODE for the financial support it has extended to him, which has enabled him to sustain his business and pay fees for his children.

loans.use: To boost his shoe trade business by buying more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To move to a more secure location.

loans.name: Narinee

texts.en:
Narinee is an artisan from Thailand who specializes in silver and marcasite hand-crafted jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver.

Narinee has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story:

"I have a special fascination with marcasite jewelry. The glistening stone allows me to create and design thousands of patterns. My inspiration comes from all that impresses me, like the exotic shape of a flower, the intricate patterns on lace, and small pretty animals."

"I am preparing jewelry for the upcoming high season. This will require a large investment, so your support through this microcredit comes at the perfect time."

Use the link below to view Narinee's silver and marcasite hand-crafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/7307

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver

loans.name: Exmilson Ipolito

texts.en:
Exmilson is turning 70 years old, is a "cañicultor" (planting sugar cane). He lives and works in Ibarra’s rural zone, which suffers drought caused by climate change. He’s married and has 7 children, all of them just finished primary education and they are all adults. He lives with his wife and his 24 year old daughter.

He has dedicated his entire life to sugar cane cultivation,. Today he needs a loan to buy fertilizers and pay for tractor hire. His biggest worries are plagues which can damage his crop.

He is an entrepreneur, dreamer and disciplined. He carries 40 years of tireless work and his biggest life goal is to buy another small land to improve his family’s life and help other children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for tractor hire.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 75 years old and he works as a driver. He has been in this activity for over 10 years and he needs a new loan to buy an engine for his vehicle.

He hopes you can help him because he is a widower. He has a daughter but she has her own expenses and can't help him although she gives him a place to live. Victor is living with his daughter and he helps her with the expenses. In the picture you can see Victor and his son in law is behind him Victor is at the place where he lives

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, women's accessories, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is a 51-year-old widow. Her husband died one year ago and since that time she’s had to fight and move on alone. She takes care of the house and her two children and granddaughter. Her daughter studies at the university.

Presentacion’s life has been hard; she lives far away of the city in the moor so she always wakes up early because she has to feed the animals around 4 or 5 am every day. After that she has to go out to the city to sale her dairy products; they are produced in her community. With this activity she tries to solve her economic problems.

20 years ago, she began to raise guinea pigs, rabbits and pork to improve the life of her family but she doesn’t have an appropriate infrastructure hence and some of them die. She looks forward to have a safe place to raise the animals.

Her main concern is to support the family and her granddaughter’s health. She wants to continue raising animals and stop selling her dairy products because she doesn’t want to go out the city. This loan will allow her and her family to build a piggery, buy animal food and try to raise all the animals in the best condition to get more income.

loans.use: to build a piggery and to buy animal food to try to raise all the animals in the best condition to get more income.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en:
Alexandre is an artisan from Brazil who specializes in gemstone sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones and wire.
Alexandre has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story:

"I have always loved gemstones and when I was a kid I would go to a place where they lapidated stones and helped by sorting them out. I went because I wanted to, and I would spend all my time there, unless I was at school. Eventually I began to learn how to sculpt gemstone figurines, which was a slow process. I began sculpting birds by first observing a model I liked and then replicating it. Sometimes I would take photographs of nature, and then replicate what I shot with stones. Birds are my specialty, and amethyst and quartz are my favorite gems. My wife helps me by mounting the pieces. I enjoy working with her. Our workshop is at home, which is very convenient because I like to work at night. I believe that Brazilian arts and crafts are very beautiful and creative, therefore I feel very happy to know that I contribute to my country's legacy with my gemstone birds."

"The support received by way of this microcredit is very important, and offers the stability and continuity I need to continue crafting my works."

Use the link below to view Alexandre's gemstone sculptures on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/6233

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones and wire

loans.name: Jehova Jireh 2 Group

texts.en:
Nivelore is one of the members of Jehova Jireh 2. This group comprised of Haitian immigrants and they are located in the city of Hato Mayor, which is one the most rural cities in the country and whose economy is dependent on agriculture. These five entrepreneurs are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community.

Nivelore, a Haitian mother living in the Bateyes in Dominican Republic, makes her home in a simple structure with one of her two children. They live together in her rural area surrounded by mountains. She is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza. She sells miscellaneous products like shoes, cosmetics, women's accessories, men and kid's clothing and other different products.

This loan is intended to increase her inventory.

She will use the profits to cover her home expenses; as a single mom she is in charge of her family. Also, she is planning to reinvest in the success of her business. She thanks you all for your support

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products

loans.name: Las Cayenas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is one of the members of Las Cayenas (Dominican name of the hibiscus flower) 1 & 2. This group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, in a community district called Los Alcarrizos. These 10 businesspeople are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community.

Rosa runs two business; one is to make empanadas (a dough filled with meat or vegetables) and another is selling used clothes that she buys in special packets with hundreds of pieces.

Rosa makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and three children. They live together in this neighborhood of scarce resources. She is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza.

She will uses this loan to buy clothes and ingredients (flour, cooking oil, meat, vegetables) to make empanadas.

She will use the profits to reinvest in her businesses and to provide her family all they need, helping her husband with their expenses at home. She thanks you all for your support

loans.use: to buy used clothes and ingredients to cook empanadas.

loans.name: Mujeres En Esperanza 5 Group

texts.en:
Sugeiry is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres en Esperanza (Hope women) 5. Her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently moved from the Haiti to the DR) clients. Her group is based in the Santo Domingo Norte, where most of the people who live in this part of the capital are citizens with many needs.

Here she makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and a child. Sugeiry is excited to take her third loan from Esperanza.

She plans to use this loan to improve her fritura (a food stall where you can buy fried food, especially for breakfast and dinner, by purchasing some ingredients like chicken, beef, flour to make dough to fry and fill it. She also sells vegetables like plantains, sweet potatoes, etc. Sugeiry says she enjoys doing business, specially cooking. Her most important dream is to have a successful business to produce enough income to have a tranquil life along with her family.

She will continuing saving and re-investing her business profits. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, flour, etc.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
“What I have always wanted is to give my family a better living condition. That's why I'm working hard to expand my business, so I can earn enough. I also want them to be always safe.” This is what Jinky, a 46-year-old mother from Batasan, Quezon City aspires to do.

It's for these reasons that she has kept her business in food supplement distribution going for ten years now. This is a good source of income for her since her common patrons are mostly her neighbors. With her different products, she is able to earn at least PHP 9,000 a month, which serves as a remedy for their family’s diverse expenses and needs.

Together with her husband, she dreams of upgrading their socio-economic status. With this aspiration in mind, she wants to develop her inventory by asking for a loan from you that will definitely enable her to purchase more food supplements to sell. An amount of PHP 10,000 will be enough to realize this goal.

With hope and trust, she believes that you will help her grasp a better future ahead. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more food supplements for her business.

loans.name: Yellow Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Adama who is 50 years old was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She is married with four children. Her children are all school going children.

Adama belongs to a solidarity group of four women, who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams. “Yellow” is the name of Adama’s solidarity group. “Yellow” group needs a total loan of 4,000,000SLL of which Adama will receive 1,000,000SLL in order to purchase more bags of rice for her business.

Adama trades in rice in a rented shop right in the city centre of Freetown. Her business which has been in existence for over seventeen years is the main source of her livelihood and that of her family and supports her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week from 7 am to 6 pm. Adama is a hardworking woman, See Adama (left of the group picture).

In the future, Adama plans to support her children to acquire university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman. She will be very appreciative to anyone that can help. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 38 ans, Adjo est femme habitant à Tokoin avec ses deux enfants à charge. Adjo produit et vend du jus fait avec du maïs et du sucre généralement appelé « AKPAN GLACE ». Adjo s’approvisionne du nécessaire une fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route et dans les quartiers environnant. Adjo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs et des boites de lait concentré en vue de bien vendre afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en: Adio is a widow aged 38. She lives in Tokoin with her two dependent children. Adio makes and sells juice made with corn and sugar generally called “Apkan Ice”. Adio buys the stock that she needs for her business once a month at the market and sells her goods on the roadside and in the local area, Adio requests this loan to order bowls of corn and bowls of condensed milk  to make a good number of sales, to satisfy the demands of her clients, and to have considerable financial autonomy to enable her to help her children with their education

loans.use: to buy 45 bowls of corn and 15 tins of condensed milk.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a 46-year-old married woman with three children, two attend school.

Mary Jean works hard to provide for her family and has sold rice for 24 years. She requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy rice to sell.

Mary Jean has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF and earns additional income operating a general store.

Mary Jean aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy  rice to sell.

loans.name: Ismael Horacio

texts.en:
Horacio is 20 and he is the last of 5 children.His brothers have their own families. Horacio’s mother is his only support, but nowadays she can’t help him economically with the household economy.

Two years ago he finished his studies in a technical college in “Design Arts”.
Before he finished the college he used to work making ceramic crafts, with his design teacher to help himself pay for college. Throughout his life he’s had to deal with difficult family situations. 5 years ago his father abandoned them and then divorced his mother, but It hasn’t been an obstacle to move on.

One year ago, he started to make ceramic crafts in his house, but he doesn’t have the equipment necessary to perform such crafts. For this reason he has to send his crafts to other handicraftsman to improve the look of the craft and sell them for a better price.
He really wants to finish his studies in the university and to be a professional in “Design Arts”, but he and his mother don’t have money to reach it.

He is looking forward with this loan to improve the workshop’s equipment and infrastructure. The key equipment he needs is an oven because it helps to improve the craft’s look. He considers himself as an entrepreneur and his neighbors see in Horacio a model for themselves and their children.

loans.use: to improve his workshop’s equipment and purchase a oven to have a professional finish for his ceramic crafts.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her 4 children and family.

She grows seaweed and earns additional income from fishing. Letecia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase seaweed seedlings and plastic rope.

Letecia has sustained her business through 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase  seaweed seedlings and plastic rope.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 55-year-old married woman with seven children, two attend school.

She has earned a living growing coconut for 20 years and is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

She earns additional income buying and selling gasoline.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is a 33-year-old married woman with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 3 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods and personal care products.

Eden has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF. She earns additional income raising pigs.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and personal care product.

loans.name: Melany

texts.en:
Melany is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children, five attend school.

She runs a general store and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase soap, milk, biscuits, chips, bread, and noodles.

She earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Melany wishes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, biscuits, chips, bread, and noodles.

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
Maximiliano, de 42 años de edad, estudio para profesor, está casado, su esposa tiene un negocio de venta de hamburguesas y hog-dog, no tienen hijos y viven en casa familiar.

Maximiliano, tiene varios años de trabajar como docente, quien por el gran esfuerzo de sus padres logró sacar la carrera y ahora le sirve, pero además de ser profesor, los fines de semanas y por las noches anda con una orquesta musical.

Maximiliano, necesita el préstamo para complementar el dinero para comprar un vehículo, porque lo necesita para trasladarse a su trabajo, puesto que el lugar donde trabaja no hay mucho transporte, de esa forma mejorara considerablemente su vida.

El sueña con trabajar y ahorrar un poco y tener las condiciones favorables para él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Maximiliano is 42 years old and studied to be a teacher. He is married. His wife has a business selling hamburgers and hotdogs. The couple has no children, and lives in a house.

Maximiliano has been working as a teacher for a number of years. Owing to his parents' efforts he managed to move forward with his studies and this has helped him. However, in addition to working as a teacher, Maximiliano is part of a music group in the evenings and at the weekend.

Maximiliano needs this loan to add to the savings he has in order to buy a vehicle. He needs the vehicle in order to arrive at work as there are few transport links to the school. Having his own vehicle will help Maximiliano to improve his life a great deal.

Maximiliano's dream is to work, save up a little. and enjoy pleasant living conditions with his wife.

loans.use: to have enough money to buy a car.

loans.name: Adelinda Cecilia

texts.es: Adelinda incansable y trabajadora, se encuentra divorciada y tiene tres hijos Adriana, Nataly y Santiago que dependen de ella y  los apoya incondicionalmente en todo sentido. La necesidad le obligo a iniciar una pequeña tienda  hace veinte años atrás ya que su esposo nunca se responsabilizó con el hogar, todos los días se levanta a trabajar muy temprano y cierra a las diez de la noche, empezó ganando un litro de leche y cinco panes diarios para alimentar a sus hijos  poco a poco  trata de surtir su negocio. Adelinda necesita el dinero para adquirir más productos, obtener mayores ingresos con ello cubrir los gastos de sus hijos ya que ella desea que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Tireless and hard-working Adelinda is divorced and has three children - Adriana, Nataly and Santiago - who all depend on her. Adelinda supports them unconditionally in every way possible.

Adelinda had to open a small shop 20 years ago as her husband never helped to look after the household. Every day Adelinda wakes up very early in order to work. She closes the shop at 10pm. When she started, she earned a litre of milk and five pieces of bread to feed her children but gradually she stocked up her business.

Adelinda needs this loan in order to buy more products and earn a higher income. With this income, Adelinda wants to cover her children's expenses as she wants them to continue in education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock up her shop.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz  is 40 years old, married with three children.

Ma. Luz  works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Ma. Luz  has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling firewood.

Ma. Luz  aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Liezel has been in this business for 20 years. Liezel earns more income from buy and sell fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
Nerlita is 51 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 5 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy shampoo, soap, milk, can goods, and eggs.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  shampoo, soap, milk, can goods, and eggs.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a 47-year-old married woman with two children who works very hard to provide for them.

She has run a general store for 5 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase household goods to sell.

In the future Remedios would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, one child attends school.

She has grown vegetables for 16 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

She has previously borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a 35-year-old married woman with one school-aged child. Jonalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jonalyn has runs a general store for 9 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now needs another loan to further build her businesses.

Jonalyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, spices, bread, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en: Chan’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. Chan makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is 33 years old and single. He is very energetic and passionate at work. Elnur is the one working in the family and taking care of his old parents. He is working as a mechanical engineer. Elnur’s salary isn’t enough to take care of family needs. Now a sudden need has arisen. His mother is very ill. He is suffering from an illness in his liver. He has taken himself several times to doctors and now they have asked him to buy some medical pills. He needs a loan of 500 AZN to buy the necessary drugs. Kiva lenders can show their support for Elnur.

loans.use: to buy some medical pills.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family through a 16-year-old nipa roofing business.

She requests 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and needs an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Esther works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling coconut wine. Esther is borrowing 11,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pan dulce, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 41 years old and has one child still in school.

Mary Jane has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish, salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 21 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Jolinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jolinda works hard to support her family. She has a food production/vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store.

Jolinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production/vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Jolinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production/vending business

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: Carlos es un joven de 25 años residente en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, cuya familia es comerciante y en su vivienda habían construido un local que se encontraba desocupado por lo que este emprendedor le propuso a sus padres que se lo cedieran para colocar una heladería, negocio en el que vio oportunidad debido a que en el sector no existía negocios de este mismo tipo y que él podría crear una plaza.  Hace dos años Carlos cuenta con una heladería en la que ofrece un variado surtido y con la finalidad de crecer en su negocio, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en nuevas presentaciones de helado e insumos, con lo que logrará inyectar un capital para brindar una mayor estabilidad y posibilidades de inversión con las que podrá aprovechar promociones y promover mayores ventas. Su meta a futuro es abrir un punto más grande y continuar con sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man, 25 years old, who lives in a neighborhood in the city of Soledad and who comes from a family of shop owners. They had built a storefront in their home and it was vacant, so this entrepreneur made a proposal to his parents to hand it over to him to put in an ice-cream shop. He saw an opportunity with this business because there were no businesses of this same type in the area and he could create a market.

For two years, Carlos has had an ice-cream shop that offers a variety of products. With the goal of growing his business, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in new types of ice cream and supplies. The injection of capital will provide greater stability and the possibility of investment, to be able to take advantage of promotions and promote greater sales.

His future goal is to open a larger locale and to continue his professional education.

loans.use: to invest in new styles of ice creams and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Grupo San Miguelito 4 Group

texts.es: Pascuala (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía de blusa café) es una mujer de 37 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia con la que vive, ella cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior logro darle a su cultivo de banano su mantenimiento necesario y a Dios gracias obtuvo una muy buena cosecha y logro venderlo en su mercado regional a un buen precio, y con ello compro media cuerda de terreno para su cultivo. Pascuala por la confianza que su grupo le tiene nuevamente la eligieron, ahora Pascuala solicita otro préstamo para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Ella espera obtener una buena cosecha en esta temporada. Su esperanza de vida es ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Pascuala (the first on the left in the photograph in the brown shirt) is a 37-year-old woman. She is married with a beautiful family with whom she lives. She says that thanks to her previous loan, she succeeded in giving her banana crop the care is needs. Thanks to God, she got a very good crop and succeeded in selling it in the regional market at a good price. With this, she bought some land for her crop.

Pascuala was chosen again by her group because of the trust they have in her. Now Pascuala requests another loan to take care of her coffee crop. She hopes to get a good harvest in his season. Her hope for life is to see her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, de 72 años de edad, no estudio, está casado, tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José, se dedica a la agricultura y siembra granos básicos, sus hijos le apoyan y su esposa es quien les da la alimentación a él y a los mozos que tiene.

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes y abono para su milpa, para obtener una buena cosecha y obtener ingresos cuando se venda el producto y dejar para su familia.

El sueño de José, es mejorar su calidad de vida y que este año sea mejor la cosecha y siempre obtener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 72 years old, didn't study, and is married. He has two children who are already adults. His wife is dedicated to household work.

Jose is dedicated to agriculture and grows basic grains. His children support him, and his wife is the one who feeds them.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and manure for his corn. This will help him get a good harvest and earn income when he sells the product and leaves it for his family.

Jose's dream is to improve his quality of life and, this year, to have a better harvest and always earn a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for his corn.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, canned goods and spices.

Grace has been in this business for 14 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, canned goods and spices.

loans.name: Meycil

texts.en:
Meycil is 28 years old and single with three children. Meycil works very hard to provide for them.

Meycil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods and personal care products.

Meycil has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future Meycil would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Grupo Casa Grande Group

texts.es:
Catalina es una  gran mujer de 25 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de un hijo de 8 años, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de San Antonio Suchitepéquez.
Catalina (es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) trabaja con mucha dedicación y con entusiasmo, ella tiene tres años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas, este negocio se ubica en su casa de habitación  y esto le permite realizar otras actividades pero también cuidar mejor de su hijo. Catalina gracias a su esmero vende tortillas deliciosas e higiénicas, por esa razón mucha gente la visita muy continuamente, y con el afán de satisfacer a toda la clientela solicita un préstamo para la compra maíz y leña. Catalina tiene las esperanzas de mejorar sus servicios con esta inversión. Su esperanza  de vida es construir una casa de block más amplio para mejor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Catalina is a remarkable 25-year-old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family, with an 8-year-old son. This beloved family lives in a community in San Antonio Suchitepéquez.

Catalina (first from the right in the photo) works with a lot of dedication and enthusiasm. For three years, she has made a living by selling tortillas. This business is located in her home, which allows her to carry out other activities but also take better care of her son.

Thanks to her carefulness, Catalina sells delicious and clean tortillas, so many people are constantly coming to visit her. Eager to satisfy all of her customers, Catalina is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood.

Catalina has hopes of improving her services through this investment. Her life's dream is to build a larger house of cement blocks, for her family's increased comfort.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is a 64-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nemia has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Nemia requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Nemia has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, fish net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 53-year-old married woman with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items such as soap, milk, noodles, sugar and coffee.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items such as soap, milk, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, de 37 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en gobernación, tienen dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad y los dos van a la escuela.

Reina, con el fin de ayudarle a su esposo a obtener algunos ingresos se ha dedicado a la elaboración de hamacas desde hace muchos años, en el mes elabora ocho hamacas.
 
Reina, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar hamacas, ya que tiene muchos encargos y el hilo esta bien caro de esa manera le ayudara para que mejore sus ingresos y la vida de sus familias.

El sueño de Reina, es siempre mantener el negocio y sus buenos clientes.
texts.en:
37-year-old Reina did not attend school. She is in a relationship, and her spouse works for the government. They have two children, 16 and 10 years old, who both attend school.

With the goal of helping her husband obtain some income, Reina has worked making hammocks for many years. She makes 8 hammocks a month.

Reina needs the loan to buy materials to make hammocks, because she has many orders and the thread is quite expensive. In this way, you will help her improve her income and her family's life.

Reina's dream is to always maintain the business and her good customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make hammocks

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old, and married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Josephine has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Nema

texts.en:
Maria Nema is 47 years old and is a widow with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, sardines, chips, noodles, etc. to sell.

Ma. Nema has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, sardines, chips, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sandrita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sandrita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Sandrita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

Sandrita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina lives in Same. She is a business women and she has a kiosk, so now she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

Carolina started to open her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $1,500. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as detergents, sugar, cooking oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sardines, biscuits, noodles and other things to sell.

She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods, and she hopes with this loan she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy detergents, sugar, cooking oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sardines, biscuits, noodles and other things to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 63 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are currently in school.

Vilma is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Vilma has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is 27 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child still in school.

Cathy is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Cathy has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann is 26 years old and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. Rose Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Rose Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods and personal care products.

Rose Ann has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Rose Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods and personal care products.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre San Isidro  está en el 1er. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Sra. Eugenia quien tiene un comedor donde tiene menús todos los días y comidas rápidas, es una mujer muy trabajadora que deleita a sus clientes con las delicias que prepara. Ella poco a poco está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo y las comidas que vende.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer comidas, como ser: carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir haciendo una buena variedad de comida para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named “San Isidro” is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are participating in the poverty elimination program and are striving to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Eugenia, who has an eatery where she serves à la carte dishes and fast food every day. She is a hardworking woman who delights her customers with the delicious food that she prepares. Eugenia is gradually doing her best so that she can help her family through her work and the food that she sells.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of supplies for preparing her dishes such as meat, condiments, greens, baked goods, and other ingredients. This will allow her to continue preparing a wide variety of foods for her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, greens, baked goods, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Penie Jean

texts.en:
Penie Jean is 34 years old and has three children. She is single and her three children are currently in school.

Penie Jean is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Penie Jean has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 73 years old. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nilda has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Nilda has been in this business for 50 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул, 43 года, не замужем, есть дочь дошкольного возраста. Назгул занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 дойные коровы, 6 лошадей. На участке 4,0 Га земли она выращивает клевер для реализации. Ежедневно продает экологически чистое вкусное молоко. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения поголовья скота и объемов реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса, также она мечтает накопить средства на открытие продуктового магазина.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 43 years old, not married, and has a preschool-aged daughter. Nazgul does agricultural work, and currently has 4 milk cows and 6 horses. On a 4.0 hectare plot of land, she grows clover for resale. She sells delicious organic milk daily.

In order to further develop her farm, Nazgul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy dairy cows so that she can increase her headcount of livestock and her volume of organic milk for sale. Nazgul plans to invest the income from her loan in the further strengthening of her business, and she also dreams of saving the funds to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy some dairy cows to increase her amount of organic milk for sale.

loans.name: Marithel

texts.en:
A married woman with four children, all of whom are in school, 34-year-old Marithel is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has been operating a fishing business in the Philippines for 10 years now.

Marithel has requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 50-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She has been farming rice in the Philippines for 10 years now.

Marilou, who has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her enterprise, has requested a PHP 24000 loan to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers. In the future, she would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
Maria, es una señora de sesenta y cinco años de edad, que siempre ha trabajado muy duro para salir adelante, ella solo aprobó la primaria, no obstante, eso no la detuvo para que fuese emprendedora. En la actualidad ella vende productos de belleza y también tiene un puesto de comida en su casa de habitación. 
Ella ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar cosméticos y prendas de acero inoxidable, dado que su clientela está demandando estos artículos. En un futuro desea poder optar a otro financiamiento para invertirlo en su venta de comida. Ella aún tiene muchos metas como mujer comerciante, no descansara hasta cumplirlas.
texts.en:
Maria is a sixty-five year old lady who has always worked very hard to get ahead. She only passed primary school, however, that didn’t stop her, and she became an entrepreneur. Currently, she sells beauty products, and she also has a food stand in her home.

She has turned to Kiva and MiCrédito so that she can get a loan to buy cosmetics and stainless steel jewelry since her clientele demands these products. In the future, she wants to be eligible for financing to invest in her food sales. She still has many goals as a businesswoman, and she will not rest until she achieves them.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and stainless steel jewelry.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela estudia la carrera de Administración de Empresas, es una excelente persona  muy dedicada a sus estudios, siempre se esfuerza para poder alcanzar sus metas. 
Su sueño es terminar su carrera y el día de mañana trabajar de forma independiente y enseñar en las Universidades así poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Graciela is studying for a degree in Business Administration. She is an outstanding individual who is extremely dedicated to her studies and always trying to reach her goals. Her dream is to finish her degree and someday work independently and also teach at the university level. In addition, she would like to help her family.

Graciela is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her degree fees. This would allow her to continue her studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
A 32-year-old married mother of two residing in Banadero with her family, Jocelyn owns and operates a transportation service to earn a living. For over eight years, she has sustained it and been able to provide for the educational needs of her children.

Jocelyn repaid her previous loan used to buy spare parts and tires for her motorcycle. She has requested a new loan to pay for motor parts and repair costs for her motorcycle. Her future plan is to buy a four-wheeled vehicle for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Annilyn

texts.en:
Annilyn is a 43-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are presently in school. She has been farming bananas in the Philippines for 12 years now.

Annilyn, who has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, has requested a new loan of PHP 12000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Alcidia

texts.es:
María, de 52 años de edad, solo estudio hasta sexto grado, ya que por motivos económicos en aquella época los padres no le pudieron ayudar, está acompañada, el esposo se dedica a la agricultura en su casa y vive solo con su madre, ya que los dos hijos que ella procreo ya están acompañados.

María, vende productos de primera necesidad desde hace más de 5 años, lo aprendió por si sola y ahora es una fuente de ingreso que le está dando ganancias para poder comprar los alimentos necesarios para ella y su madre.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para surtir la tienda y mejorar su calidad de vida porque así vivirá mejor con su madre.

María, sueña con tener un negocio más fuerte.
texts.en:
María, who is 52 years old, only studied up to the sixth grade because at that time her parents could not support her for financial reasons. She is married, her husband works in agriculture at their home and they live with her mother, because the two children she had are now married.
María has sold basic necessities for more than 5 years. She learned the business by herself and it is now a source of income which is earning her profits to be able to buy the food which she and her mother need.
María needs the loan to buy more products to stock the shop and to improve her quality of life so she will live better with her mother. María dreams of having a stronger business.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de queso y chicharrones se dedica a la s ventas desde hace 6 años y gracias a su trabajo es comp ha podido salir adelante, el joven actualmente vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas queso y chicharrones todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: This young man, whose face has been pixelated because he’s twenty-one years old and lives in a high-risk area, works selling cheese and chicharrones (pork skin cracklings). He has worked selling these items for six years, and thanks to his job has been able to get ahead. This young man currently lives in his own home with his partner and their son. He is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale cheese and chicharrones to continue his sales; that way he can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale cheese and chicharrones (pork skin cracklings).

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, tambien se dedica a la agricultura, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, la joven es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con su hija de 7 años de edad, ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young girl has her face pixelated because she is 27 years old and lives in a high risk area.
She has owned a boiled corn mill located in her place of residence for the last 8 years. She also works in agriculture, and what she makes from her sales allows her to cover some expenses around the home. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her 7 year old daughter.
She is asking for a loan again to buy what she needs for the mill like belts, disks, knives, etc., so she can get a better income.

loans.use: to buy belts, disks, knives, etc.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two, Anecita works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from operating a bicycle taxi.

Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She has requested a new PHP 20,000 loan in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Anecita hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Criste

texts.en:
Criste is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and her three children are still in school.

Criste is in an agricultural business farming fruits in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Criste has been in this business for 14 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Criste would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
A 54-year-old married mother of three, Marilyn has been raising pigs in the Philippines for nine years, and also earns income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Narilyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam works hard to support her family. Meriam is married and has a "buy-and-sell" vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Meriam has been in this business for ten years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Grupo San Miguelito Group

texts.es:
Catarina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía)  es una mujer amable, y perseverante  tiene 39 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 9 y 19 años de edad, ellos viven en una comunidad del caserío san miguelito. Catarina para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la producción de café, con esta actividad lleva ella 7 años de realizarlo, gracias a esta labor a su familia ha sacado adelante. Catarina es la representante del grupo san miguelito, gracias a su perseverancia la gente de su comunidad le tiene profunda admiración. En estos días sus parcelas de café ya necesitan que se les de  mantenimiento de la temporada pero su dificultad es no contar con recursos económicos suficientes por esa razón solicita un préstamo  para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra.
Su esperanza de vida es la construcción de dos casa de block para mejor estabilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Catarina (the first on the left in the photo) is a kind and determined 39 year old woman. She is married with a beautiful family of four children who are all aged between 9 and 19 years old. They live in a community in the small village San Miguelito.
To earn an income, Catarina works producing coffee which she has done for 7 years. Thanks to this work her family has got ahead. Catarina is the representative of the San Miguelito group, and thanks to her perseverance the people of her community have deep admiration for her.
These days her coffee plots need seasonal maintenance work, but her difficulty is that she does not have sufficient financial resources. For that reason she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pay for manual labor.
Her life hope is to build two block houses for better stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children who are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase farm supplies and pay for laborers' salaries.

She supplements this income with earnings from her business buying and selling rice.

Mary Jane dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 50-year-old married mother of five children, one of whom is still in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business (pig fattening) in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Teresita has been in this business for nine years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
A 57-year-old married mother of six, Narcisa works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a general store in the Philippines for 10 years, and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Narcisa, who has borrowed and repaid 25 previous loans from NWTF, has requested a new loan for PHP 13000 to purchase additional stocks of sugar, oil, soap, noodles, etc. to sell. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of sugar, oil, soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru: Анна, 29 лет, в разводе, есть сын, ему 10 лет, ходит в школу. Анна с сыном, ее мамой живут все вместе. У Анны средне-специальное образование. Она работает директором в компании, предоставляющей услуги такси. Ее ежемесячная заработная плата составляет около 14,000 сом (KGS). Анна обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на утепление дома. На кредитные средства Анна приобретет пластиковые окна и балконную дверь, утеплит крышу и стены, приобретет регулятор теплого пола в ванную комнату. Проведенные ремонтные мероприятия позволят утеплить дом, создав благоприятные условия для сына и мамы Анны, а также позволят снизить затраты электроэнергии и экономить на оплате за отопление.
texts.en:
Anna is 29 years old, divorced, and has a son. Her son is 10 years old and goes to school. Anna, her son, and her mother all live together. Anna has a specialist secondary education. She works as the director of a taxi company. Her monthly salary is around 14,000 som (KGS).

Anna has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to insulate her house. With the loaned money, Anna will purchase plastic windows and a balcony door, insulate her roof and walls, and purchase a baseboard heater for her bathroom. Carrying out these measures will allow Anna to insulate her house and create favorable conditions for her mother and son. It will also allow Anna to reduce her spending on electricity, and be more economical by paying less for heating.

loans.use: to insulate her house by purchasing plastic windows and a door and insulating the roof and walls.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is a business women and she has a small kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, gambling cards, soft drinks and other things to sell. Ermelinda started to open her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $400.

She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, gambling cards, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es:
El grupo que lleva por nombre “Las Solidarias” está en su cuarto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de ellas es la señora Virginia quien se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas variadas, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se esfuerza por poder ir mejorando poco a poco su emprendimiento.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como ser: remeras, camisas, jeans, y otros,  y así poder seguir con sus ventas, cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group is called “Las Solidarias” and it is in its fourth loan cycle in the women's committee program, where the goal is to eliminate poverty, fighting to improve the living conditions of the women and their families.

One of the women is Virginia, who works to be able to improve her living conditions and that of her loved ones. She sells various pieces of clothing. She is a very hard-working woman who makes effort to be able to continue improving her business little by little.

She seeks this loan in order to be able to buy various clothing items to sell such as shirts, jeans, and other items in order to continue with her sales, meeting the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items to sell such as shirts, jeans, and other items.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 38 años es un padre de familia que encontró la oportunidad de generar ingresos adicionales para su familia por intermedio del comercio de bisutería en acero y oro golfi, actividad que desarrolla alterno a su actividad principal como guardia de seguridad.  Sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de trabajos a quienes les vende por encargos y les ofrece facilidad de pago según su flujo de efectivo.  Sus compras las realiza a almacenes en el centro de la Barranquilla que es su ciudad de residencia y las cancela de contado, es por ello que necesita más capital para realizar las comprar de sus encargos. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en cadenas, pulseras, aretes y anillos, que le han solicitado sus clientes. Con esta inversión podrá innovar sus surtido y obtener mayores ganancias para el beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
38 year old Julio is a father who saw the opportunity to generate additional income for his family by trading steel and gold plate jewelry. He has developed this activity as an alternative to his main work as a security guard. His main customers are his work colleagues to whom he sells to order and he offers them the facility of paying according to their cash flow.
His purchases are made in department stores in the centre of Barranquilla, his home city, and are paid for in cash. It is for that reason that he needs more capital to make purchases to meet his orders.
He is now applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in chains, bracelets, earrings and rings, which his customers have ordered. With this investment he will be able to update his stock and earn higher profits to benefit his family.

loans.use: to invest in chains, bracelets, earrings and rings, which his clients have requested.

loans.name: Tanya

texts.en:
Tanya has been working in the daycare business for more than 10 years. She gave up her career when she saw how her daughter's poor quality daycare was negatively affecting her. Tanya started her own daycare to be with her daughter and provide better care for local children. 

Tanya's husband lost his job about three years ago due to injury, so he has decided to go back to school. Tanya has kept her daycare thriving in this difficult time and continues to improve it, so she can provide income for her family. 

Tanya will use her Kiva loan to buy more furniture and learning materials for her daycare. She wants to bring a new level of quality care to her business by making a more comfortable play area and by providing enriching books and educational tools for the children she cares for.

loans.use: to buy more furniture and learning materials for her daycare.

loans.name: Leoncio Agapito

texts.es: Leoncio es un hombre de 55 años que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Talamolle Viejo, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él se dedica a trabajos múltiples como peonaje agrícola y cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por alfalfa orgánica que él mismo cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cuatro vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder darle a su pareja estabilidad económica y sobre todo espera poder tener salud, es por ello que apuesta por lo orgánico, para seguir estando junto a su ella por mucho tiempo más.
texts.en: Leoncio is a 55 year old man who lives with his wife in Talamolle Viejo, located in Moquegua. He has many jobs such as agricultural laborer and raising organic cattle, placing a lot of attention on the care and feeding he provides them. The feed consists of organic alfalfa that he grows himself. He seeks a microloan in order to be able to buy 4 organic cows. He hopes to sell the milk at a better price since it will be organic. In the future he hopes to be able to provide economic stability to his wife and above all to be able to have good health, which is why he supports organic, in order to be with her for many more years.

loans.use: to buy organic cattle.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a 54-year-old married mother of one. Her child is still in school.

Emely is in the agricultural business (vegetable farming) in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds, and other farm supplies.

Emely has been in this business for twenty years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emely would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nedelyn

texts.en:
Nedelyn is 38 years old, married, and has three children.

Nedelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a "buy-and-sell" feeds business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds to sell.

Nedelyn has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the "buy-and-sell" feeds business for 11 years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Medalla Milagrosa“ está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para que cada una conozca su situación de vida, y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Graciela, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una pobreza extrema, pero ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la elaboración de comidas que está haciendo, lucha por mejorar cada día sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Comenta que gracias a que sus comidas son muy ricas, ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las comidas que vende.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer comidas, como ser: verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su emprendimiento  como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The “Medalla Milagrosa“ group is making the quest to eliminate poverty, so that each knows her own situation and can thus improve her living conditions.

One of the members is Graciela, who per her survey demonstrated a level one poverty index, which means she is in extreme poverty, but through her work and continuous effort of making and selling food, she fights every day to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She says that due to her delicious meals, she has a good clientele that always buys her meals from her.

She seeks this loan to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other ingredients to make food, which are the ingredients she needs to prepare her food. In this way she can continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 47-year-old married mother of three children, one of whom is still in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business (pig fattening) in the Philippines. Josephine requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
