Et son objectif est de pouvoir construire sa propre maison pour éviter la location pendant long temps.
texts.en: Veronique and her husband have been married for three years, he is a pastry chef employed in a baker's shop. They have two children aged six months and five years. Only the older child attends school. Since 2009 Veronique has been running a business selling telephone services (taxi-phone), portable telephones and accessories. She started with just mobile phones and top-up cards. Her business developed little by little. Even before 2009 she sold snacks in association with a friend. Her wish is to open a proper shop one day. Her aim is to build her own house to avoid paying rent for too long.

loans.use: to buy top-up cards, batteries, cards, and mobile telephones.

loans.name: Jérusalem Group

texts.fr: Chimanuka est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Jérusalem», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 47 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 4 étudient et 1 est encore gamin. Elle est vendeuse des huiles de palmes au domicile dans une avenue de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 350 litres d’huiles. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: Chimanuka is a saleswoman, a member of the Jerusalem group, and a client of IMF Hekima. She is 47 and married with five children of whom four attend school and one is still an infant. She has been selling palm oil from her home on an avenue in the town for five years. She needs to stock up on 350 liters of oil. She would like to expand her business, send her children to school and feed them correctly. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for non-bankable entrepreneurs. It should be noted that this client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to stock up on 350 litres of oil.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store. Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Madeleine Patricia

texts.es: Madeleine es una joven emprendedora con  metas claras en su vida para proyectarse como microempresaria de éxito y desarrollar las  ideas de negocios que  le surgen, así como perseguir nuevas oportunidades que le ayuden al  mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de muebles para el hogar y pequeños electrodomésticos que distribuye por la modalidad de venta puerta a puerta para lo cual utiliza el servicio de 4 vendedores. Madeleine se ha planteado un  nuevo reto y es satisfacer la necesidad identificada en el sector: el montaje de una panadería proyecto que planea financiar con los recursos de su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en la compra de los equipos que requiere como un horno de tres bandejas, una sobadora entre otros. Madeleine, asegura que la vida es un reto y que en cuanto a sus negocios  se refiere nunca desfallece  en sus ideales  e iniciativas empresariales, y para materializarlas, debe ser perseverante en sus metas y accionarlas cumpliendo con lo que ha planeado por lo que visualiza que a corto plazo tendrá organizado  su nuevo negocio de panadería.
texts.en:
Madeleine is an entrepreneurial young woman with clear goals. She sees herself becoming a successful small business owner and developing her business ideas, which will allow her to pursue new opportunities and improve her quality of life. 

She works selling furniture and small electric appliances door-to-door with 4 other salespeople. Madeleine has decided to pursue a new challenge, which is to start a bakery. She wants to finance this project with her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest the loan buying the required equipment, such as a large oven and a rolling mill, among others.

Madeleine affirms that life is a challenge and that she never gives up regarding her business plans. In order to make them come true, she perseveres and makes her ideas a reality. She foresees setting up her bakery in the short term.

loans.use: to start a bakery.

loans.name: Carmilita

texts.en:
Carmilita is a 52-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Carmilita has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, and bamboo for her business.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, and bamboo for her business.

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: Emed est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Ahadi», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 55ans, mère de 8 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de la viande dans une boucherie au domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 9 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 120 kg de viandes. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu d’un crédit. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Emed is a saleswoman, a member of the Ahadi community bank, and a client of IMF Hekima. She is 55 and married with eight children who all attend school. She has been selling meat in a butcher's stall at home in a lively part of the town for nine years. She will stock up on 120 kg of meat. She started her business with funds from a loan. She would like to increase her activity, and feed her children and send them to school. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on 120 kg of meat.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
El señor Clemente  de 58  años de edad, vive con su esposa, tiene 02 hijos  que dependen de él y vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras,  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 22 años  a la venta de abarrotería, embutidos,  refrescos y también vende leche porque se dedica también a la ganaría.
Don Clemente también trabaja de bombero, sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos y personas que a diario llegan a su negocio a comprar sus productos, es un hombre trabajador, que desea salir adelante con su familia.
Don Clemente está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abono, semillas, etc. que son  insumos para el cultivo de maíz,  con el apoyo de este préstamo desea mejorar su calidad de vida y cosechar  maíz que tanta falta hace en la zona, está muy agradecido con Prisma  por apoyar su negocio y sus actividades.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre del 2015
texts.en: Clemente is 58 years old. He lives with his wife and has two children who depend of him. He lives in a community in the south of Honduras. He has his own house and has worked for 22 years in the business of groceries, pork products, beverages, and he also sells milk because he works in animal husbandry as well. Clemente also works as a fireman. His customers are the friends, neighbors and persons who come daily to his store to buy his products. He is a hardworking man who wants to move ahead with his family. Clemente is requesting a loan to buy manure, seeds, etc., which are inputs to cultivate corn. With the support of this loan, he wants to improve his life quality and harvest corn which is needed so much in his region. He is grateful to Prisma for supporting his business and his activities.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 51 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Eva has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to resell.

Eva has been in this business for two years. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose works hard to support her family. Rose is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rose requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and shrimp to sell to her customers.

Rose has been in this business for five years now and earns additional income from her general store.

In the future, Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shrimp to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is 30 years old and married.

Cathy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snacks foods and other personal care products.

Cathy has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Cathy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snacks foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sharon works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Sharon is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of goods to sell like canned goods, milk, spices, seasonings, etc for her general store business.

Sharon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of goods to sell like canned goods, milk, spices, and seasonings

loans.name: Yessel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessel, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, tiene 1 hija, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.  

Yessel, se dedica a vender tortillas desde hace 6 años, aprendió este trabaja gracias a una amiga en donde ella era empleada en una tortillería y luego decidió poner su propio negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a vender frutas y el negocio lo tiene en su casa y su horario es 5:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m. 

Yessel, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz como materia prima para elaborar las tortillas.  

Los sueños de Yessel, son poder ampliar más su negocio y poder ampliar su casa y poderle cambiar el techo.
texts.en:
Yessel is 29 years old and studied up to Grade 4. She has one daughter, is in a relationship and her husband works as a bricklayer.

Yessel has worked selling tortillas for six years. She leaned this work thanks to a friend when she was employed in a tortilla shop and she later decided to open her own business. Her business is in her house and her schedule is from 5am to 1pm. She previously worked selling fruit.

Yessel needs the loan to buy corn as raw material to make tortillas.

Yessel's dream is to continue to grow her business and be able to enlarge her house and replace the roof.

loans.use: to buy corn as a raw material to make tortillas.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es:
Silvia, de 53 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, vive con sus hijas en casa y trabaja vendiendo enchapes de oro.

Silvia, tiene una tienda desde hace 3 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de tamales y comida típica, la tienda la tiene en la casa y se involucran sus dos hijas y el horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m.  
  
Silvia, necesita el préstamo para surtir más la tienda y comprar productos de la canasta básica, con la ayuda del préstamo será satisfecha la necesidad y tendrá más capital para poder surtir el negocio. 

Los sueños de Silvia, son poder ahorrar para poder comprar una casa y poder ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia, 53, is the single mother of two children. She lives with her daughters at home and works selling gold-plated articles.

Silvia has had a store for three years. Before than she sold tamales and traditional food. The store is in her home and her two daughters are involved. She works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m.

Silvia needs the loan to stock her store more and to buy basic staples. With the help of the loan she'll satisfy that need and have more capital for stocking her business.

Silvia's dreams are to be able to save to buy a house and to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock her store and to buy basic staples

loans.name: Segundo Vicente

texts.es: Vicente tiene 52 años, está casado su esposa trabaja como lavandera de ropa, él se dedica hace más de treinta años a criar pollos , gallinas de campo, muy responsablemente  todos los días los alimenta  hasta que crezcan y pueda venderlos en el mercado de aves. Vicente con este dinero compraría maíz, algunas  gallinas  que puedan empollar,  aumentaría   su producción y obtendría  mayores ingresos solventando así  la  alimentación y  el alquiler del lugar donde vive con su esposa.
texts.en: Vicente is 52 years old. He is married and his wife works washing clothes. He has worked for more than thirty years raising chickens and free-range hens. Very responsibly, he feeds them every day until they grow and he can sell them at the poultry market. With this money, he would buy corn, some hens that can lay eggs, he would increase his production and would get more income so he can pay for food and the rental of the place where he lives with his wife.

loans.use: to buy hens and corn.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 49 years old and unmarried. For the past two years she has operated a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Maribel has applied for a 13,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to stock up on more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, spices and sugar. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock up on more groceries to sell

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Del Calvario Group

texts.es:
Karina es una gran mujer, con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, tiene 36 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 3 y 14 años de edad, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad denominada aldea chocola. 
Karina (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa casual para damas, caballeros y niños, con este negocio tiene ella 4 años de realizarlo, Karina cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como sastre. Karina con el afán de darle a su negocio una mejor presentación, ha decidido comprar una vitrina que le permitiera exhibir mejor sus productos y llamar la atención de los clientes.
Su esperanza de vida, es ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Karina is a great woman with great ambitions in life. She is 36 years old and is married with a beautiful family of four children between the ages of 3 ad 14 years old. This lovely family lives in a community called Chocola village.

Karina's (the first on the left in the photo) business is buying and selling casual clothing for women, men and children. She has four years of experience in this business.She has the support of her husband who works as a tailor. Karina in her eagerness to provide her business with a better appearance has decided to buy a display case which will allow her to exhibit her products better and catch the attention of her clients.

Her great hope in life is to see her children become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy a display case to better exhibit her products.

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Cruz del Carmen de 46  años de edad es  Soltera, tiene 01 hijo que depende de ella, vive en la comunidad Nacaome, al sur de Honduras y tiene casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 07 años  a la venta de abarrotería como, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Cruz del Carmen está muy agradece a Prisma por el apoyo que se le brinda siempre que lo necesita en esta ocasión está solicitando el préstamo para surtir el negocio de los productos como granos básicos, jugos, carnes, embutidos, detergentes, harinas, dulces, etc. es un cliente con varios ciclos y espera que esta inversión le permita poder salir adelante con su familia y poder cubrir los gastos del hogar.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Cruz del Carmen is 46 years old, single, has one dependent child and lives in the Nacaome community in the south of Honduras. She has her own home and has worked for seven years selling groceries. She is a hard working woman with hopes of getting ahead.

Cruz del Carmen is very thankful for Prisma for the support they have always given her when she needs it. In this instance, she is asking for a loan in order to stock her business with products such as basic grains, juice, meat, cold cuts, detergent, flour, sweets, etc. She is a client with various loan cycles and hopes that this investment will allow her to carry her family forward and be able to cover her household expenses.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – September 2015.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, juice, meat, cold cuts, detergent, flour, sweets, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking businesswoman and mother with three children. She earns a living by raising and selling pigs in the Philippines. She also sells peanut butter and other food.

Thelma took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 7000 PHP loan to buy additional sacks of feed and other supplies for her pigs. She hopes to earn enough extra money to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn is single and for the past two years has sold rice to support her family in the Philippines. She has applied for a 5000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. She hopes in the future to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old and married with three children. For the past three years she has earned an income by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She also earns extra money through her sari-sari, or small general store.

Vilma has applied for a 11,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy sacks of fertilizer for her fields. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer for her fields.

loans.name: Bertha Del Carmen

texts.es:
Bertha, de 45 años de edad, está acompañada, su esposo está en Estados Unidos, tiene una hija de 6 años de edad y solo la hija depende de ella y estudio hasta noveno.

Bertha, tiene una tienda y se ha dedicado desde hace 4 años, decidió colocar este negocio después que quedo desempleada, anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa que procesa el atún y la tienda la tiene en su casa los horarios son de 6:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar mercadería para surtir la tienda y comprar productos lácteos y embutidos para su comercialización.

Los sueños de Bertha son poder ampliar más su negocio y poder comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Bertha is 45 years old and went to school up until ninth grade. She is married. Her husband is in the United States. She has a 6 year old daughter who is her only dependent.

Bertha has had a store for the last 4 years. She decided to open this business after she lost her job. She previously worked in a tuna factory. She runs her store from her home from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store and to buy dairy products and cold cuts to sell.

Bertha dreams of growing her business and to be able to buy a car.

loans.use: buy merchandise to stock her store and buy dairy products and cold cuts to sell.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos, que están estudiando, mientras que su esposo trabaja la agricultura.

Ana, posee una tienda desde hace 1 año, fue idea de ella colocar este negocio y su esposo le ayuda en la tienda, ella abre todos los días desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para surtir más su tienda, para que sus ventas sean mayores y eso significa mejores ganancias.

El sueño de Ana, es tener más clientes y también que sus hijos se gradúen de la escuela.
texts.en:
Ana went to school up to the third grade. She is married and she lives with her spouse and their two children. They are in school and her husband works in agriculture.

Ana has had a store for 1 year. It was her idea to start this business and her husband helps her with the store. She opens every day from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

Ana needs the loan to stock her store more so that she can increase her sales, which will mean better profits.

Ana's dream is to have more customers and also for her children to graduate from school.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store, such as beans, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel works hard to support her family. Jessel is single and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Jessel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Jessel has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jessel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Roxana Raquel

texts.es:
Roxana, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera de una niña, ella vive solo con su hija y su madre que son las que dependen directamente de ella.

Roxana, desde hace un año comenzó a trabajar vendiendo ropa y fue su madre quien le sugirió que realizara esa actividad, para sacar a su familia adelante, la venta la realiza de lunes a viernes en la comunidad. 

Roxana, necesita el préstamo para comprar nuevos estilos de ropa, ya que sus clientes se lo están solicitando y eso le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos.

Los sueños de Roxana, darle la oportunidad a su hija para que estudie y hacer crecer su negocio hasta tener un local estable y formal donde realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Roxana went to school up to the ninth grade. She is a single mother of a daughter. She lives alone with her daughter and her mother, who depend on her financially.

A year ago, Roxana started to work selling clothes. It was her mother who suggested that she do this activity to get her family ahead. She sells from Monday through Friday in the community.

Roxana needs the loan to buy new styles of clothing, because her customers as asking her for them and this will allow her to improve her income.

Roxana's dreams are to give her daughter an opportunity to get an education and to grow her business until she has a stable and regular locale where she can sell from.

loans.use: to buy new styles of clothing.

loans.name: Roxana Marilin

texts.es:
Roxana, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, tiene 1 hijo de 25 años de edad y vive en Estados Unidos con su mamá. 

Roxana, se dedica al destazo de cerdos, aprendió acerca de este negocio gracias a su mamá y desde hace 15 años se dedica a este negocio.
  
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar cerdos para destazarlos, la necesidad será satisfecha y tendrá capital para invertirlo.

Roxana, sueña con poder tener una granja de cerdos, para poder emplear a un sobrino.
texts.en:
Roxana is 45 yeas old. She went to school up to the ninth grade. She has one 25 year old son and he lives in the United States with her mother.

Roxana works butchering pigs. She learned about this business thanks to her mother and she has been doing it for 15 years.

She needs the loan to buy pigs to butcher. It will fill the needs and she will have capital to invest.

Roxana dreams of being able to have a pig farm, so she can employ her nephew.

loans.use: to buy pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Norsuita

texts.en:
Norsuita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and rice bran.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming rice.

Norsuita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and rice bran.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jonalyn is 43 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jonalyn has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish and salt and other materials for her business to sell.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish and salt and other materials for her business to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas En Œuvre A Group

texts.fr: Papy est commerçant, président du groupe solidaire «Dorcas en Œuvre A», client de l’IMF Hekima, âgé de 34 ans, marié, père des deux enfants dont 1 scolarisé et 1 est gosse. Il est vendeur des divers habillements dans un magasin de la ville depuis 5 ans. Il va s’approvisionner en souliers, pantalons, etc. Il commença son business  avec le capital reçu de la tontine. Il souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Papy is a merchant and the president of the solidarity group “Dorcas en Œuvre A”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, he is 34 years old and the married father two children, of whom one is in school, and one is very young.

For five years, Papy has been a vendor of a variety of clothing in a store in town. He is going to stock up on shoes, pants, etc. He began his business with capital from the tontine. His wish is to increase his capital and provide schooling and food for his children. In conclusion, he thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on shoes, pants, etc.

loans.name: Iban José

texts.es: Iban es un microempresario de 31 años residenciado en Barranquilla que aprovecho los conocimientos de su cónyuge quien estudio organización de fiestas y eventos, él palpó oportunidad  para complementar esta actividad por medio del alquiler de sillas y con una liquidación que recibió las adquirió. Con el desarrollo de su actividad fue adquiriendo otros elementos como manteles, forros y mesones, los cuales alquilan por separado o en conjunto con los servicios que su cónyuge ofrece.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en silla, mesas y accesorios, necesarios para cubrir la demanda de servicios actual. Su meta a futuro es alquilar otros elementos entre ellos vasos, platos, cubiertos y hieleras.  En lo personal desean adquirir casa propia.
texts.en: Iban is a 31-year-old microentrepreneur residing in Barranquilla who took advantage of the knowledge of his spouse, who studied event and party planning. He sensed an opportunity to complement this activity through renting chairs, and rented chairs he obtained through a clearance sale. With the development of this activity he has rented other items such as tablecloths, lining, and tables, which he rents separately or together with the services his spouse offers. He is currently applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in chairs, tables, and accessories, which are necessary to cover the current demand for his services. His goal for the future is to rent other items such as cups, plates, cutlery and ice trays. His personal goal is to have his own house.

loans.use: To invest in chairs, tables and accessories

loans.name: Dorcas En Œuvre B Group

texts.fr: Aimée est commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «Dorcas en Œuvre B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 30 ans, mariée, mère de quatre enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle est vendeuse des divers habillements bébés dans un magasin du centre-ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en layettes et autres habits bébés. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite augmenter son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Aimée is a merchant and a member of the solidarity group “Dorcas en Œuvre B”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 30 years old and the married mother of four children, of whom three are in school, and one is very young. For eight years, Aimée has been a vendor of a variety of baby clothing in a store downtown. She is going to stock up on baby accessories and more baby clothing.

She began her business with capital from her husband. Her wish is to increase her loan and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on baby accessories and more baby clothing

loans.name: Prudencia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Prudencia, es una mujer trabajadora, ella solo estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera y por el momento no  tiene hijos.

Prudencia, trabaja en una empresa en donde procesan atún, pero aparte de eso en su tiempo libre se dedica a la agricultura, este trabajo siempre lo ha realizado, ella alquila un terreno para poder sembrar sus cultivos. 

El crédito lo solicita para pagar el alquiler del terreno en el cual siembra.

Los sueños de Prudencia, es poder cosechar con éxito sus granos básicos y que le genere muchas ganancias, además desea poder comprar su propio terreno y así poder construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Prudencia is a hardworking woman. She only went to school until the sixth grade. She is single and does not have any children currently. 

Prudencia works in a company that processes tuna, but aside from this she dedicates her free time to agriculture, an activity that she has always done. She rents land to be able to cultivate her crops. 

Prudencia's dream is to be able to successfully cultivate her grains and make great profit, and also she wishes to be able to buy her own land and in this way be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To be able to rent the land in which she cultivates

loans.name: Melisa Daniela

texts.es: Melisa es una joven de 19 años que encontró en el comercio la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos; ella comercializa prendas de vestir a sus amigos y conocidos, actividad en la que ha obtenido muy buenos resultados, ella inició en el año 2014 y ha consolidado una clientela estable, pues la prefieren por su buen gusto y excelentes precios.  Ella es soltera y reside con su familia en un barrio de Barranquilla un municipio del Atlántico. Como su capital le es insuficiente para abastecer la demanda que se avecina por ser la época del año en el que sus clientes se interesan mucho más por los productos que oferta, Melisa realizó una solicitud de su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar prendas de vestir; short, jeans, blusas y pijamas que le permitirán incrementar sus ventas y contar con excelentes ganancias que aportará para sus gastos de estudio. Su meta es graduarse como profesional y continuar en el comercio como propietaria de un almacén.
texts.en:
Melisa es una joven de 19 años que encontró en el comercio la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos; ella comercializa prendas de vestir a sus amigos y conocidos, actividad en la que ha obtenido muy buenos resultados, ella inició en el año 2014 y ha consolidado una clientela estable, pues la prefieren por su buen gusto y excelentes precios.  Ella es soltera y reside con su familia en un barrio de Barranquilla un municipio del Atlántico. Como su capital le es insuficiente para abastecer la demanda que se avecina por ser la época del año en el que sus clientes se interesan mucho más por los productos que oferta, Melisa realizó una solicitud de su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar prendas de vestir; short, jeans, blusas y pijamas que le permitirán incrementar sus ventas y contar con excelentes ganancias que aportará para sus gastos de estudio. Su meta es graduarse como profesional y continuar en el comercio como propietaria de un almacén.

Melisa is a young woman of 19 years who found an opportunity in business to earn her own living; she sells clothing to her friends and other people she knows, an activity in which she has obtained very good results. She started in the year 2014 and has established a stable customer base because customers prefer her due to her good taste and excellent prices. She is single and lives with her family in a neighborhood in Barranquilla, a municipality of Atlántico. Since her capital is insufficient to meet the demand that approaches due to it being the time of year in which her clients are much more interested in the products she offers, Melisa applied for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy clothing; shorts, jeans, blouses, and pajamas, that will allow her to increase her sales and count on excellent profits that will help pay for her school expenses. Her goal is to graduate as a professional and continue in business as the proprietor of a department store.

loans.use: to buy clothing: shorts, jeans, blouses, and pajamas

loans.name: Maman Lèves-Toi Group

texts.fr: Martine est commerçante, membre du groupe solidaire «Maman lèves-toi», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 46 ans, femme vivant seule, mère de dix enfants scolarisés. Elle est propriétaire d’un dépôt relais des boissons au domicile dans une avenue animée depuis 27 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 50 caisses de Primus et 50 caisses de sucrés. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son ami. Elle souhaite construire une maison annexe, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Martine is a merchant and a member of the solidarity group “Maman lèves-toi”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 46 years old, a woman living alone, and the mother of ten children, all in school. For 27 years, she has been the owner of distribution center for beverages in her home on a busy avenue. She is going to stock up with 50 cases of Primus and 50 cases of soft drinks.

She began her business with capital from her friend. Her wish is to build a home annex and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 50 cases of Primus and 50 cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Mirna Evelyn

texts.es: Mirna es una mujer trabajadora de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su compañero de vida, su padre y dos hijos de 10 y 5 años de edad. Mirna se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una granja de gallinas ponedoras desde hace 1 año, pero además, se dedica a la  venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Mirna desea cambiar la madera de su vivienda, ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada y el ser toda la estructura de este material ella teme que en cualquier momento la madera pueda ceder cayendo su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar madera como: costaneras, cuartones, bigas, clavos y alambre para cambiar la madera de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Mirna is a hard working woman. She is 34 years old, lives together with her life partner, her father, and two children who are 10 and 5 years old. Mirna has worked offering her services on a hen farm for one year. She also works selling beauty products from catalogues which allows her to carry her family forward.

Mirna wishes to change the wood of her home since it is deteriorating and because the entire structure is made from this material, she fears that at any moment, the wood could give way and her house would fall. Because of this she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy wood such as: purlins, scantling, beams, nails, and wire in order to change the lumber of her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy wood such as: purlins, scantling, beams, nails, and wire in order to change the lumber of her home.

loans.name: La Main Dans La Main Group

texts.fr: Zeferine est commerçante, trésorière du groupe de crédits «La main dans la main», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 45 ans, mariée, mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des divers habillements dans un magasin dans une gallérie de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en habillement dames et enfants. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu apres recoltes de son champ. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables
texts.en:
Zeferine is a merchant and the treasurer of the loan group “La main dans la main”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 45 years old and the married mother of four children, all in school. For twelve years, she has been a vendor of a variety of clothing in a store located in a gallery in town. She is going to stock up on clothing for women and children.

Zeferine began her business with capital from harvesting her field. Her wish is to increase her capital and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on clothing for women and children

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 48 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

Jessica has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Aljadis Esther

texts.es: Aljadis es una empresaria independiente que comercializa prendas de vestir y calzado, ella encontró la oportunidad de generar ingresos adicionales para su familia al percibir que sus compañeras de trabajo necesitaban comprar con facilidad de pago, de este modo decidió invertir en alguna mercancía y poco a poco ha expandido su clientela y su inventario. Sus compras las realiza a almacenes en el centro de la Barranquilla y las cancela de contado, es por ello que necesita más capital para realizar las comprar de sus encargos. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir prendas de vestir; short, jeans, blusas que le permitirán incrementar sus ventas y contar con excelentes ganancias que aportará al sostenimiento de su hogar.  Ella es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y reside con su cónyuge en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla, su meta es tener una vivienda donde puedan gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Aljadis is an independent entrepreneur who sells clothing and shoes. She came across the opportunity to generate additional earnings for her family through perceiving that her colleagues needed to buy with convenience of payment. In this way she decided to invest in some merchandise and little by little she has expanded her customer base and inventory. She buys her merchandise with cash, and for this reason she needs more capital to buy her merchandise. She is now applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in clothing; shorts, jeans, and blouses, that will allow her to increase her sales and count on excellent profits that will help her pay for living expenses. She is the mother of two young children and lives with her spouse in a neighborhood in Barranquilla. Her goal is to have a house where she is able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: invest in clothing; shorts, jeans, and blouses.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is a married woman who is 61 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Merlina has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Arcelyn

texts.en:
Arcelyn is 41 years old, married, and has three children, with one child still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Arcelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Arcelyn has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her dried fish making business.

Josephine successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Josephine's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making dried fish.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is single and works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Nena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional personal collection products to sell for her direct selling personal collection products business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal collection products to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mercedita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mercedita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lorie Ann

texts.en:
Lorie Ann is 40 years old and married with three children. Lorie Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Lorie Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snacks foods and other personal care products.

Lorie Ann has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Lorie Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snacks foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a 35 year-old married mother of four children who works hard to support her family. She is a policewoman. Her husband works in agriculture.

Although the family works very hard, they cannot earn enough for them to support the cost of her education. This loan of $ 600 will allow Estela to help herself to study in the university.

She will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. Estela loves her family very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of ginger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell for her ginger business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell for her business

loans.name: Mawuena  Antiessie

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans, Mawena est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè pour exercer son activité. Ayant quatre enfants à charge, Mawena est une marchande de toute catégorie de sacs de friperies. Mawena s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et les revendent au bord de la route. Mawena sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de sacs en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner  une marge bénéficiaire assez élevée afin d’aider son mari à couvrir les charges quotidiennes de la famille puis aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Mawena, aged 35, is a married woman who lives in Agoè to operate her business. With four children to support, she is a merchant of any type of used bags. She gets her supplies of merchandise at the market twice a month. And she resells on the roadside. Mawena is requesting this loan to order handbags with the aim of doing well in her sales, then earning a profit margin high enough to help out her husband to cover the family’s day-to-day expenses, and then helping her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 28 units of used handbags

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
Novie is 29 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like bread, coffee, spices, milk, soap, etc.

Novie has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Novie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like bread, coffee, spices, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 50 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, soap, spices and other groceries.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 57 years old and married with eleven children. With one child still in school. Marjorie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods, and personal care products.

Marjorie has been in this business for six years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snack foods, and personal care products.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 60 years old and married with eleven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for 14 years. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has been blessed with four kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Fatuma operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over eight years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business.

Fatuma dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marissa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy supplies of rice to sell.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies of rice to sell.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Purita works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Purita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Purita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 59 years old and married with six children.

Loreta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care items.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Loreta has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Loreta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care items.

loans.name: Hugues Alberto

texts.es: Hugues es un emprendedor de 34 años a quien desde niño le gustó todo lo relacionado con las motocicletas y cuando llegó a su juventud, con la ayuda de su familia organizó su propio taller de mantenimiento y arreglo de motocicletas; tiene 17 años de experiencia en esta actividad que ejecuta desde su casa en el horario de 8:00 a.m. a  6:00 p.m. y sus clientes son vecinos, agentes de la Policía Nacional motorizados, personas dedicadas a cobro de cartera en motocicletas. Hugues está solicitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el fin de obtener los recursos que requiere para adquirir repuestos e insumos para el mantenimiento y arreglo de las motocicletas. Su meta para el negocio organizar físicamente su taller y fortalecer el negocio para generar ingresos suficientes que le permitan brindar una buena educación a sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Hugues is a 34-year-old entrepreneur who since childhood liked everything related to motorcycles. When he reached his youth, with the help of his family, he organized his own maintenance and repair shop of motorcycles. He has 17 years of experience in this business which he runs from his home in the hours of 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. His customers are neighbors, motorized agents of the National Police, and people working in portfolio collection in motorcycles.

Hugues is requesting his first Kiva loan through the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo" [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation] in order to obtain the resources required to acquire spare parts and supplies for the maintenance and repair of the motorcycles. His goal for the business is to physically organize his shop and strengthen the business to generate enough income that allows him to provide a good education to his four children.

loans.use: to acquire motorcycle spare parts and supplies.

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa is a married woman who is 45 years old.

Dolorosa has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Dolorosa requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, fish net, bamboo, sacks of salt and other materials for her business.

Dolorosa has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, fish net, bamboo, sacks of salt and other materials for her business

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 47 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell like soft drinks, milk, sugar, chips, eggs, etc.

Raquel has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Raquel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like soft drinks, milk, sugar, chips, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is 43 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cindy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cindy has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
These members belong to the Blessing Group from Teshie branch, which is located in the northern part of Accra in Ghana. They are into the sale of food stuff, kenkey (cooked corn paste), fish, cloth, groceries, cooking oil, slippers, kerosene and doughnuts.

Janet is one of the members. She is 31 years old, married, and has four dependent children. Janet has worked by selling groceries, cooking oil, slippers and kerosene for seven years now. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. Janet has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. She is requesting a loan in order to buy groceries, cooking oil, slippers and kerosene to sell to her customers. Therefore, she promises to complete her repayments according to the established terms. This is her sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and her third with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy groceries, cooking oil, slippers and kerosene to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman and has been blessed with one child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a farming business, selling from home to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farming business. She decided to join to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her farming business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Her name is Josephine. She is 27 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Avic, a technical assistant, and they have two children. Her husband's salary is not enough to cover their daily food and household expenses, which led Josephine to open an Internet shop for expenses to augment their income.

Josephine has been operating her computer rental shop for one year already. In the Philippines, very few people have their own computers. People go an Internet café for their business, school requirements and business documents. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

She needs to buy another personal computer unit to serve more customers. In this regard she hopes to borrow funds in the amount of PHP 11,000. Her income from her Internet shop is a big help for her family’s basic needs and in sending her children to school.

Josephine aims to have a bigger space for her Internet shop to attract more customers. She desires for her children to go to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every weekend where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional computer for her Internet shop.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 49 years old and married with three children; one child is still in school. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, snack foods, etc.

Editha has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, snack foods, etc

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emelia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Emelia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Brenda Mercedes

texts.es:
Brenda es una mujer, de cincuenta años de edad, que luego de la muerte de su esposo tuvo que portarse valiente y salir adelante en la vida, ella emprendió un negocio de venta de verduras, con el apoyo infaltable de su hermanas y sobrinos, por eso está muy agradecida y confía fielmente en ambas organizaciones.
Por eso, en esta temporada del año, ella ha vuelto a pedir un préstamo que le permita comprar verduras frescas, como apio, chiltoma, cebolla, tomate, lechuga, zanahoria, entre otros. Su clientela cada vez va creciendo más, en un futuro ella quiere incursionar en la venta de granos básico y volver su negocio una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Brenda is a 50 year old woman, who, after the death of her husband, had to have courage and continue on in her life. She started a business selling vegetables, with the unfailing support of her sisters and their children. She is very grateful and is faithfully confident in both organizations.

At this season of the year, she has returned to request a loan that will allow her to buy fresh vegetables such as celery, sweet peppers, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, carrots, and others. Her customer base continues to grow. In the future, she would like to venture into selling basic grains, and turn her business into a distribution service.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables such as celery, sweet peppers, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, carrots, and others.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mebakari operates a grocery and vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Shela Me

texts.en:
Shela Me is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Shela Me's business profile for a new loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Concepcion

texts.en:
Ma. Concepcion is a married woman, 47 years old, with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Concepcion has a buy and sell of dried fish business in the Philippines. Ma. Concepcion requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Ma. Concepcion has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 59, is a married woman.

Marilyn has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, sacks of salt, fish net and other materials for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, sacks of salt, fish net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 47 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Eugenia has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming ginger.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy addditional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Rose Pask School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Savio. He is the head teacher of Rose Pask Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Kisubi in Kampala with 450 students. Rose Pask School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Rose Pask School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Savio ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 31 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Angie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Angie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 46 years old and both of her children are still in school.

Marites has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her dried fish making business.

Marites has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her dried fish making business

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Morena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of ginger business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Morena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell for her buy and sell ginger business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Morena has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Presilda

texts.en:
Presilda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Presilda is 40 years old and both of her children are currently in school.

Presilda has a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines. Presilda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Presilda has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosa is 52 years old and has one child still in school.

Rosa has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anorkhol

texts.ru: Анорхол замечательная женщина из Хуросонского района. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Муж Анорхол работает учителем в своем районе. Так как его зарплаты не хватает на обеспечение семьи, Анорхол хочет помочь мужу и внести свой вклад в семейный бюджет. Она хочет приобрести несколько голов скота и начать животноводческий бизнес. К сожалению, у неё нет для этого достаточных денег. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом и надеется, что ей не откажут. Анорхол очень хочет поддержать мужа.
texts.en:
Anorkhol is a wonderful woman from the Khuroson area. She is married, and the mother of two children. Anorkhol's husband works as a schoolteacher in their area. 

Since her husband's wages are insufficient for providing for the family, Anorkhol wants to help her husband and do her part for the household budget. She wants to purchase some livestock and start a cattle-breeding business. 

Unfortunately, she does not have enough money for this. Thus, she has applied for a loan and is hoping that she will not be rejected. Anorkhol greatly desires to support her husband.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and start her business.

loans.name: Nurzat

texts.ru: Нурзат, 38 лет, замужем, 2 дочери и сын. Образование у Нурзат среднее, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нурзат, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 40 овец и 2 лошади. На участке мерою 3,22 ГА она выращивает клевер. Также выезжает на пастбище и продает национальный напиток кымыз и курут. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 20,000 сом (KGS). Нурзат обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Nurzat is 38 years old, married, and has two daughters and a son. Nurzat has secondary education, and breeds cattle and grows crops in order to bring income for her family, having started with 10,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to Nurzat's persistent hard work, currently her farm has four cows, 40 sheep, and two horses. She cultivates clover on a small land plot of about 3.22 hectares. She also puts her cattle out to pasture, and sells the national drinks kymyz and kurut. Her monthly income is about 20,000 som (KGS). 

Nurzat has applied to Bai Tushum bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) in order to buy livestock for increasing her herd. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business and her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anipa

texts.ru: Анипа успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 6 коров. На участке, мерою 1,0 ГА она выращивает рис. Также выращивает фрукты, сушит их и продает на рынке. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анипа вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку яблок, шиповника и прочих фруктов для сушки и реализации на рынке. Доходы от кредита Анипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Anipa has successfully repaid her loan, having used it as specified. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped her with financing. Today there are six cows on her farm. She cultivates rice on a land plot of 1.0 hectares. She also cultivates fruits, dries them, and sells them at the market. 

In order to further develop her farm, Anipa has again applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) in order to buy apples, rose hips, and other fruits for drying and selling at the market. Anipa plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits wholesale to dry and sell as dried fruit.

loans.name: María Claudia

texts.es: María es una comerciante que ejerce esta actividad hace cinco años, ella comercializa mediante catálogos una variada gama de productos entre ellos calzado, productos cosméticos y de aseo personal, idea de negocio generada por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso adicional para apoyar a los gastos del hogar. Esta barranquillera de 48 años de edad ejerce varios roles ser madres, ama de casa y empresaria, son sus retos a los que se debe enfrentar día a día para prosperar. No tiene horario laboral y comercializa sus productos mediante visitas a sus clientes para promocionar los productos y a través de las redes sociales. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que proyecta invertir en la compra de calzado deportivo unisex para incrementar su capacidad de oferta. Su meta es tener una mayor cobertura de clientes que le generen mayores ventas y mejores utilidades y poder obtener los recursos para ayudar a su hija de 19 años, con sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
María is a trader. She has been working for five years . Maria sells a variety of product ranges through catalogues, including footwear, cosmetics and personal hygiene goods. She came up with the idea for this business out of a necessity to earn an additional income to help with household costs.

María, a 48-year-old from Barranquilla, carries out various roles - she is a mother, a housewife, and a businesswoman. Everyday she must face these challenges in order to prosper.

María has no fixed working timetable. She sells her products at visits to clients to promote products, and on social networks.

Currently María is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use this loan to buy unisex sports shoes to increase sales capacity.

María's goal is to have more customers and make more sales. She wants to earn higher profits and be able to earn an income to support her 19-year-old daughter with her university studies.

loans.use: to buy unisex sports shoes to increase sales capacity.

loans.name: Busalima

texts.ru: Бусалима, 58 лет, вдова, есть 7 детей. У Бусалимы - среднее образование, она на пенсии, занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Бусалимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 5 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS). Однако, данных средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Бусалима обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита позволят развить ее бизнес, увеличить прибыль и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Busalima is 58 years old, widowed, and has seven children. Busalima has secondary education and is retired. She is engaged in farming, and provides for her family with the income. 

Thanks to Busalima's persistent hard work, today her farm has two cows and five sheep. Her monthly income from the business is about 11,000 som (KGS). However, this money is not enough for a satisfying life or family maintenance. 

Busalima has applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. The funds from the loan will allow her to develop her business, increase her income, and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to help bolster her income.

loans.name: Atyrgul

texts.ru: Атыргул, 39 лет, замужем, есть дочь и 2 сына. У нее высшее образование, работает в школе, также занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Атыргул на сегодняшний день имеет 3 коровы, 8 овец. Летом скот отправляет на пастбище, зимой содержит в сараях. Ежемесячный доход Атыргул около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Атыргул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Атыргул планирует вложить заготовку корма и ячменя на зиму для скота.
texts.en:
Atyrgul is 39 years old, married, and has a daughter and two sons. She has higher education, works in a school, and also farms livestock and grows crops. Thanks to her persistent hard work, today Atyrgul has three cows and eight sheep. In the summer the livestock is sent to pasture, and in the winter  they are housed in sheds. Atyrgul's monthly income is about 19,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Atyrgul has applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) in order to buy sheep for fattening and resale. Atyrgul plans to invest the funds from the loan in storing up feed and barley for the livestock for winter.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep for fattening and resale, in order to save money for purchasing feed for livestock.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венера, 57 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает фельдшером, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2000 году с суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Венера на сегодняшний день имеет 1 корову, 5 овец, лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Венера обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Venera is 57 years old, married, and has three children. She has specialised secondary education and works as a doctor's assistant. As a source of supplementary income for her family, she also is engaged in animal husbandry with her husband, having started in 2000 with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistent hard work, today Venera has one cow, five sheep, and a horse. 

In order to further develop her business, Venera has applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) in order to buy three steers for fattening and resale. She plans to direct the funds from the loan in the further development of her business, and major repairs for her house.

loans.use: to buy three steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Saadat

texts.ru: Саадат, 38 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей, самой младшей дочери 8 лет. По характеру Саадат очень трудолюбивая, жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина. В качестве основного источника дохода для семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 1 корову, 2 бычков, 5 овец. Саадат получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 11,000 сом (KGS). Она хочет развить свой бизнес, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для постройки сарая для скота, для создания благоприятных условий по содержанию животных.
texts.en:
Saadat is 38 years old, married, and has five children. Her youngest daughter is eight years old. Saadat is very hardworking, full of joie de vivre, and responsible. As the main income provider for her family, she grows crops and rears livestock. She has a developed farm, namely one cow, two steers, and five sheep. 

Saadat receives a monthly income of about 11,000 som (KGS).
