She wants to develop her business, thus she has applied to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) in order to buy building materials for constructing a barn for the livestock, so as to create favourable conditions for keeping the animals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a barn for livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Yenifer Carolina

texts.es:
La señora  Yenifer de 27 años de edad es  madre Soltera, tiene 02 hijos que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad de Nacaome al sur de Honduras, el hogar donde vive es de su madre y se dedica desde hace 01 años a su negocio que es pulpería donde vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta básica.
Doña Yenifer está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cómo ser: jabón manteca, papel, refrescos, harina,  jugos etc. anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa americana es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Desea surtir el negocio para esta época de fiestas patrias está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y uno de sus sueño es mejorar su negocio y construir su propia casa. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
Yenifer is a 27 year old single mother who has 2 children who depend on her. She lives in the community of Nacaome in the south of Honduras. She lives in her mother's home and has earned a living for the last year working in her grocery store where she sells all types of staple goods.

Yenifer is applying for a loan to buy: soap, butter, paper, soft drinks, flour and juices. She used to earn a living selling American clothing and is a hard-working woman with a desire to succeed.

She wants to stock up the business for the period of the national holidays and is very happy to continue working with Prisma. One of her dreams is to improve her business and build her own home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – September 2015

loans.use: to buy: soap, butter, paper, soft drinks, flour and juices for her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 32 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal sales business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Analyn has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 8 years and also earns an income from her general store.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 38 years old and married with two children, both her children are still in school, Rosalia works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items  to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, snacks foods and personal care products.

Rosalia has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Rosalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Arnida

texts.en:
Arnida is a widow and is 64 years old with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Arnida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Arnida has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farm in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries and buy sacks of fertilizer for her farm.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries and buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Sara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sara, de 30 años de edad, vive con su mamá, estudio hasta bachillerato, porque por falta de recursos económicos no continúo con sus estudios. 

Sara, en el 2010 estudio corte y confección en la comunidad donde vive, confecciona ropa de sus vecinos y hace los uniformes de la banda de paz del centro escolar de su comunidad y vestidos de fiestas rosas y casamientos, también hace tamales y otras meriendas para la venta, aprovecha los negocios de temporada.

Sara, necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima y hacer arreglos florales (flores artificiales) para vender para el día de los santos inocentes.

Sara, sueña con que su negocio crezca, para generar los suficientes ingresos que le permitan comprar el terreno para edificar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sara is 30 years old and lives with her mom. She studied until her high-school diploma and did not continue to study because she did not have the financial resources.

In 2010, Sara studied dressmaking in the community she is living. She is making her neighbors' clothes, uniforms for the peace band of her town's school, and dresses for engagement parties and weddings.

She also makes tamales and other snacks to sell, making use of seasonal business.

Sara needs this loan to buy raw material and for making flower arrangements (artificial flowers) to sell on Holy Innocents' Day.

Sara's goal is to grow her business to generate a sufficient income, which will allow her to buy the land for building her own home.

loans.use: to buy raw material and to make flower arrangements (artificial flowers) to sell on Holy Innocents' Day.

loans.name: Mirta Esperanza

texts.es:
Mirta, una mujer con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, es amable, sincera y perseverante en la vida, tiene  40 años de edad, es casada con una familia de dos hijos una  mujer y un hombre, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Samayac.
Mirta su principal actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa casual para damas, caballeros y niños, con este negocio tiene ella 8 años de realizarlo, para Mirta este negocio no es suficiente por eso se dedica a la venta de consumo diario. Con el acercamiento del fin de año, para Mirta es importante realizar la inversión comprando productos de ropa como, pantalones, blusas, faldas y camisas. Con este anagrama Mirta espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
Su gran esperanza de vida, es terminar la construcción de su casa y abrir un nuevo local.
texts.en:
Mirta is a woman with great ambition in life. She is kind, sincere, and persevering in life. She is 40 years old, married, with a family of two children - a girl and a boy. This beautiful family lives in a community of Samayac.

Mirta's main financial income comes from buying and selling casual clothing for women, men, and children. She has had this business for eight years. This business is not enough for Mirta, which is why she also sells goods of daily consumption.

With the end of the year approaching, it is important for Mirta to invest in buying clothing items like pants, blouses, skirts, and shirts. With this, Mirta hopes to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Her great goal in life is to finish the construction on her house and open a new store.

loans.use: to buy clothes like pants, blouses, skirts, and shirts for her business.

loans.name: Reinaldo José

texts.es: Reinaldo de 36 años es ebanista por herencia familiar, pues este era el oficio de su padre con quien aprendió a trabajar y hoy en día son socios en su taller ubicado en un barrio popular de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y recomendados que le encargan puertas, ventanas, salas comedores, closets entre otros. Él no tiene horario laboral pues siempre está disponible para atender los requerimientos de su clientela puesto que es quien genera el único ingreso del hogar y tiene una responsabilidad muy grande con sus tres hijos de 18, 15 y 11 años. Reinaldo está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que planea invertir en la compra madera y demás insumos que requiere para la elaboración de sus productos con el fin de tener un inventario de productos terminados para ofrecer a su clientela. La meta para su negocio es fortalecerlo y mejorar sus equipos de trabajo y para su familia contar con los recursos suficientes para brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is a 36 year old cabinetmaker, by family trade, which was his father's profession and from whom he learned the trade. Today they are partners in his workshop in a popular district of the city of Barranquilla.

His customers come from friends, neighbours and recommendations and they order doors, windows, dining rooms, closets and other things. He doesn't work regular hours but he is always available to meet the requirements of his customers. He is the only one who generates income in the household and is responsible for three children aged 18, 15 and 11.

Reinaldo is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He plans to buy wood and other supplies required for the manufacture of his products in order to have a stock of finished products to offer his customers.

The goal for his business is to strengthen and improve its teamwork and for his family it is to have sufficient resources to provide a good education for his children and to have their own home.

loans.use: to buy wood and other supplies that he requires for the manufacture of his products.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Milagros is 52 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Milagros has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 21000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell to her customers.

Milagros has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 35 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Rosemarie has a buy and sell native mats business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 24500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more native mats to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more native mats to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 36 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, coffee, cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, coffee, cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy gasoline, fishing net for her fishing business for her fishing business.

Elsie has been in this business for 13 years. Elsie earns more income from dried fish processing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: Laurina

texts.en:
Laurina is 40 years old and married has five children, two of whom in school, Laurina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of recycle materials for her business.

Laurina has been in this business for 11 years. 

In the future Laurina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of recycle materials for her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Angelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Angelina is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Angelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to buy her own pump boat for fishing.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Hayrapet

texts.en: Hayrapet is 60 years old and he lives with in Antarashat village of Syunik region. He lives with his beloved wife who is disabled. Their two children are already married and they live with their families. For several years Hayrapet works as a salesman now he is also employed and he works at the television station. He also has a cute farm, where he takes care of two cows and three heifers. He also has a plot of land on which he cultivates beans, potato, tomato and greens. His land’s vegetables and his farm’s milk and meat Hayrapet sells right from his house to his neighbors and regular customers. With his first partnership with Kiva Hayrapet would like to buy fodder for all his farm cattle and he will be thankful very much if he will be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fodder for all his farm cattle and he will be thankful very much if he will be supported by Kiva lenders

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy piglets, vitamins and feeds.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

Melinda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, vitamins and feeds

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, egg, milk, etc for her food vending business.

Nenita has been in this business for 3 years. Nenita earns more income from raising pig.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, egg, milk, etc

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara with his wife and two children lives and works in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. He is employed and works at the city’s hospital as a litter bearer and simultaneously takes care of his cute farm where there are cows, calves and a heifer. Ara’s wife makes very tasty cheese and butter and they sell it with their farm milk and meat. Land cultivation also developed in Ara’s farm and he has harvest of potato and tomato both for sale and family use.

Now this Kiva loan Ara asks as he wants to buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Ramón Enrique

texts.es: Ramón es un joven emprendedor que actualmente tiene 19 años, pero su experiencia en el mundo de los negocios data desde hace 10 años porque desde muy niño le gustaba comercializar mercancías y siempre ha contado con el apoyo de sus padres. Actualmente ejecuta dos actividades de negocio: diariamente vende puerta a puerta prendas de vestir, calzado, artículos para el hogar entre otros artículos y semanalmente elabora y vende pasabocas para eventos por encargo y a través de tiendas de víveres ubicadas en el barrio donde reside. Ramón está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que invertirá en incrementar su inventario con ropa, calzado y artículos para el hogar, para ofrecer a su clientela en la temporada de fin de año. Su proyecto es fortalecer su negocio, ampliar la cobertura de  su clientela, organizar un local comercial en su caso y educarse para tener una formación profesional.
texts.en: Ramón is an enterprising young man who is currently 19 years old, but his experience in the world of business began 10 years ago, because since he was very young he liked to sell merchandise and has always had the support of his parents. Currently he carries out two business activities: every day he sells clothing, shoes, household goods and other items door to door and weekly he makes and sells tasty snacks for events by delivery and through grocery stores located in the neighborhood where he lives. Ramón is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financing that he will invest in increasing his inventory with clothing, shoes, and household goods to offer his customers in the end-of-year season. His plan is to strengthen his business, expand his customer coverage, organize a sales location in his house and get an education to have professional training.

loans.use: to invest in increasing his inventory with clothing, shoes and household goods.

loans.name: John Alexander

texts.es: John de 33 años de edad es un emprendedor, dedicado a la comercialización de ropa, calzado, relojes y demás artículos que solicitan sus clientes;  inició su negocio hace 5 años, por consejo de un amigo que se dedicaba a esta actividad y que por su experiencia lo recomendaba como un negocio rentable. John realiza sus compras en Maicao, municipio de la Guajira colombiana, reconocido por ser un cetro del comercio de la región. Sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y referidos a quienes visita periódicamente para propiciar las ventas. John esta tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo recursos que proyecta invertir en Jeans, camisas, bermudas, sueters, calzado y relojes, inventario que le garantiza un incremento significativo en las ventas de la temporada de fin de año. Él visualiza su negocio organizado en un local comercial abierto al público, con unos ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y a futuro comprar su propio apartamento.
texts.en: John, 33 years old, is an entrepreneur, working in selling clothing, shoes, watches and other items that his customers request. He began his business 5 yeas ago from the advice of a friend who worked in the same business and who, from his experience, recommended it as a profitable business. John makes his purchases in Maicao, a municipality in the Colombian Guajira, known as being the business center of the region. His customers are friends, neighbors and people referred to him who he visits periodically to promote his sales. John is applying for his first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, resources that he plans to invest in jeans, shirts, Bermuda shorts, sweaters, shoes and watches, inventory which will guarantee a significant increase in the sales during the end-of-year season. He envisions his business being organized in a sales space, open to the public, with income that will permit him to improve his quality of life and, in the future, purchase his own apartment.

loans.use: to invest in jeans, shirts, Bermuda shorts, sweaters, shoes and watches.

loans.name: Nimanvula

texts.en:
Nimanvula  is a widowed woman and has been blessed with five children all of whom attend school. Together with her children, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima is 24 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, an infant child and parents in Chkhorotsku district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow seasonal vegetables. They also have 2 pigs. Dima is unemployed and wants to start taxi business.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 3500 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a car and will serve people as a taxi driver. Dima will generate daily income and will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en: Salam is a 26 years old Palestinian single woman who lives with her parents and works in women clothing store. Her parents are old. So, she is the main income source for her family. Their house is very old and needs repair so she thinks that it should be repaired before the winter come. For that, she is requesting to borrow a loan of $700 from Kiva’s partner, Alibdaa to be able to enhance her way of living and meet the needs of their life.

loans.use: to repaire her house before winter come

loans.name: Dinora Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Dinora de 26 años de edad  vive con su esposo y su hijo tienen casa propia, vive en una de San Lorenzo y se dedica desde hace 05 años a su negocio que es la compra y venta de lácteos. Es una mujer trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante. 
Doña Dinora está solicitando el crédito para la compra de concentrados, pasto y sal para sus animales, con esta inversión pretende mejorar su negocio y que también le genere los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Doña Dinora uno de sus sueños es que en su próximo préstamo pueda mejorar su vivienda.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – Septiembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Dinora, 26 years old, lives with her husband and their son; they have their own house. She lives in San Lorenzo and for 5 years has worked at her business which is buying and selling dairy products. She is a very hard-working woman with a lot of desire to get ahead.

Dinora is asking for the loan to purchase concentrated feed, grass, and salt for her animals, with this investment she plans to improve her business and also generate the necessary income to get ahead with her family.

One of Dinora's dreams is that with her next loan she can improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – September 2015.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed, grass and salt for her business.

loans.name: Elba Rosa

texts.es: Elba es una emprendedora de 54 años que reside en el municipio de Barranquilla y se encuentra dedicada a la comercialización de artículos de ferretería como materiales para construcción, cemento, tornillería, pinturas, tubería PVC, partes eléctricas, entre otros.  Este negocio es tradicional en su familia e inició con el apoyo de su cónyuge y un hermano,  y con el que ha logrado educar a sus dos hijos y solventar parte de los gastos en el hogar. Ella administra este negocio desde hace 31 años y diariamente apertura su ferretería a las 8:00 a.m. en jornada continua hasta las 6:00 p.m. Su clientela está conformada por los vecinos y familiares que realizan construcciones en el sector y desean ahorrar en transporte y otras variables que afecten su presupuesto. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en las compra de materiales para construcción y partes eléctricas. Su sueño de prosperidad es abrir una sucursal con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan seguir apoyando a sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en: Elba is an entrepreneur, 54 years old, who lives in the municipality of Barranquilla and works selling hardware items such as construction materials, cement, nuts and bolts, paints, PVC pipes, electrical parts, and more. This business is a family tradition and she began it with the support of her spouse and a brother and with it she has managed to educate her two children and pay part of the household expenses. She has run this business for 31 years and opens her hardware store daily at 8:00 am and stays open until 6:00 pm. Her customers are made up of her neighbors and family members who do construction projects in the sector and want to save on transportation and other variables that affect their budgets. Currently, she is applying for her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, resources that she plans to invest in the purchase of construction materials and electrical parts. Her dream of prosperity is to open a branch with the end of getting more income which will allow her to continue supporting her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to invest in construction materials and electrical parts.

loans.name: Enrique Manuel

texts.es: Enrique es un microempresario de 48 años que encontró en la cría y comercialización de carne de cerdo su proyecto de negocio; hace 20 años siguiendo la tradición familiar, Enrique compró sus primeras cría con las que inició su negocio y que a un plazo relativamente corto pudo sacrificar para comercializar su carne. Él manifiesta que la crianza de cerdos es un negocio rentable  porque en comparación con otros animales su ciclo de reproducción es relativamente corto y pueden tener camadas muy numerosas. Enrique sacrifica animales cada 4 días y vende su carne diariamente en el punto de venta ubicado en su residencia a vecinos, familiares y transeúntes. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual planea invertir en la compra de concentrados, insumos y crías pequeñas con el fin de aumentar su oferta e incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades. Su visión es fortalecer su negocio, obtener mayores ganancias y apoyar a sus hermanos.
texts.en: Enrique is a micro-entrepreneur, 48, who raises and sells pork as his business of 20 years, following the family tradition. Enrique purchased his first piglets with which he began his business and in a relatively short period of time he was able to butcher them to sell the meat. He states that raising pigs is a profitable business because in comparison to other animals, their reproductive cycle is relatively short and they can have very large litters. Enrique butchers animals every 4 days and sells the meat daily at the sales location located in his home to neighbors, family members and passersby. Currently he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which he plans to invest in the purchase of concentrated feed, supplies and piglets with the end of expanding his offerings and increasing his sales and his profits. His vision is to strengthen his business, get better earnings and support his siblings.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of concentrated feed, supplies, and piglets.

loans.name: Songo Group

texts.en:
Mamie is a two-seven years old business woman and a member of Song solidarity group. Song solidarity group has three women and two men. Mamie sells clothing materials (textile) to the general public. Mamie has been in this textile business for the past 15 years. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm.

Mamie established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from her business. See Mamie (is in the middle of the picture).
Mamie and her group members needs a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL in other to buy 2 bales of textile for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Mamie is married and has two children with the ages of 10 and 8 years children who are both school going children.
In the feature, Mamie plan to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.
Mamie and the rest of the group members will be very appreciative to anyone that can help.

loans.use: to buy 2 bales of textile for her business

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in handcrafted jade jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of jade and sterling silver.

Pablo has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story:

"I find the history associated with jade to be inspiring. This beautiful stone has been treasured and worked since the times of the ancient Maya. Jade can only be found in a few countries around the world, so I feel fortunate to have the privilege to have it nearby and to create something so valuable. The first piece I ever made was the replica of a Maya mask from Tikal. It was a lot of hard work, but in the end my bosses were pleased with it and soon sold it at their store. I continued working hard to save enough to set up my own workshop, and I finally got it set up in 2000."

"Many thanks for your support. This microcredit will allow me to prepare for the upcoming Christmas season."

Use the link below to view Pablo's handcrafted jade jewelry on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/8890

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of jade and sterling silver

loans.name: Armin

texts.en:
Armin is a mason and he also works in other activities to make more money. He also resells concert and game tickets. Armin is single and he doesn't have children but he helps and he lives with his father The house of his father is made of adobe.

Armin needs a loan to fix a room at the house where he lives. He hopes you can help him. Armins is at his house in the picture

loans.use: to fix a room at the house where he lives

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Her name is Dominga, aged 50, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Happily married to Rodante, a tricycle driver. The couple is thankful that their hard work and perseverance paid off now that their two children are already working.

Dominga has run her small general store for fifteen years which helped cover their daily sustenance. In order to grow  her store she is humbly asking your assistance of a Php 10000 loan to fill her store with large quantities of food and household items as rice, bread, biscuits, canned goods, instant noodles, eggs, oil and toiletries etc. Although there are times she has difficulty collecting her receivable from some of her customers she still maintains a positive and understanding attitude towards them.

Dominga dreams to own a big grocery store someday. She prays for God to bless her efforts with success and live a comfortable life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Con 46 años de edad Ana habita en casa de su propiedad en la cual habita junto a su hijo de 18 años de edad y sus padres a los que apoya en su vejez. Ana se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos desde hace 1 año lo que le permite sacar adelante a su hijo y sus padres. Ana se siente muy preocupada, ya que no cuenta con una puerta segura en su vivienda, además no cuenta con energía eléctrica en la misma, pero no cuenta con liquidez económica necesaria por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cables eléctricos, caja térmica, toma corriente y una puerta para instalar una puerta y energía eléctrica en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Ana, 46 years old, lives in her own house in which she lives with her 18-year-old son and her parents who she supports in their old age. Ana has worked in domestic service for 1 year, which allows her to get her son and parents ahead. Ana is very concerned because she doesn't have a secure door on her house, and in addition it doesn't have electricity. But, she doesn't have the liquid assets needed, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in electrical wires, a breaker box, an outlet and a door to install a door and electricity in her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in electrical wires, a breaker box, an outlet and a door to install a door and electricity in her house.

loans.name: Oscar Agustin

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre de 25 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de San Pablo Jocopilas.
Oscar para sacar adelante a su familia trabaja para una institución privada desde hace 4 años de edad. Oscar un admirable joven quien se preocupa para que su familia tenga todo lo necesario, y se ha dado cuenta que ahora lo primordial es la construcción de su casa, aunque tiene todo el deseo de construir su mayor dificultad es no tener los recursos suficientes para poder adquirir los materiales como cemento, block, arena y piedrín, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para cubrir esta necesidad.
Su esperanza de vida es graduarse de licenciado y contar con su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 25-year-old man, single and lives with his parents and siblings in a community of San Pablo Jocopilas.

Oscar, to get his family ahead, has worked for a private institution for 4 years. Oscar is an admirable young man who is concerned that his family has everything it needs and he has realized that now the basic need is to build a house. Although he has all the desire to build, his greatest difficulty is not having sufficient resources to be able to get the materials such as cement, concrete blocks, sand, and gravel. For this reason, he asks for a loan to cover this need.

His hope in life is to graduate with a degree and have his own business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, concrete blocks, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean works hard to support her family. Jean is single with one child and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Jean requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jean has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Jean would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 62 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Perla is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Perla has been raising pigs for 9 years and also earns additional income from selling corn.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Aralid Esther

texts.es: Aralid es una microempresaria de 48 años residente en un barrio popular del suroccidente de Barranquilla y en esta misma localidad está ubicado su taller de confecciones.  Ella elabora pijamas, bermudas, camisas, sudaderas, ropa deportiva y demás prendas requeridas por su clientela compuesta principalmente por vecinos y amigos.  Aralid cuenta con 35 años de experiencia en esta actividad pues aunque no realizó estudios sobre esta profesión, adquirió el conocimiento de su madre que ejercía esta actividad. En la actualidad está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que planea invertir en telas e insumos para confeccionar prendas y mantener un inventario para ofertar a sus clientes en la temporada de fin de año. Ella visualiza su negocio realizando ventas a l por mayor a almacenes y comerciantes y su meta familiar es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Aralid is a 48 year old small business owner who lives in a popular neighborhood southwest of Barranquilla. Her sewing workshop is also located there. She makes pajamas, bermuda shorts, shirts, sweats, athletic attire and other clothes required by her clients who are mainly her neighbors and friends.  Aralid has 35 years of experience in sewing. She didn't study sewing, but she learned the profession from her mother, who was also a seamstress. She is currently processing her first credikiva with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use the money to invest in fabrics and supplies to make garments and keep an inventory to offer her clients for the end of the year season. She sees her business doing wholesale sales to warehouses and shopkeepers, and, on a more personal note, her goal is to buy a house.

loans.use: invest in fabrics and supplies.

loans.name: Juan Masias

texts.es: Juan es un hombre trabajador de 52 años que vive junto a su esposa en la localidad rural de Yanque, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a trabajos múltiples tales como peonaje agrícola y cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por alfalfa orgánica que él mismo cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar una vaca orgánica, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder brindarle a su esposa mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Juan is a hard-working man, 52 years old, who lives with his wife in a rural locality of Yanque, which is located in Arequipa. He works at different jobs such as agricultural laborer and raising organic cows, putting a lot of attention into the care and feed that he offers them, which is made up of organic alfalfa which he grows himself. He asks for the microloan to be able to purchase an organic cow. He hopes that its milk will be sold at a better price because it is organic. In the future, he hopes to offer his wife better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an organic cow.

loans.name: Silvia Claribel

texts.es:
Silvia, de 36 años de edad, vive con su madre y sus dos hijos que están estudiando y ella solo estudio hasta octavo grado, su madre solo puede ayudarle con los oficios domésticos y también para cuidar a sus nietos. 

Silvia, se dedica a vender ropa y desde hace varios años ha sido su fuente de ingresos, pero ella desea establecer un nuevo negocio, está pensando colocar un negocio.- Ella tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocios, antes había trabajado en un cafetín y aprendió bien su funcionamiento.- Actualmente, no poses ningún cafetín y en estos días van a poner un lugar para impartir clases a jóvenes cerca de su casa y ella ve como una muy buena oportunidad para poder iniciar un nuevo negocio, sin dejar la venta de ropa y espera mejorar sus ingresos.

Silvia, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos como: golosinas, bebidas, refrescos y panes con pollo. Este negocio le permitirá a ella y a su familia mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
El sueño de Silvia, es colocar su propio cafetín y tener variedad de productos a disposición de sus clientes, establecer un buen servicio y atención al cliente.
texts.en:
Silvia, 36 years old, lives with her mother and her two children who are going to school and she only went to school up to the eighth grade. Her mother can only help her with the household tasks and also care for her grandchildren.

Silvia works selling clothing and for some years it has been her source of income. But, she wants to establish a new business, she is thinking of setting up a business. She has a lot of experience in this type of business, before she worked in an eatery and learned its functioning well. Currently, she doesn't have an eatery and soon they will establish a place to teach classes to young people near her house and she sees it as a very good opportunity to be able to begin a new business without neglecting the clothing sales and she hopes to increase her income.

Silvia needs the loan to purchase products such as candies, drinks, soft drinks, and bread with chicken. This business will allow her and her family to improve their living conditions.

Silvia's dream is to establish her own eatery and have a variety of products at the disposal of her customers, establish a good service and customer service.

loans.use: to purchase products such as candies, drinks, soft drinks, and bread with chicken.

loans.name: Wendy Henry

texts.es: Henry es un hombre trabajador que vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus  dos hijos una niña de 12 años y un varón de 15 años de edad a los que cada día busca la manera de brindar lo mejor como padre responsable cada día pone todo su empeño por su familia para que no les falte nada. Henry se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y golosinas, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes. Henry desea construir la parte trasera de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía esta parte de su vivienda está hecha de lámina deteriorada y cartones, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para construir la parte trasera de su vivienda, para brindar protección a su hija.
texts.en: Henry is a hard-working man who lives with his life partner and their two children, a 12-year-old girl and a 15-year-old boy for whom he seeks the means each day to offer the best as a responsible father. Each day he puts forth all his determination so his family doesn't lack anything. Henry works selling fruits, vegetables, and candies, work he has done for 4 years, so he has a large number of customers. Henry wants to build the rear part of his house since, as can be seen in the photo, this part of the house is made of deteriorated metal sheeting and cardboard. So, he asks FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to build the rear part of his house to offer better protection to his daughter.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, nails and wire to build the rear part of his house to offer his daughter better protection.

loans.name: Satya Raj

texts.en:
Satya is a 35 years old man living in Kuika, Sundarbasti in Achham district of far western Nepal.He started his grocery shop, but he is not confident about the future of business. His hours of operation are limited because of lack of electricity. As soon as it gets dark he has to close his shop and so do other near him.
Satya was also appointed as the chairperson of Gairitand micro hydro project, but he himself has to live without electricity. His community has also struggled to afford the operation and maintenance cost of micro-hydro project, so the project has been non-operational for some time.
He wants to take a loan to cover the costs of a nanogrid, a small solar power system that could provide electricity to his shop and 54 nearby households with about 366 people in all. Each shop and household can then pay only a few dollars a month to have electricity, which will improve not only the ability to keep his shop open in the evening but also help the households by having more affordable, cleaner light for cooking and children to study at night.

loans.use: to install a nanogrid to provide electricity to his community

loans.name: Bahkat Bahadur

texts.en:
Bakhat is a 44 year old man living in Binayak, an extremely rural area of Nepal. He spent much of his youth in India, working to make a living, but after many years away from his family, he returned to Nepal and has been struggling to earn a living in Nepal due a lack of electricity.

He works as a social worker and also runs a small grocery shop. His grocery shop and the neighboring shops all suffer from a lack electricity which forces them to 
have to close when it gets dark since they cannot stay open into the evening.

He wants to take a loan to cover the costs of a nano-grid, a small solar power system that could provide electricity to his shop, the neighboring shops and 25 nearby households.  Each shop and household can then pay only a few dollars a month to  have electricity, which will improve not only the ability to keep the shops open into the evening but help the households by having more affordable, cleaner light for cooking and for children to study.

loans.use: to invest a nanogrid to provide electricity to his community.

loans.name: Dharma

texts.en:
Dharma is a shop owner in Accham, a rural area in far western Nepal. He makes and sells footwear in a small shop, but does not have access to electricity. The situation has gotten bad enough that he has to take work in a neighboring village to support himself and his family. The neighboring village has power but when he returns home every night, he and his family have to sit in darkness and it makes him feel he and his family are unlucky.

He wants to take a loan to cover the costs of a nano-grid, a small solar power system that could provide electricity to his shop and 62 nearby households, with about 256 people in all.  Each household can then pay only a few dollars a month to have electricity. He know the benefits of electricity on standard of living, education and 
business from seeing them in the neighboring village and hopes that he can bring these benefits to his community with the nano-grid.

loans.use: to install a solar nano-grid.

loans.name: Chandra

texts.en:
Chandra is 35 and lives in Achham, a rural area in far western Nepal. He is the primary wage earner for a joint household of two families and he supports a total of 10 family members. He does this by running a small hotel, but his hotel doesn’t have access to electricity. His hotel has been financially struggling and he is certain that access to electricity will enable his hotel to be more financially successful.

He wants to take a loan to cover the costs of a nano-grid, a small solar power system that could provide electricity to his hotel and 20 nearby households with about 146 people in all.  Each household can then pay only a few dollars a month to have electricity, which will improve not only the ability to keep his hotel and local shops open into the evening and get more customers but help the households by having more affordable, cleaner light for cooking and having children study.

loans.use: to provide electricity for a hotel and surrounding households.

loans.name: Bhim Bahadur

texts.en:
Bhim is a 55 year old man living in Kirtipur village in Achham district in far west part of Nepal. He spent 20 years of his young life in India as a migrant laborer. He returned back to Nepal-to work as a farmer. He has been financially struggling to earn a living for his family. He was surprised to find the dark nights of his childhood still prevailing in his village due to lack of electricity. His family and surrounding households can get a lot of work done in the evening and also prepare for farming the next day if only they had lights after dark. 
He wants to take a loan to cover the costs of a Nano-grid, a small solar power system that could provide electricity to his family and 18 nearby households with about 140 people in all. Each household can then pay only a few dollars a month to have electricity, which will improve not only the ability to keep his family and other households in lighting and also helps to increase business and social activities.

loans.use: to own and operate a nanogrid to provide clean and affordable electricity to the entire community

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Dalila de 66 años de edad, quien vive de manera humilde junto a sus nietos, una niña de 11 años y un niño de 7 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia en la cual ha vivido desde hace 33 años. La casa en la que habita es humilde pero Dalila se encuentra feliz de poseer un techo bajo el cual poder vivir. Ella es una persona muy humilde, responsable y trabajadora, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, actividad que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logra llevar y de esta manera mantener la economía del hogar y así satisfacer las necesidades básicas de ella y de sus nietos y poco a poco ir tratando de mejorar su calidad de vida. La hija de Dalila, quien es la madre de los dos niños en busca de apoyar a su familia y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos decidió emigrar al extranjero para poder obtener una mejor fuente de ingresos económicos así poder apoyar a su familia. Para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: concentrado, vitaminas y también más pollos para aumentar las ventas y así las ganancias. De esta forma seguir luchando por mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Dalila, 66 years old, lives very simply with her grandchildren, an 11-year-old girl and a 7-year-old boy. She has lived in her own home for 33 years. The house she lives in is humble, but Dalila is happy to have a roof over their heads. She is a very modest person who is responsible and hard-working.

She raises and sells chickens. With hard work and dedication, she manages and maintains the household budget and satisfies her own basic necessities and those of her grandchildren. Little by little, she is trying to improve their quality of life. Dalila's daughter, the mother of the two children, decided to emigrate abroad with the hope of supporting her family and giving them a better life. She did so to achieve a better source of financial income and with that support her family.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in feed concentrate, vitamins and also chickens to increase sales and profits. That way she can continue to strive for a better life.

loans.use: to invest in feed concentrate, vitamins and also more chickens to increase sales.

loans.name: Lami

texts.fr: Avec quatre enfants à sa charge, Lami est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè pour exercer ses activités. Agée de 36 ans, Lami est une marchande de toutes catégories de sacs de friperies. Lami s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans en parcourant dans les quartiers environnant. Lami demande ce crédit pour commander des unités de sacs à main, de sacs à dos et de soutien-gorge en vue de bien vendre et de gagner  une marge bénéficiaire assez élevée pour pouvoir couvrir les charges quotidiennes dont elle éprouve et veiller à ce que les enfants soient dans de bonnes conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Married and raising four children, Lami lives in Agoè in order to run her business. At 36, she sells all sorts of second-hand bags. Lami stocks up on her merchandise twice a month in the market and sells her goods by walking through the streets of the surrounding neighborhoods.

Lami is requesting this loan to order some handbags, backpacks, and bras that she can resell and earn a high enough profit margin to cover her daily expenses and make sure her children experience good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 150 handbags, 10 backpacks, and 100 bras.

loans.name: Ahoefa

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 44 ans, Ahoefa est une femme sans enfant à charge. Habitant à Tokoin, Ahoefa prépare et vend de la pâte bandée appelée « Kom » et le rend à la devanture de son domicile en vue  de bien vendre et d’avoir une bonne rentabilité. Ahoefa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de maïs et des dizaines de poissons congelés, Ahoefa demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat afin de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face à ses besoins personnel.
texts.en:
Aged 44 and married, Ahoefa is a woman with no children. She lives in Tokoin and prepares and sells wrapped dough called « Kom », vending it in front of her house so as to sell a lot and make a good profit.

Ahoefa renews her stocks once a month in the market. So that she can order some bowls of maize and dozens of frozen fish, Ahoefa is requesting this loan to make her purchase and make more income to cover her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy 50 bowls of maize and 15 dozen frozen fish.

loans.name: Olga

texts.fr: Olga est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Ayant deux enfants à charge, Olga se bat  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des plateaux d’œufs. Pour s’approvisionner, Olga se rend six fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers. Pour commander des plateaux d’œufs, Olga nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Olga va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Olga is a married woman, aged 37, who lives in Tokoin. Raising two children, Olga struggles to earn a living by selling trays of eggs. In order to stock up, Olga goes to the market six times a month and resells her wares by walking through the neighborhoods.

Needing to order some trays of eggs, Olga is requesting this loan to finance her restocking. With the profit that will come of this, Olga will be able to help her husband with the family's daily expenses and promote her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 27 trays of eggs.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas es una ciudad muy comercial y además es un sector muy productivo del país, aquí se dan muchos productos agrícolas de exportación; en este sector vive María una señora de 42 años, habita en casa arrendada con sus tres hijos, dos mayores y un pequeño.
María cuenta con negocio propio desde hace varios años atrás; en el centro de la ciudad tiene un local donde da el servicio de belleza, realiza cortes de cabello, tintes, manicure y pedicura; está situada en buen sitio por lo que tiene buena clientela, gracias a este negocio ella ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, sus hijos ya son profesionales. 
María ahora necesita adecuar mejor su local y comprar materia prima, por ello con este crédito podrá hacer posible los arreglos y compra de tintes, keratina, esmaltes y otros, así podrá dar un servicio más eficaz y mejor. Se siente agradecida con KIVA porque con este crédito podrá mejorar la imagen y seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo de los Taschilas in a very commercial city and is a very productive sector of the country. It is here that many of the agricultural products for exportation are grown. Maria lives in this area. She is a 42-year-old woman, who lives in a rented home with her three children, two of which are older and one small child. Maria has had her own business for a few years now. In the center of the city she has a shop where she provides beauty services, hair cuts, hair coloring, manicures and pedicures. She is situated in a good location and because of this has a good clientele. Thanks to this business, she has been able to bring her family forward. Her children are now professionals.

Maria now needs to adapt her shop and purchase prime materials. With this loan it will be possible for her to make the repairs and purchase hair dye, keratin, nail polish, and others. In this way she will be able to provide a more efficient and better service. She is grateful for Kiva because with this loan, she will be able to improve the appearance of her shop and continue growing as a microentrepreneur.

loans.use: to adapt her shop and buy raw material in order to provide a better and more efficient service.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a butcher shop. Violeta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more fish and crabs to sell.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and crabs to sell

loans.name: Elis Marina

texts.es:
Marina es una señora con 49 años de edad, soltera y tiene tres hijos ya mayores de edad. Desde hace 3 años monto su propio negocio, un pequeño almacén donde vende variedad de productos como papelería, bisutería y otros.
Con el fin de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes y de tal manera sus ganancias, Marina solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de variedad de mercancía para todo tipo de personas y también hará algunas reparaciones a su local.
Sus sueño es formalizar su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a sus hijos.
Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante permiten ver en esta persona unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Marina is 49-year-old woman who is single, and has three adult children. Three years ago, she started her own business, a small shop where she sells a variety of products including stationary, costume jewelry and more.

With the goal of improving her sales, increasing her clientele and in this way, increasing her earnings, Marina is asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of a variety of merchandise for all types of people and she will also make some repairs to her shop.

Her dream is to formalize her business and, in the future, leave it for her children. Her positive attitude and her hopes of getting ahead show that this person has an immense desire to better herself and of course, a desire to receive a favorable response to her loan request.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise for all types of people, and also to make some repairs to her shop.

loans.name: Samid

texts.es:
Samid es un hombre soltero con 22 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde.
Los diversos factores que lo han llevado al fracaso en ocasiones anteriores no han sido impedimento para este hombre rendirse y echar sus sueños al olvido.
Su deseo actualmente es montar su propio negocio, una miscelánea, pero como no cuenta con mucho capital de trabajo no ha podido, es por esto que solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en activos fijos, surtido y también adecuación del local.
Su mayor sueño es crecer con su negocio y poder pagar los estudios profesionales.
Sabe que con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva podrá hacer realidad lo que tanto desea.
texts.en:
Samid is a single man who is 22 years old, a hard worker, and very humble. The diverse factors that have caused him to fail in the past have not been an obstacle for this man; it did not cause him to give up or forget his dreams.

His current dream is to start his own business, a general store. But, as he does not have much working capital, he has not been able to. For this reason he is asking for a loan which he will invest in an assortment of fixed assets and also to adapt his shop.

His greatest dream is to grow his business and be able to pay for his professional studies. He knows that with the help of Interactuar and the Kiva lenders, he will be able to make his hopes into reality.

loans.use: to invest in an assortment of fixed assets and also to adapt his shop.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 57 years old and widowed with six children. Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

Daisy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, breads, shampoo, snacks foods and other personal care products.

Daisy has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, breads, shampoo, snacks foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Ma. Lisa

texts.en:
Ma. Lisa is 38 years old, and is married with five children.

Ma. Lisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, spices, soap an other groceries to sell.

Ma. Lisa has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Lisa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, spices, soap an other groceries to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen lives in the suburbs of Karachi. Filled with passion and determination to educate her three children, a daughter and two sons, she runs an embroidery business, a skill she acquired at a very young age.

Embroidery is a common means of earning income, especially for women in Pakistan. A variety of embroidery is done on different types of fabrics from clothes to other household items. Yasmeen has managed to establish her own office where she deals with her clients. Her customers are satisfied with her quality of work and appreciate her talent. She has earned a good reputation only not in the market but also around her family for her hard work and success.

Her future plans are to have a better life style for her family and to have a steady income. She therefore has requested for a loan of PKR 150,000 to buy raw material like fabrics, lace, pearls and a variety of beads, etc. to cater more demand.

She is happy to avail this source of funding and hopes it will pay off.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle.

For this reason, Shagufta has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business

loans.use: to afford the maintenance of an auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Saray Rubiela

texts.es:
Saray es una mujer con 29 años de edad, trabajadora y muy  humilde dedicada a la cría y venta de ganado porcino, un negocio que la ha ayudado a salir de la difícil situación económica por la que estaba pasando después de que quedo sin empleo por varios meses.
Con los ingresos generados esta mujer aporta a su casa para la alimentación y el pago del arriendo.
Trabaja todos los días durante 2 horas.
Se encuentra solicitado un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdas reproductoras, alimentos y vacunas para las mismas. Con esto espera aumentar sus clientes y ser más competitiva en el mercado.
Quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de comprar su vivienda propia y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
Con su aporte esta mujer podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Saray is a 29 year old woman, is hardworking and very humble. She works breeding and selling pigs, a business that has helped her to get out of a difficult financial situation, since it has been some months that she has been without employment.

With the income generated, she contributes to her household food costs and the cost of rent. She works every day for 2 hours. She is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of breeding sows, feed, and vaccines.

With this she hopes to gain more customers and be more competitive in the market. She wants to keep working to achieve her dream of buying her own home and having better financial stability. With your support she will be able to make her dreams a reality, go ahead and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy breeding sows, feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 35 years old, married with three children.

Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, spices, soap and other groceries.

Maricel has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns income from pig fattening.

Maricel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, spices, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen is a 41-year-old married woman with eight children, six of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marigen has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Marigen requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell like cabbage, squash, potatoes, eggplant, beans, carrots,etc.

Marigen has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell like cabbage, squash, potatoes, eggplant, beans, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Johana

texts.es:
Claudia es una señora con 34 años de edad, se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado porcino, un negocio que lo inicio por necesidad económica y del cual obtiene muy buenos ingresos,
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo por que necesita adecuar y ampliar sus cochera, también comprara cerdos y alimento para los mismos.
Quiere seguir trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda pero principalmente pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.

Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante permiten ver en esta persona unas ganas inmensas de superarse y supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 34-year-old woman. She earns a living raising and selling pigs. It is a business that she started out of financial necessity and from which she obtains a very good income. She is now requesting a loan because she needs to adjust and expand her shed, and she will also buy pigs and feed for them.

She wants to keep working until she reaches her dream of improving the conditions of her home, but mainly paying for her children's education because their well-being worries her. Her positive attitude and the desires to get ahead demonstrate in this individual a great willingness to improve herself, and she hopes for a favorable response to her request.

loans.use: to adjust and expand her shed, and to also buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 42 year old, and is a married mother of one child who works hard to support her family. She is a teacher.

Although the family works very hard, it can be cumbersome for her to afford the cost of her education. This loan of $ 800 will allow Rosalina to help her studies and will be put toward university. She will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

Rosalina hopes that in the future they will be happy in the family.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Julio

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre con 30 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo desde hace poco logro montar su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda la cual ubico en la sala de la casa donde reside, con los ingresos generados por esto logra cubrir las necesidades básicas que su hogar amerita.
Trabaja todos los días durante 12 horas.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual abastecerá su negocio de alimentos como arroz, aceite, azúcar, sal, panela y otros.
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que esta no se encuentra en buen estado.
Con su aporte este hombre podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en: Pedro is a 30-year-old man. With a lot of effort, a little while ago he was able to establish his own business: a small store that he set up in the living room of his house. With the income that he generates from this, he is able to cover the basic needs of his household. He works every day for 12 hours. He is requesting a loan to stock his business with food such as rice, oil, sugar, salt, raw cane sugar, and other items. His greatest dream is to improve the conditions of his home, since it is not in good shape. With your contribution this man will be able to make his dreams a reality. Let's go - make a loan.

loans.use: to stock his business with food such as rice, oil, sugar, salt, raw cane sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Eliodora

texts.es:
Eliodora es una señora con 34 años de edad, ella desde su casa se dedica a la venta de artesanías como sombreros, forros, cojines, bolsos, tapetes y otros, una actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, quien se dedicaba a lo mismo. Este negocio lo inicio por necesidad económica, al ver como su situación económica desmejoraba poco a poco por falta de empleo. 
Sus ventas siempre habían sido muy altas, pero ahora debido al alto costo de la mercancía y la competencia en el sector, estas han bajado mucho, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprará productos de artesanía los cuales venderá a buen precio.
Quiere abrir su primer local, ofrecer nuevos productos y llegar a generar empleo.
Su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa y una buena estabilidad económica.
Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva, sabe que de la mano de estos sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Eliodora is a 34-year-old woman who sells handicrafts, such as hats, covers, pillows, purses, area rugs and other items, from her home. She learned the business thanks to her father, who was in the same line of work. She started the business out of financial necessity, because she saw how her financial situation was getting worse little by little because she was unemployed.

Her sales had always been very high, but lately, due to the high cost of the merchandise and competition in the field, they have gone down a lot. This is why she is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy handicrafts that she will sell at a good price.

She wants to open her first store, offer new products and eventually generate employment. Her biggest dream is to have her own home and financial stability. For that, she is depending on the help of Interactuar and the Kiva collaborators; she knows that making her dreams a reality is in their hands.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts that she will sell at a good price.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en: Saltanat is a polite and wonderful woman who lives in Jomi district. She is 46 years old. For 10 years she has engaged in sewing. She sews national women`s dresses and sells them. She likes her job and wants to improve it. As her current sewing machine is old it is difficult for her to sew. For this reason she wants to purchase a modern sewing machine.  That is why Saltanat submits an application for loan. Saltanat is a hardworking woman and she believes that with your support she can expand her activity and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Vilma Graciela

texts.es: Vilma es una mujer trabajadora de 34 años de edad habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos en casa de su propiedad. Vilma se gana la vida con su venta de hielo, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación y de la que obtiene muy buenos ingresos ya que tiene una gran demanda en su comunidad. Vilma desea mejorar el piso del corredor de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía este se encuentra agrietado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena y grava para mejorar el piso del corredor que se encuentra agrietado.
texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking woman 34 years of age. She lives with her partner and three children in her own home. She works selling ice, a job she does in her home and from which she obtains a very good income, since she has a large demand in her community.

She would like to repair the floor of the walkway of her home, since, as seen in the photo, it is cracked. For this, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy floor tiles, cement, sand, and gravel to repair the cracked walkway floor.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles, cement, sand, and gravel to repair a cracked floor.

loans.name: Genalyne

texts.en:
Genalyne is 27 years old and is a single mother of one child. She owns and manages her own piggery business. She raises pigs and sells them in the market. She's earning a good living from this activity. She is able to support the needs of her child as well as their household expenses.

Genalyne wants to improve her business by expanding it and decided to ask for financial assistance from GMDPC. She joined and gained access to GDMPC and recently, Genalyne took a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to purchase feeding supplies and additional piglets to raise in order to supply more meat in the market.

She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family through her piggery business.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 43 years old and is married with four children.

Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, noodles, spices, bread and etc .

Maricel has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns income from pig fattening.

Maricel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, drinks, noodles, spices, bread and etc

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old and single with one child. Sandra works very hard to provide for her family.

Sandra runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, spices, milk, drinks, bread, and snack foods.

Sandra has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Sandra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, spices, milk, drinks, bread, and snack foods.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino con 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa, en el distrito de Aramango, provincia de Bagua, departamento de Amazonas, país Perú, en una zona rural. Marcelino cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Marcelino se dedica al cultivo de café, variedad catimor. El préstamo solicitado lo utilizará para invertir en el mantenimiento y compra de abonos del cultivo. Esta inversión le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias de esta manera mejorar su condición económica y por ende mejores condiciones de vida.

Marcelino es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 54 years old, and he lives with his wife in his own home made of rustic material in the Aramango district in the Bagua province in the department of the Amazonas in Peru, in a rural zone. Marcelino has very good personal and work references on behalf of the inhabitants of the area. The inhabitants of this location earn livings mostly through agriculture, trade, and cattle raising.

Marcelino earns a living growing coffee of the catimor variety. He will use the requested loan to invest in maintenance and to buy plant fertilizers. This investment will allow him to obtain greater earnings and thus improve his financial condition and ultimately better his living conditions. Marcelino is a recurrent member of the institution Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance and to buy plant fertilizers.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is a 50-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Sherlita has a buy and sell crabs business in the Philippines. Sherlita requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more crabs to sell to her customers.

Sherlita has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more crabs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Swelyn

texts.en:
Swelyn is 58 years old, married with three children.

Swelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, breads, shampoo, snacks foods and other personal care products.

Swelyn has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Swelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, breads, shampoo, snacks foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

She supplements this income with earnings from her coconut palm making.

Leonor dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, utilizo el crédito anterior para poder mejorar el inventario de su negocio, el impacto ha sido favorable para su economía y tiene más clientes satisfechos.
