Opta por un nuevo crédito por la facilidad de recursos para adquirir producto al mayoreo, en esta oportunidad comprara dulces, gaseosas, jugos, quesos, cereales, etc., incluirá nuevos productos para satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes, espera que sus ganancias incrementen.
texts.en:
Ana used the previous loan to improve her business inventory. This had a positive impact on her profits, and she has more satisfied customers.

She is applying for a new loan to have the resources to buy products at wholesale; this time she will purchase candies, soft drinks, juices, cheeses, cereals, etc., and new products to satisfy her customers' demands, with the hope that her earnings will increase.

loans.use: to purchase candy, soft drinks, juices, cheese, cereals, etc., and new products to satisfy customer demand

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old, married, and has four children who are currently in school.

Gladys is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gladys requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gladys has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gladys would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evaline works hard to support her family.

She has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish. Evaline is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cement, sand and gravel and to pay her laborers' salaries.

Evaline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cement, sand and gravel and to pay her laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is business woman and she has very high interest in doing business; she has been involved in business activities since 2010 and she makes her best on it. She is earning good money but she still wants to improve her business so she takes a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more additional items to keep in her store including coffee, sugar, oil, candles, sardines, salt, slippers, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell. She is very happy with her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, oil, candles, sardines, salt, slippers, soft drinks, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Silvano

texts.en:
Silvano is a 29 year-old, married father of two who works hard to support his family. He is a government staffer and his wife is housewife.

Even though the family works very hard, it can be cumbersome for them to afford the cost of their brother's education. This loan of $600 will allow Silvano to help his brother continue his studies in junior high school. He will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

In the future, Silvano hopes that his brothers are all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Geines Fadul

texts.es:
Geines es un hombre con 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos menores y vive en  municipio Sampués desde  hace poco, por falta de empleo, se dedica a cría y venta de animales, con esto ha logrado superar la situación económica tan difícil por la que tuvo que pasar.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de carneros, alimento y vacunas para los mismos.
Su deseo es continuar con este trabajo y que en un futuro pertenezca a sus hijos.
La adversidad que lo ha perseguido n o ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños. Se le debe apoyar.
texts.en:
Geines is a 42-year-old man. He has three children who are minors and he recently moved to the Sampués municipality. Because he does not have a job, he makes a living by raising and selling animals. By doing this, he has been able to overcome the difficult economic situation that he had to go through.

Currently, he is requesting a loan that he will invest by buying rams, as well as food and vaccines for the rams. His dream is to continue with this work and that in the future he can pass it down to his children. The adversity that has followed him has not kept him from wanting to get ahead and accomplish his goals. He deserves support.

loans.use: to buy rams, as well as food and vaccines for the rams.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita, 33, is the married mother of three children. She works hard to support her family. She is a teacher, and her husband works in agriculture. Although the family works very hard, they do not earn enough to afford the cost of their daughter’s education. This loan of $1,000 will enable Rosita to help her daughter graduate from senior high school and continue to university. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks and school supplies. Rosita loves her daughter very much and hopes that further education will help them have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks and school supplies.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is the age of 35, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fan, washing machine, and troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He sells electrical components as well over his shop such as bulbs, switches, sockets, etc.

He wants to buy new inventories for his shop but does not have the amount to buy new inventory. Therefore, Rehana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be empowered to buy his desired inventory.

Rehana thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new inventory such as bulbs, switches, sockets, etc. for her husband's electrical shop.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel es un hombre de 37 años que vive en la localidad rural de Talamolle Viejo, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él trabaja como obrero de construcción y también se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por alfalfa orgánica que él mismo cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para comprar una vaca orgánica, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder comprar más ganado y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 37, lives in Talamolle Viejo, a rural area that is in Moquegua. He works as a construction worker, and he also raises organic cows. He pays a lot of attention to their care and the feed he provides them with. Their feed is comprised of alfalfa, which he grows himself.

He is requesting a microloan to buy an organic cow. He hopes that the milk will be sold for a better price because it is organic.

In the future he hopes to be able to buy more livestock and to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy an organic cow.

loans.name: Bulti

texts.en:
Bulti is an enterprising woman of 24 years from a small village of Falakata in the district of Alipurduar, West Bengal. She is married and a mother of two sons and a daughter; her sons are students of grades 6 and 4, and her daughter is a toddler. They are from a humble family, but scarce in economic resources. Her husband is engaged in a grill-cutting business. Due to low income, Bulti is unable to manage her family expenses properly.

Besides being a housewife, Bulti is involved with her animal husbandry. She rears cows and then sells milk at the local market. Sometimes, for earning more money, she also sells the cow dung, which is used as manure for farming in the rural areas.

Now she wants to upgrade her business, but money is the main problem for her. Thus, she is seeking a loan to buy another cow from BJS, a Kiva partner. She hopes that this loan will give a boost to her business, and she can upgrade her financial status with the profit from her business as well.

She dreams to build a concrete house in the future with the profit from her business. She gives her heartiest thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow for enhancing her business.

loans.name: Jeva

texts.en:
Jeva is a 27-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jeva has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jeva requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and shrimp to sell to her customers.

Jeva has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and shrimp to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling charcoal and selling lumber.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm.

Maricel has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Maricel is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Adelaida María

texts.es: Adelaida es habitante de Malambo un municipio del Atlántico donde funciona su negocio de Droguería, ella es una emprendedora de 46 años dedicada a la comercialización de medicamentos; en cumplimiento con las disposiciones legales vigentes en Colombia estudió y obtuvo la certificación en manejo de droguería y farmacia y desde hace 5 años organizó un local comercial en su casa, aprovechando que el sector no existía este tipo de negocio. Sus clientes son los vecinos y transeúntes del sector y trabaja en el horario de 8:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m. Adelaida requiere incrementar sus inventarios con una mayor variedad de medicamentos de uso frecuente, para lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su visión es fortalecer día a día su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Adelaida lives in Malambo, a town in Atlántico, where she has a drugstore. She is a 46 year old entrepreneur working in the sale of medicines. In compliance with the current legal provisions in Colombia, she studied and obtained a certification in drugstore and pharmacy management.

For 5 years she has had a business in her home, making the most of the lack of this type of business in her area. Her customers are her neighbors and passers-by in the area. She works on a schedule from 8:00am to 9:00pm.

She needs to stock her inventory with a wider variety of frequently-used medications, for which she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her vision is to strengthen her business day by day and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her inventory with a greater variety of medicines.

loans.name: Shaela Mae

texts.en:
Shaela Mae works hard to support her family. Shaela Mae is single with two children and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Shaela Mae has been in this business for 4 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Shaela Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, bamboo and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Fely works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fish vending. Fely is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more nipa to sell.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa to sell

loans.name: Fausto Antonio

texts.es:
Fausto, es un señor que vive solo, no tiene hijos que dependan directamente de él, hace mucho tiempo tenía un empleo como maestro de Educación Física, posteriormente una hermana le cedió un microbús para ofrecer el servicio de transporte de alumnos, desarrolla esta actividad desde hace 15 años, es así como él puede subsistir.
Con el crédito podrá comprar llantas nuevas, cambiar la tapizaría y pagar los costos de renovación de la documentación necesaria para continuar trabajando, considera que su unidad de transporte será más segura y cómoda para sus clientes, tiene la fe de tener mejores ingresos para respaldar el pago de su deuda.
Su sueño es lograr comprar otro unidad de transporte para tener un mejor equipo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Fausto lives alone. He does not have children that are directly dependent upon him. A long time ago he had a job as a physical education teacher. After that, his sister gave him a minibus in order to provide students with transportation service. He has been engaged in this business activity for 15 years. This is the way that he is able to survive.

With the loan he will be able to buy new tires, change the upholstery, and pay the expenses of renewing the documents needed to continue working. He thinks that his transportation vehicle will be safer and more comfortable for his customers. He believes he will have better earnings to sustain the repayment of his debt.

His dream is to manage to buy another transportation vehicle in order to have better work equipment.

loans.use: to buy new tires, to change the upholstery, and to pay the expenses for renewing the paperwork that is needed to continue working.

loans.name: Pallabi

texts.en:
26-year-old Pallabi lives in the small village of Falakata in the Alipurduar district of West Bengal. She is a young housewife, who lives with her husband and two lovely sons in their own house. One son is in grade 4 and the other is a preschooler. Her husband, Gopal, is the sole breadwinner of the family. He is engaged in vegetable cultivation. He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells his harvest in the local market. Sometimes he also does some carpentry work in his spare time for additional income. Apart from covering household expenses, he does end up compromising on meeting his family’s needs.

In spite of Gopal's laborious efforts, he fails to meet his family’s needs due to the rapidly growing costs of daily essential commodities. So, to earn more, he has decided to cultivate cauliflower on his farmland. For the upcoming winter season, the cultivation of cauliflower has to be started very soon. There is a great demand in his locality.

To help her husband, Pallabi seeks a loan from Kiva through Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS). With the loan, Pallabi will purchase necessary farm supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides, etc., for cauliflower cultivation to grow their business and earn more to ensure financial stability for her family’s well-being. She expresses her gratitude towards her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm supplies for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Tapasi

texts.en:
Tapasi is 36 years old. She is a rural housewife who is busy with her daily household chores. She lives in a village of Falakata, West Bengal, with her husband and a son. Her son is studying in grade 10 in a nearby village school.

Tapasi’s husband runs a general store in their locality. He sells various food items like cakes, biscuits, snacks, chocolates, etc., and mouth refreshers like chewing gums, chewing masala, pan, etc.

In her free time, Tapasi also helps her husband in running the store smoothly. They have been running this business for the past five years. This is the only source of income of the family.

With the price hike of essential commodities, they are facing problems to manage their household expenses as well as the educational cost of their only son. Now they need to expand their business. They want to add varieties of items in their stock so that they can be able to satisfy the needs of more customers. But they have a lack of funds to invest, so as a responsible lady, Tapasi seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

They will utilize the loan to purchase varieties of stationery items at a wholesale rate for more sales. This investment will help them to expand their business for upgrading her family economy as well as their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her husband’s stationery shop.

loans.name: Margarita Delmy

texts.es: Margarita cuenta con 58 años de edad y habita junto a su grupo familiar en casa de su propiedad desde hace 40 años, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con un lugar propio en el cual vivir. Margarita se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, actividad que realiza desde hace 30 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia cuenta con una gran calidad de clientes, además vende productos de belleza por catálogo. Margarita desea invertir en materiales para su taller de costura, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: telas, hilos, botones, broches y productos de belleza para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Margarita is 58 years old and has lived with her family in her own house for 40 years. She is happy that she is able to have her own place in which to live.

She works making garments, work that she has been doing for 30 years. Thanks to her experience she has a large number of customers. She also sells beauty products by catalog.

She would like to purchase materials for her sewing workshop, for which she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in fabric, thread, buttons, clothespins, and beauty products to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, clothespins, and beauty products to improve her sales.

loans.name: Chanty

texts.en:
Chanty is a 19-year-old single freshman who is from the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in engineering at a university in the city. Chanty’s family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which make it hard to pay for his tuition fees.

Due to the fact that Chanty is short of the finances to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. For his dreams, he hopes to find a proper job with a decent salary, so he also wants to save money to build her own house and if he gets children he wants his children to study university as well.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year for his BSc in Engineering
